loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena N., 50, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, a driver.  Together they work hard for a safe and secure future for themselves and their family.

Elena operates a meat business. Live pigs or meat are bought directly from hog raisers. The live pigs are then slaughtered, and then the meat is sold to members of the immediate community. Elena has many patrons who buy the cut meat and then sell it from their respective market stalls. There are many patrons who prefer Elena’s products because they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. It is also a little cheaper to buy meat from an independent meat shop than the ones in the market who sometimes use the services of professional slaughterhouses for their meat. The cost of slaughter is added to the final price of the cut meat and passed along to the customers. Thus, Elena has many patrons who regularly anticipate her meat. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of $10 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy live pigs to be slaughtered and sold every day. She also will invest a portion of the loan to buy pork, poultry and beef from other raisers.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Elena hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day, and be finished with their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy live pigs to be slaughtered and sold every day, and also to buy pork, poultry and beef from other raisers

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im L., 30, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, where she earns a living raising pigs and farming her own land. She has been running this business since 2001, and it has provided her with income to attain her present standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband who is a firewood seller. This couple has four children, all single and living under her roof. The harvest season is coming but Im L. doesn’t harvested her mature rice yet. So Im L. will use her loan to hire laborers to harvest her rice crop.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest rice crop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 58 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweeds to the market.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gloria from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Nine people are forming a village bank loan. They are located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. The other members selected Mrs. Leng P., a 31-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. 

Mrs. Leng P. and her husband, Mr. Dul SoK., have two children. One is attending a local school and the younger is 3 years old.
 
They are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land that they use to cultivate rice, peanuts and vegetables for selling to support the family. 

With this farming, they still earn less income than they need to improve their lives. So, Mrs. Leng P. would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig food. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family’s condition.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana tiene 49 años de edad, tiene seis hijo y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Luciana nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de tortas y gelatinas, ella nos cuenta que vende de forma ambulatoria en el paradero de los buses que llegan de la ciudad de Calca, ella sube a los buses y ofrece sus productos a los  pasajeros, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, refrescos y muchas cosas más.  
     
Luciana pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luciana is 49 years old, has six children, and lives in the city of Pisaq in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco, Peru.

She says that she sells cakes and gelatins. Luciana sells her products as a street vendor at the bus station that receives the traffic from the city of Calca. She boards the buses in order to offer her products to the passengers. Therefore, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as sugar, soft drinks, and many other items.

Luciana belongs to the Communal Bank “Mosoq Ñusta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Luis Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr R. labora como Higienista es soltero, tiene tres persona al su cargo  es el No. 3 del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  le ha dado esta institución con  este  desembolso para complementar la  comprar de un terreno, ya que me encuentro posando y para poderle un techo a mi familia.
texts.en: Mr. R. works as a janitor. He is single and he has three individuals in his care. He has had 3 past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and he is thankful for the support granted to him by this organization. This loan will be used to purchase an additional stretch of land and to give his family a roof over their head.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rosalie Rasonable Group's

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie R. is from the Barangay of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Rosalie is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). While both members of the group would receive an individual loan, they would be collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if one of them is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosalie R.’s Group.

Rosalie is a married, 35-year-old woman who is blessed with one school-age child. To earn a living, she is engaged in the agriculture industry. Specifically, she produces seaweed (locally known as guso) for re-sale purposes. She has been engaged in this line of business for five years, and she typically earns an average of no less than 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2011, Rosalie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. By doing so, she hopes to be better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Rosalie is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. She is now requesting her first loan through PMP, in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which would be used to finance production of her guso. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her family's living conditions. For instance, she would like to use the additional revenue to meet their family's basic needs, save for the future, repay the loan, and expand her business.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model

loans.use: To expand her guso (seaweed) production

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a resident and farmer in his native town of Kisii in  Nyanza Province, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with five children, four adults and one still schooling. He is aged 60 years and has been in mixed farming for over ten years, producing tea, cabbages, and bananas with the help of two farmhands. His produce is sold to Kenya Tea Development Authority and at the local market. 

Dominic has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of the cow will improve his income and help him educate his last child as well as provide the farm with natural fertilizer. He is focusing on having four quality dairy cows in the near future to commercialize his farm.

He says he is glad that Juhudi provides loans which have had great impact on farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tienen un hijo en edad escolar.  Carlos y su familia viven en el distrito de Chepén perteneciente al departamento de La Libertad, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.  Chepén se caracteriza por la gente trabajadora de habita en él.
Él se dedica al alquiler y venta de cd’s desde hace 3 años.  Esta actividad la realiza en su mismo domicilio, en donde su conviviente lo apoya.  Carlos y su familia son muy conocidos.  A la fecha tienen clientela muy fidelizada.  Los ingresos que perciben en esta actividad es utilizado en la educación de su hijo y solventar gastos los gastos diversos.
Carlos desea comprar más cd’s para poder venderlos posteriormente y así poder obtener más ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old, has a live-in partner and one child who attends school. Carlos and his family live in the district of Chepén, in the La Libertad region, an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Chepén is known for its hard-working people.
Carlos has sold and rented out CDs for three years. He works from home, where his partner helps him. Carlos and his family are well known and they currently have very loyal customers. The income they earn goes towards paying for their child’s education and covering their various expenses.
Carlos would like to buy more CDs for resale in order to generate more income. This is why he has requested a 1500 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase CDs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa M. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Marissa joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional groceries to sell. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Hotensiah

texts.en:
Hotensia has been operating her clothes shop in Naivasha town for the last two years.  She is 43 years old and is a single mother of three children.

Hotensia was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Hotensiah hopes to grow her shop into a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and married to John who contributes to the family income. Jane has a knitting shop, which she has been running for a period of about 4 years, with an income of 12,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is the second loan Jane is receiving from KADET, after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy knitting threads and other accessories so that she will be able to knit more items, like cardigans. She hopes to own a big knitting shop and create employment for other people.

loans.use: to buy knitting threads and other accessories.

loans.name: Rose Efua

texts.en: Rose makes gari, a dish made from a deep rooted vegetable called cassava. She also sells kako, a type of salted fish cut into pieces for resale.  She sells her food in Elmina. Rose Efua has received a senior high level of education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She responsibly assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava and kako for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a food stand. In the picture, she is cutting the kako into pieces. Behind her are a few tubers of cassava.

loans.use: buy cassava and kako

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with four children who all go to school. She does not have additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes in Bwaise, a Kampala suburb. She has been in business for the last 8 years and works six days a week. She sells her clothes at the market.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality. Jalia resides in her own house where her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Merie Cris

texts.en:
Merie Cris is a married woman and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 38 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Merie Cris has a small market at home to earn a living. She sells assorted food products like food in pouches, coffee, milk in sachets, sugar and canned goods. She supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for five years. She earns a monthly total of PHP 3,000 doing this activity. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Merie Cris has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Merie Cris hopes to add a new retail shop in the market and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nahun Arturo

texts.es:
Nahún, viven en su propia casa con su esposa y dos hijas de 4 y 7 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy joven inicio la siembra de maíz y frijol y hoy en día este trabajo es el que le sustenta a su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono y pago de mano de obra, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para fortalecer el cultivo y este se desarrolle para que la producción sea abundante.
Su objetivo como agricultor es mantener el cultivo de maíz con una buena cosecha, comercializar una parte de ella y que también le sirva para la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Nahún lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters who are 4 and 7 years of age.  He is a farmer.  Since a young age he started planting corn and beans and today this is the work that supports his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy manure and to pay labor costs.  This loan will be a big help to him to strengthen his crop so that it will develop and production will be abundant.

His objective as a farmer is to keep his corn crops producing good harvests to sell part of it and the rest of it serve as food for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Marta Luz de treinta y ocho años de edad posee una tienda en su residencia, es la más surtida de productos de buena calidad en la zona; ella se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan a precios bajos y con un servicio excelente. Marta es una mujer muy activa se levanta desde muy temprano a trabajar  ya que  su lema es al que madruga Dios le ayuda, siempre está adelante de la competencia y necesita surtirse de nuevos productos es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, granos básicos, bebidas, embutidos, pan, productos instantáneos entre otros así siempre satisfacera el gusto del cliente. Marta Luz tiene la confianza que con su trabajo lograra darle a su familia una vida plena
texts.en:
Marta Luz is 38 years old, and operates a store in her home. It has the best selection of good quality products in the area. She has a lot of customers because she always has what people need, at low prices and with excellent service. Marta is a very energetic woman. She gets up very early to work, since her motto is, "God helps the one who gets up early".  

She is always ahead of her competition and needs to stock up with new products. That's why she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy candy, basic grains, beverages, sausages, bread, instant products, and other things. In this way she will always satisfy the tastes of the customer.  Marta Luz is confident that with her work she will succeed in giving her family a full life.

loans.use: candy, basic grains, beverages, sausages, bread, instant products

loans.name: Reiner

texts.es: Reiner, tiene la edad 36 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y una hija. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de almacigo de café. El cuenta con una plantación de almacigo de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener un mejor almacigo. El quiere obtener una buena plantación  para vender un almacigo de café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de siembra y venta de almacigo de café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Reiner, aged 36, is married and lives with his wife and one daughter.

With the loan he plans to help his coffee plantation.  He has a coffee plantation, and plans to invest in supplies such as manure, labor and fungicides in order to get a better plantation.  He wants to have a good plantation to sell quality coffee.  He wants to generate a greatear amount of earnings for his well-being and that of his family.

This is his first loan that he has received through FODECOSUR.  He had not taken other loans previously from the state banks, but FODECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: supplies such as manure, labor and fungicides in order to get a better plantation.

loans.name: Linda Vista Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama Linda Vista  porque asi se llama la colonia donde viven los integrantes de este grupo, ademas por que es muy llamativo el nombre. Este grupo está conformado por 15 integrantes.

El representante D. grupo se llama susana tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio la preparatoria, es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 6 años de edad que estudia la primaria, ella y su familia viven en una zona cañera, ya que alli se encuentra el Ingenio de Constancias. Ella nos platica que desde poco mas de 5 años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de tienda de Abarrotes ya que como su hija era pequeña y tenia que darle mas atencion y asi poder pagar  los gastos de su hogar y ofrecerle a sus hija una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña susana realiza  sus ventas desde su casa, ella ha habierto un pequeño local en un esacio de su casa  y alli pone sus productos que tiene a la venta para que sus clientes hagan sus compras, tambien nos cuenta que trata de tener bien surtido su negocio para que sus  clientes encuentren todo lo que buscan y asi queden  satisfecho y dia a dia pueda tener mas clientes.
Ella necesita este credito para la compra de jabon en polvo, jabon de baño, cloro, detergente, arroz, frijol, galletas, dulces, refrescos, cereales, leche, aceite, jabon de bañarse y jugos para surtir su tienda y posteriormente realizar sus ventas.

Doña susana espera que con este credito su negocio prospere y cresca para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ademas de que se encuentra muy contenta por la oportunidad que le a ofrecido Fundación Realidad.

Los demas integrantes se llaman:

Irma-zapatos
Adela-abarrotes
Lucia-ropa
Ofelia-abarrotes
Soledad-ropa
Juan Manuel-cultivo de maiz
lina-zapatos
Nancy-joyeria
Abigal-cosmeticos
Norma-calzado
Maria Julia-abarrotes
Nidia-antojitos
Gemma-molino
Alejandra-ropa
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Linda Vista," because this is the name of the neighborhood where the members of the group live, and also it is a very attractive name.  This communal bank contains 15 members.

Susana is the representative of this group, and she is 33 years old.  She has a high school education, and is the single mother of a 6 year-old daughter who is in elementary school.  She and her family live in an area known for growing sugar cane, near the Ingenio de Costancias sugar refinery.  She tells us that a little more than 5 years ago she decided to start her own business, a grocery store, because her daughter was young and she needed to give her more attention, and also because in this way she could pay the household bills and offer her daughter a better quality of life.

Susana makes her sales from her house. She has a small store that she set up in a part of her house where she puts her products for sale and where her customers can make their purchases.  In addition, she tells us that she tries to keep the business well-stocked so that her customers will find everything they are looking for.  This way her customers will leave satisfied, and each day she will have more customers

She needs this loan to buy powdered soap, bath soap, bleach, detergent, rice, beans, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, cereals, milk, cooking oil, and juices to stock her store so that later she can make her sales.

Susana hopes that with this loan her business will prosper and grow so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.   She is very happy with the opportunity that being provided to her by Fundación Realidad.  

The other members of the communal bank are:

Irma- who sells shoes
Adela- who sells groceries
Lucia-who sells clothing
Ofelia-who sells groceries
Soledad- who sells clothing
Juan Manuel-who cultivates corn
lina- who sells shoes
Nancy-who sells jewelry
Abigal-who sells cosmetics
Norma-who sells shoes
Maria Julia-who sells groceries
Nidia-who sells snacks
Gemma - who has a mill
Alejandra-who sells clothing

loans.use: to sell groceries

loans.name: Koko

texts.en: Koko is married and lives with their five children in the village of Jukwa in Ghana’s Central Region. For the past 15 years Koko has worked selling baked bread. Koko will use the loaned money to buy flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients. After supporting her family, she hopes to use the remaining profits to reinvest back into her business to sustain her work and strive for further growth.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Allen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero Region of Uganda. For the past two years, Allen has been working hard to manage her clinic, which provides testing and treatment services. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock up on medicine, and will help Allen to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to continue her education and become a nurse. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Allen's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for new medicine

loans.name: Liliana Janeth

texts.es:
Liliana de 26 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre piensa positivamente en el futuro de sus hijos.
A pesar de que su marido no le guste que ella trabaje, ella ah sabido manifestarle que el dinero que gana el no es suficiente para mantener a la familia.

Ella es una vendedora de cosméticos que vende productos  como: perfumes, cremas, desodorante, etc.

El problema de ella es el sector donde vive  ya que es de difícil  acceso para llegar a su vivienda.
Solicita este préstamo para invertir más en su venta de cosmético y que su negocio incremente.

El sueño de ella es terminar su casa y apoyar a su esposo en la economía del hogar.
texts.en: Liliana, 26, is a very hardworking woman who always thinks positively in the future of her children.  Despite her husband not liking her to work, she’s known how to show him that what he earns isn’t enough to support the family.  She sells cosmetics; she sells such things as perfume, creams, deodorants, etc.  Her problem is that access to her house in the area where she lives is difficult.  She’s asking for this loan to invest more in her cosmetics sales so that the business will grow.  Her dream is to finish her house and help her husband with household economy.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Melina Narcisa

texts.es:
Melina de 29 años, vive en una zona llamada “Duran”.
Inicio el negocio de elaboración de bocaditos y buffet hace 5 años, comenzó preparando bocaditos para la familia y al darse cuenta que lo hacia rico, decidió ponerse un local de venta de bocaditos.
La actividad la realiza sola, desde las 6:00am hasta las 1:00pm.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y la entrega de bocaditos, ya que no tiene ninguna clase de vehículo para movilizarse.
Es casada, el esposo trabaja en Ingeniero de electricista.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como: harina, horno, azúcar, huevos, carnes, etc.
Su sueño es expandir su local a otros locales en otro sector de la urbe.
texts.en:
Melina is 29 and lives in the area known as "Duran".  She began her snack business five years ago and started by preparing snacks for the family.  Upon realizing that she was doing a good job she decided to set up a snack shop.

She works alone from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.  The difficulty she is up against is delinquency and delivery of the products, since she has no vehicle to get around.  

She is married and her husband works as an electric engineer.  The loan she is requesting is to buy goods such as flour, sugar, eggs, meat, an oven, etc.

Her dream is to expand the business by setting up other shops in the town.

loans.use: To buy goods such as flour, sugar, eggs, meat, an oven, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 7 children, 4 of whom are enrolled in school while the others are still too young for school. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Fatuma has operated a retail shop for the past 9 months. Her potential clients are local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Kuru Orbana Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in a village called Kolisuku, in northern Sierra Leone, fifty-five-year-old Marie is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer and two of her children are in college. The rest are no longer attending schools.

For over twenty years now, Marie has been selling rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), groundnuts, etc. Marie and her group members have applied for a loan of 800,000 SLL for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Marie will use her share of the loan to expand her business; she will buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, etc. wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, etc. wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 46-year-old hardworking lady. She is married to Emad, an engineer, and has three sons and daughters. Lina is also a teacher in an elementary school. Because Lina is a conservative person, she has asked her husband Emad to appear in the photo.

Almost 3 months ago, Lina opened a mini-market with her husband's help to add another source of income for the family. The mini-market's hours start after one of them gets back from their first full-time job. Although the mini-market is not open all day, it has already gained a lot of customers because of the products they sell and the good location. They are now thinking of the best way to manage the mini market hours, so it can be open all day to serve as many customers as possible. Until they find a solution, Lina has applied for this loan to buy more products so they won’t run out of items in the store.

loans.use: to buy more products for their mini market

loans.name: Koreta

texts.en:
Koreta is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Foailalo.  She is married and has five children.  To make a living, Koreta owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Koreta has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Koreta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  This will be Koreta's first loan from SPBD.  Koreta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Lucinda De Los Santos

texts.es: Lucinda de los Santos de sesenta y uno años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un molino de nixtamal con el que presta servicio en la zona donde reside además se dedica a la venta de maíz, es muy conocida en la localidad pues el servicio es muy bueno y los clientes siempre quedan satisfechos además los precios y la calidad del trabajo es excelente; Lucinda es una mujer muy activa, siempre trabajando duro para forjarse un futuro mejor, para ella el  éxito se obtiene solo con pensamiento firme y seguro de saber lo que se quiere llegar a ser, Lucinda está segura de su meta es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita dar mantenimiento al molino y para la compra de maíz por mayor y otros. Lucinda de los Santos tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Lucinda de los Santos is 61 and lives with her husband and children. She has a corn grinder that she allows others in the neighborhood to use and she also sells corn.  She is well-known in her area and many people seek out her services and corn, as she sells at a good price and the quality of her product is excellent.  Lucinda is very active and works hard to improve her quality of life and succeed through personal determination.  Lucinda seeks this credit from INTEGRAL to carry out maintenance for her corn grinder and to buy a wholesale quantity of corn. Lucinda de los Santos has great faith in a better future for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a wholesale quantity of corn

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 49 years old, married, has four children, and is from Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Joy has a business raising pigs. Joy has been raising livestock for one year & three months and she earns 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Joy is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Joy wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 45 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business selling spare parts in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase wheels and tires. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and tires to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 

Ailyn has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ailyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Angoritas 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS DE 25 DE JULIO” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado. Tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, artesanía, transporte público.

La señora Julia,  indica que es el primer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una de las promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá la agencia distribuidora, por mayor, y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación y salud.

En la fotografía no aparese la señora Carmen, ya que ella tuvo que incorporarse inmediatamente a su fuente laboral.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Angoritas de 25 de Julio" will take their second loan with Pro Mujer. The group is part of the Andes regional office and is made up of eight members. It is run by a board headed by Julia. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are fish sales, blanket weaving, vegetable sales, handicrafts, and public transport. 

Julia states that this is her first year working with Pro Mujer and she came to the institution through the invitation of one of the facilitators. Currently she has a handicrafts business that she has worked in for years. 

The loan she is taking now will be used to increase her capital (purchasing wool) which she will get from the distribution agency at wholesale. After making her items she will sell them from her home. This for of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and health.

Carmen is not pictured in the photograph as she had to had leave immediately for work.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Alexandra Rosario

texts.es: La cliente vive en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició con la venta de productos de la línea Avon, luego diversificó su mercadería y decidió vender ropa también.  Trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo, de 8 am a 6 pm.  Es casada y su esposo se desempeña como taxista.  Tiene hijos, pero ya son mayores de edad.  Le gustaría a futuro poder tener su propio local en su domicilio.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, camisetas y shorts para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Yusula's Group

texts.en:
Yusula is a 44-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual. She is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Yusula has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Yusula described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Yusula’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maryori Yanitza

texts.es:
Maryori es una joven de 24 años de edad,soltera e hija de padres luchadores que viven en las afueras de la ciudad su padre se dedica al trabajo de seguridad y su madre es ama de casa, tiene un hermano que trabaja como electricista y apoya a sus padres. Maryori obtuvo su título de secundaria como bachiller técnico en computación, seguidamente inicio sus estudios universitarios en el área de odontología, cursando hasta el momento 33 clases, para poder lograr su meta profesional, la joven tuvo que dejar su hogar y trasladarse a otra ciudad a vivir con su tía, quien le apoya en algunos gastos de alimentación y vivienda.

Las cualidades que la destacan son la perseverancia, el optimismo, la alegría y el respeto, ya que fueron inculcados por sus padres desde que era pequeña.
Su motivación es poder lograr muchas metas al terminar su carrera universitaria, una de ellas es el poder ser un orgullo y ejemplo para sus padres y su hermano menor. Con la finalización de su educación, desea contribuir a mejores condiciones de vida para su familia y en su país, aportando un servicio para el cuidado de la salud, ya que muchas personas hoy en día lo necesitan.
Maryori comenta que desde muy niña, sus  juguetes preferidos fueron los de medicina ya que siempre soñó con ser una doctora y hoy en día ese sueño está por cumplirse, gracias a Dios y al apoyo de sus familiares que la han motivado a llegar hasta este momento.
Comenta que sus planes son el poder apoyar a sus padres y hermanos, poder continuar sus estudios, especializarse en cirugía Maxilofacial, le gusta mucho ayudar a las personas por eso le gustaría también poder tener una fundación donde pueda ayudar a las personas de escasos recursos.

loans.use: Finalización de su carrera Universitaria de Odontología

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a friendly and engaging person and a hard worker. She has three children and she has been able to provide them with an education. She started her business a few years ago when her husband retired and his salary was not enough to cover the houshold costs. So it was up to Yolanda to start a business selling Mary Kay products. Her work has allowed her to suport her husband with the family expenses, for which she requires a loan of $700 to purchase items.

Yolanda hopes to expand her business with this loan and she will be able increase her earnings. She thanks you for your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es una mujer amigable, emprendedora y muy trabajadora; tiene 3 hijos a los cuales les ha podido ofrecer una educación. Su negocio inició hace ya algunos años cuando su marido se retiro, por lo que su salario no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar, entonces fue cuando Yolanda decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo productos de belleza “Mary Key”, actualmente su trabajo le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $700 para comprar mercancía.

Yolanda espera que con este préstamo su negocio crezca y pueda brindarle mayores ingresos, ella espera tu ayuda y generosidad, apóyala para que siga creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.en:
Sadagat wishes to increase her earnings by offering new products in high demand in her area in order to increase her income.
Having borrowed $600 Sadagat bought 3 calves.
She breeds calves and cows.
Sadagat plans to increase he number of dairy cows, which will enable her to sell more milk.
She supplies milk in the village and nearby markets. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.
She has been in this business for 6 years.
Sadagat is 56 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region Mahmudlu 2 village. She is married and has 4 children.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Faaupu

texts.en: Faaupu is twenty-nine years old.  She has two children in school.  She is passionate about ensuring that her children have a bright future full of opportunity, and she says that it is for this reason that she joined SPBD to start a small business.  Faaupu wants to make a meaningful contribution to her family finances and hopes that it can substantially raise their standard of living.  She is seeking a loan to help her with her new ice-pop business.  She sells flavored ices in her village and will use loan funds to purchase bulk (and therefore cheaper) supplies of the necessary ingredients.  Faaupu is an ambitious woman, and the goal she is working towards is running a full retail shop in her village.

loans.use: Purchase bulk supplies of sugar, cordial, purified water

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Khachmaz town. He has been selling clothes for four years. He would like a loan of $950 to increase the variety of his goods to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Ni Ketut Karsi

texts.id:
Although her hut is very simple, since made from woven bamboo sheets and wood, her business as pig farmer is moving along. Today Ketut Karsi only raise 1 mother pig. Food given was also simple, from banana tree trunk that was cooked and then mixed with rice shells fed twice a day morning and evenings. Usually pregnancy time for pigs are only 3 months, and it could produce 6 to 8 piglets. raising for 6 months cost about Rp400,00 (about US$44). After it was felt large enough, that is usually 3 months raising piglets, they are ready to be sold. That could reach up to Rp 2,000,000 (about $220) each harvest and 3 months profit after feed expenses would be Rp1,600,000 (about $176) used to support her tenant farmer husband, and 2 children, who dropped out school after 1st year college. Ketut Karsi hope the capital to be obtained from Dinari could add the mother pigs to be raised, so that her income would increase, given living expenses has increased too.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun keadaan rumah yang masih sangat sederhana yaitu terbuat dari gedek dan kayu namun usaha yang ditekuni sebagai peternak babi tetap berjalan. Saat ini ini Ketut Karsi hanya memelihara 1 ekor induk. Pemberian pakan yang dilakukan masih sangat sederhana yaitu, pakan yang terbuat dari batang pohan pisang yang direbus kemudian dicampur dengan dedak padi, pemberian ini dilakukan 2 kali yaitu pagi dan sore hari, biasanya masa hamil babi hanya 3 bulan dan dapat melahirkan bibit 6 sampai 8 ekor anak babi. Pemeliharaan selama 6 bulan menghabiskan biaya sampai Rp. 400.000,- . Setelah dirasa cukup besar yaitu 3 bulan pemeliharaan anak babi siap dijual. Hasil penjualan bisa mencapai Rp.2.000.000,- sekali panen dan keuntungan selama 3 bulan setelah dikurangi biaya pakan yaitu Rp.1.600.000,- dipakai untuk membantu pendapatan suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dan memenuhi kebutuhan 2 orang anaknya yang sudah putus sekolah pada tingkat pertama, Ketut Karsi berharap dengan modal yang diberikan oleh Dinari bisa menambah jumlah induk yang dipelihara agar pendapatannya semakin banyak mengingat kebutuhan hidup yang semakin banyak pula.

loans.use: To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

loans.name: Elida Bautista

texts.en:
Elida sells children’s clothing from her home, specializing in clothing for young children and babies.

Elida is forty-one years old and a single mother of four, three girls and a boy, all of whom attend school except for her two-year old, who is still at home with Mom. Elida sells her clothing from home, sometimes visiting neighbors in her community door-to-door. Her home is on a steep hill and, in the future, Elida hopes she can open her own clothing shop in her community where customers will no longer be greeted by a sudden slope.

Elida would like to add new merchandise to her current clothing line, particularly outfits for older children. In addition, Elida plans to use her loan to buy clothing in bulk, adding more items to her stock and improving her profit margin, as well.

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing in bulk quantities

loans.name: Pun

texts.en: Mrs. Pun S., age 25, runs a butchery and grocery store out of her home, earning about $5 each day in revenue.  Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning about $5 each day.  She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase additional inventory and build a stand for her business.  She hopes to take advantage of bulk discounts by purchasing large quantities of goods for her grocery operations, thus lowering inventory costs and increasing profitability.  She would like to use the additional earnings generated by this loan to expand her product range, build her business, and increase the family’s savings.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of grocery goods and to build a grocery stand.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mrs. Ven C., 49, works selling a variety of grocery products to people in her area, and generally makes about $3.60 each day. Her husband is a village chef and also helps her sell when he is available. Mrs.Ven C. has five children. Two of them are employed at a garment factory, each earning $2.40 a day, and the rest are unemployed. Lately she has applied for a loan to enable her to purchase more grocery products to meet growing customer demand. The rest of the loan she will use to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation. She and her family are appreciative of the loan to her family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet growing customer demand.

loans.name: Belmiro Manuel

texts.pt:
Belmiro is a laborer and lives in the town of Morrumbene. Belmiro is not officially married, but he lives with a woman with whom he has 4 children. His girlfriend is not employed, but she takes care of the house and cares for the children and Belmiro. He works for a private company and his salary is approximately $90. For this reason he resolved to enter into the program so he could increase his monthly budget. His oldest children are in school. He took the loan to refurbish his home which is very old. He wants to purchase cement, squares, and zinc plates.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Belmiro e trabalhador e vive na vila de Morrumbene. Belmiro nao casou oficialmente mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 4 filhos. A mulher de Belmiro nao esta empregada. apenas toma conta da casa e cuida dos filhos e do marido. Belmiro trabalha numa empresa privada e o seu salario e de aproximadamente $90. E por isso que ele resolveu entrar para o programa para poder reforcar o seu orcamento mensal. Os filhos mais velhos de Belmiro estao a estudar. Assim ele tomou o emprestimo para reabilitar a sua residencia que esta muito velha. Ele quer comprar cimento, e esquadria, chapas de zinco

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to refurbish home

loans.name: Abdul Jalil

texts.en:
Abdul Jalil lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 2 sons and he lives with his own family. He has a metal shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 8 years. For 6 years of that time he was a student in a metal shop. This is the second year that he works alone.

He needs some machines so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and complete his stock to attract more clients. He is happy that he has the opportunity to make a good income and help his family.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is fifty-five years old and the mother of four children. She buys frozen fish from Tema, a city in southeastern Ghana, and smokes the fish on a local oven made of clay. She then travels to Volta region to sell the fish.

Comfort wants to use her new loan to buy more fish from Tema Harbour for smoking to meet her customers' needs.

She is a member of the group called May Flower. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Huot Eit Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huot E. is the group leader of four members in the Banh Chhkol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a clay pot maker. Aside from this, she is also a firewood seller. Mrs. Huot E. is 59 years old and the mother of one child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Mut Rith, is a subsistence farmer and he also assists his wife work.

Though her business activities have improved over the years, she now wants to expand her business. Consequently, she asked for a loan to buy more clay to make additional pots and buy firewood to re-sell.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more clay to make more pots and buy firewood to re-sell.

loans.name: Jazira

texts.en:
Jazira S., 50, is widowed with five children. She owns and operates a fabric business in Dar-Es-Salaam. The business has been running for 10 years and brings in a monthly profit of $80.00. Jazira works daily from 10am to 6pm.

Jazira has had a previous loan from Tujijenge, which she has paid back in full. She is happy with the type of business, but now she wishes to expand. With this loan from Kiva, she hopes to increase her capital by purchasing more inventory.

loans.use: To increase capital and expand her fabric business.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji, 53 years old, is the widow of M.R. and has been living in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the last 35 years. (Baji is an Urdu term of respect meaning 'elder sister'.) She is the mother of ten children, five daughters and five sons. Her elder son works in a factory. The next two sons have a fruit cart. Her fourth son has a milk shop and the youngest son works in a factory. Khursheed baji's first daughter is a widow and lives with her. The next two daughters make decorative embroidery. Her youngest daughters are enrolled in a local school near the family's neighborhood. Khursheed baji has a live stock business; she sells milk which she collects from her animals. She successfully completed her loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand the milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Syeda Nasira baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit business. Parveen baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose U. is 50 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling drinks, bowls and coolers. She has been in this line of work since 1993 and wants to expand her business by selling food from her store. To make this possible, she needs a loan of $850 to buy food and more bowls. She wishes to extend her thanks to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To begin selling food from her business and to buy more bowls.

loans.name: Thyda

texts.en:
Mrs. Thyda M., 34, and her husband, Mr. Lay Sophal, 33, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1999 and have two sons. One son studies in a local school, and the other son is still young and stays at home. In addition to their children, the couple also raises one orphan nephew, who studies in university.

Mrs. Thyda has been a silk weaver since 1990, using a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Lay is a security guard for a company in Phnom Penh. Thyda and her husband hope that their work can continue to support their nephew's study until he finishes university. Now Thyda is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en: Serafina F., 49, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Serafina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy a spade, a crowbar, weed killer and chemicals. Her husband is helping her with the business.

loans.use: buying a spade, a crowbar, weed killer and chemicals

loans.name: Zikran M.fazil Group

texts.en:
Zikran baji is the wife of M. and has resided in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 25 years. Pakpattan is famous for its shrine of the great Punjabi Sufi poet Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkaru. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters and all of them are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Zikran bajis husband has been running a grocery shop in the community for the past 4 years. Zikran baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Zikran baji has successfully repaid her prior two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zubaida baji is requesting a loan to buy tools to fix electronic items (tube lights and switches). Majeedan baji is requesting a loan to buy milk for her milk selling business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Mavjuda, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. 

Mavjuda is an extremely hardworking and energetic woman. She is 31 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Mavjuda started her own business, because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family's expenses. 

For more than 3 years, she has operated a store where she sells girl’s and women’s underclothes. As a rule, she travels to the neighboring town of Istaravshan to get new garments at very cheap prices. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Mavjuda hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her two children. 

To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. For this purpose, Mavjuda requests 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for a term of 6 months. She promises to repay the loan accurately, as she has done with the previous loan. 

Mavjuda is counting on your help. Be an important of the growth of Mavjuda’s business.

loans.use: To buy new underclothes for girls and women

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro B. de 41 años de edad está casado con la señora Antonia Oviedo de 35 años de edad, ambos son padres de dos hijos; una nena de 6 años y un varón de 17 años y desean que sean médicos.
 El Cliente trabajó como empleado en Argentina por más de 10 años  y  luego de reunir un pequeño capital, volvió a  Paraguay, emprendió su propia microempresa que consistía en una despensa que fue  progresando poco a poco y hoy día ya es un mini mercado.
 El monto del crédito será destinado a la compra de sidras en cantidad,  para aprovechar las ofertas y luego venderlas a buen precio cuando lleguen las fiestas de fin de año. La sidra, es una bebida muy consumida en festejos especialmente en las fiestas de fin de año, en donde se registran altas ventas de este producto en todo el país.
 Más adelante quiere tener un local propio ubicado en la Avda. Principal de esta ciudad, para seguir con el mismo negocio.
 Espera que nuestro país mejore y que haya más fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Genaro B., 41 years old, is married to Antonia Oviedo, 35 years old and are parents of two children, a six year old girl and a 17 year old son whom they would like to become doctors. He has worked in Argentina for more than 10 years and after raising a small amount of capital returned to Paraguay and started his own small business that began as a really small store and progressed to the point that today it's a mini-market. The loan will be used for purchasing cider in bulk, to take advantage of the prices and later sell at a good price when the year-end festivals arrive, during which lots of this product is sold throughout the country. In the future, he would like to have his own store located on the main street in the city. He hopes that his country improves and that there are more opportunities for work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cider to sell

loans.name: Teav

texts.en: Mr. Teav V., age 38, is a commune committee clerk; his wife's name is Yen Chancy, and she is aged 31. She currently runs a little store in front of her house and sells vegetables and some groceries to the villagers. She normally sells her items from a seller at the market. She started in this business a long time ago. Chancy currently takes care of three children, all of whom are teenagers and also attend school. Recently, she sold all her items from her store. She talked with her husband, and they have decided to ask for a loan to purchase a range of groceries and more vegetables to sell. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province. (V.'s wife appears in the picture because he was not available)

loans.use: to purchase a range of groceries and more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Neidy Scarleth

texts.es: La sra. Neydi tiene 30 años de edad, reside en laureles norte, en la ciudad de Managua, tiene tres hermosos hijos que estudian, su esposos es docente y ayuda  a sus hijos. Su negocio de la Sra., Neydi vende prendas de oro y plata los comercializa al contado y al crédito, lleva cuatro años de vender y captar clientes, negocio que inicio con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo lo cual ha sido de muchos beneficio en su vida personal, con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para levantar una pared y entechar parte de la casa, ya que de una solo vez no puede por que es una inversión cara y va poco a poco hasta lograr una casa buena para su familia. Sus planes es establecer una red de distribución de prendas de plata. Que espera lograr en un futuro es rentable ya que por su variedad y bonitos estilo y accesibles se vende mucho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Neydi is 30 years of age and lives in north Laureles in the city of Managua. She has three beautiful sons who are studying. Her husband is a teacher and helps their kids. Mrs. Neydi's business is selling jewelry of gold and silver for cash or credit. She has been working in this business for four years and has clients. She started the business with loans that Afodenic granted her, which have benefited her personal life greatly.

With this loan she is going to buy construction materials to build a wall and a roof over part of her house; she cannot do it all at once because it is an expensive investment, but little by little she has been making her home better for her family. Her plan is to establish a distribution network for her silver jewelry. She expects to have a profitable future due to high sales, since her jewelry has a lot of variety, good style, and is affordable.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a concrete wall and a roof.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. has been trading in the local market of Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is 42 years old, married with three children. Her husband is a trader. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other foodstuffs such as beans, onions, peppers, carrots, green peppers and salad leaves on top of table in the market.

Janet does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. Janet belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Tumi’ which means ‘God’s Power’. She hopes to receive GHS 800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of palm oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
la sra. Maria S. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el sr. Julian Gomez que se desempeña como motorista, ellos tinen 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ellos y esta estudiando en el colegio.
ella se dedica a la venta de comidas como sopas marineras, cocteles de curiles, pollo frito, carne asada, camarones empanizados, refrescos de botella, agua,. tambien ella se dedica al alquier de unos apartamentos, ella tiene 28 años de tener su comedor, ella en estos momentos necesita un credito para poder compras mas producto para producir sus comidas ya que la demanda es bastante en estos dias de semana santa y necesita estar bien abastecida para cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes, esta es una epoca en que la gente consume mucho marisco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria S. is 52 years old. She is married to Mr. Julian Gomez who works as a driver. They have 3 children, but only the one in high school is still dependent upon them. Maria sells food like seafood soup, seafood cocktails, fried chicken, roasted meat, breaded and fried shrimp, bottled refreshments, and water. She also rents apartments. She has had her cafe for 28 years. She needs a loan now to be able to buy more products to make her food. There is a big demand during Holy Week. She needs to be well stocked in order to meet the needs of her customers. At this time people eat a lot of seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, chicken, pork, soft drinks, tortillas and seafood

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong P. is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Nam Dịnh. She is married and has three school-aged children. To making a living, Duong runs a local shop where she sells several products to local businesses and community members, who are also the main source of revenue for her business. Duong has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500,000 VND a month.

In 1999, Duong joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Duong has successfully repaid her previous loans from TYM Fund. Duong is now requesting a new loan of 10000,000 VND to renovate her business. This loan will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. Duong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About TYM Fund:
The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality and life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation and role in society.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Dozens of plastic buckets, washers, pitchers

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Isabel  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswankaris II” en la  provincia D. Azangaro, departamento D. Puno.  Tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 11 hijos, D. los cuales solo los menores están a su cargo.  Vive en el Jr. 28 D. julio  Nº 235.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos casi 03 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. comida, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará más víveres para la preparación D. comida, la misma que venderá en su restaurante, y D. esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; Desea poder poner una polleria y D. esta manera ampliar su negocio.

A ella le gusta mucho la forma D. trabajo D. Manuela Ramos y las charlas sobre mercadeo.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel is a member of the community bank “Aswankaris II” in the province of Azangaro, departament of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and has eleven children, but only the youngest are still in her care. She lives at #235, July 28th Street. Sra. Isabel has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for almost three years. She earns her living by buying and selling food. Her first loan was for S/. 300. With this new loan of S/.1500 she will buy more supplies to make food to sell in her restaurant, and in this way continue to expand her business. She would also like to open a restaurant specializing in barbecued chicken. She likes the way her partnership with Manuela Ramos is working, especially the talks on marketing.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, seasonings, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Namen

texts.en:
G. is single with four children, two of who are under 15 years of age. She is living at Government Teachers training college (GTTC) street Nkwen Bamenda, North West Province. G. plans to invest her loan in two bags of groundnuts (peanuts), beans, corn, gari, and transportation. She will sell her food out to her community.

This is G.’s fourth loan from GHAPE. She came to know of GHAPE in 2004 and since then her repayments have been satisfactory. This loan will help her improve her business because she will have enough capital to expand. She is convinced this business will succeed because she is has experience. This business will help her community by providing food stuff.

She plans to use the profit from the loan to pay for her children's school fees, clothe them, give them good medical attention, and feed the family well.

G. prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, GHAPE offers training, and there is proper follow-up when the loan is disbursed to ensure it is properly managed.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy beans, groundnuts (peanuts), corn, and gari and to pay for transport.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes P. is fifty years old. She is a married and has given birth to seven children: four sons and three daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a police officer.

Agnes trades in footwear for both men and women. She also deals in ladies underwear. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Agnes has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more footwear to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is twenty-seven years old and married with two children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells “waakye”. Waakye is rice cooked with beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye. Esi wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans and macaroni to prepare good ‘waakye’ for her customers. She believes this will provide her with increased income to support her children's education to the university level. Esi would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more rice, vegetable oil, beans and macaroni

loans.name: Annick Jeannine

texts.en:
Annick is married and has four children, ages 18, 14, 7, and 5.  She runs a store on the edge of town in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  At her store, she sells shoes, clothing, bags, and fabrics.  Outside of her store, she sells cookies and other snacks.  Annick has been running this business for two years.  Before, she worked at a store in another part of the city.  

Annick buys her goods in Lome, Togo, which is a few hours away from Porto-Novo.  It is expensive to cross the border, but she goes to Lome because of its diverse selection of products.   Annick is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner, in order to strengthen her activity.  She would like to buy more bags, shoes, and food to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, and food

loans.name: Muminiso

texts.en: B. Muminiso is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and is the loving mother of five children. Muminiso is a market vendor. For the last thirteen years she has been selling cottonseed oil at the local market. In the traditional Tajik cuisine the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil, especially our national dish, “Pilau”, which needs a lot of cottonseed oil in order to make it delicious. So the goods that Muminiso is selling are in popular demand among the population. Today, Muminiso is planning to increase her business. For this reason she requests 4,500 Somoni. She is counting on your help and thanks you for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cottonseed oil to sell

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Ii Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
MICAELA BASTIDAS II

La alcancía Comunal “MICAELA BASTIDAS II” está ubicado en el distrito de Ate Vitarte, este grupo está conformado por 11 socias de las cuales 10 son mujeres y solo 1 es hombre.
La Sra. Toribia A. es una de las socias más antiguas y se dedica al reciclaje, negocio que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones como mantener a sus 5 hijos y aportar con los gastos en casa.
La socia Demesia Raymundo tiene un restaurant que con mucho esfuerzo pudo construirlo ahora han pasado 2 años y se siente satisfecha con su trabajo. 
Las demás integrantes de “MICAELA BASTIDAS II” tienen sus propios negocios, ellas  se dedican a la comercialización de productos de belleza, confecciones, venta de comida, bodega, servicio de internet, etc. Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de productos e insumos que le ayudaran a incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
 
Ellas se sienten satisfechas por pertenecer a la familia de EDAPROSPO  y desean continuar por mucho tiempo juntas en el grupo.
texts.en:
The Micaela Bastidas II communal bank is located in the district of Ate Vitarte. The group is made up of eleven partners, 10 women and 1 man.

Mrs. Toribia A. is an associate with one of the oldest relationships with this community bank. She runs a recycling business that has brought her satisfaction and allowed her to take care of her five children and support household spending.

The partner Demesia Raymundo now has a restaurant that only after much effort was she able to construct. Now, two years have passed and she feels satisfied with her work.

The rest of the members of this communal bank have their own businesses. Some are dedicated to the sale of beauty products, sweets, and foodstuffs while others own general stores and internet cafes. They all need loans in order to buy products and supplies that will help them increase their profits and improve their quality of life. They feel satisfied to be part of EDAPROSPO (one of Kiva's Partner Institutions in Perú) and wish to continue being a part of this community.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE INSUMOS Y PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Erdenee

texts.en: Erdenee is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of his children attend a local secondary school while his wife helps him run his business. Erdenee owns and operates a successful household goods retail business in his town. He started his business in 2002 and attributes its success to his excellent accounting skills and he and his wife’s hard work. He hopes to one day move his business into his own store so that he can expand the number of products he sells. Erdenee is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more household goods so that he can attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea N. lives in Pour Village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land, on which she cultivates rice. She now faces a small problem with insects that destroy the rice crop. To deal with this, Mrs. Sophea N. is asking for a loan. With the money, she will buy more pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. Her husband, Mr. Doek Sopha, helps her farm. Mrs. Sophea N. has three children, all of whom are attending the local school.

loans.use: purchasing more pesticides to kill all types of insects

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses B. is a businessman who is 37 years of age. He is married and blessed with three children. Moses and his wife are teachers by profession, but they work hand-in-hand with one another to run their business. Moses has been in this business for over four years. He mostly deals in clothing for children age 6 to 10. His business is situated in Kiwumulo Acade, Elgine Street Masaka town. The name of his business 614 BABIES CORNER. 

His main aim for requesting a loan is to expand his business by buying more clothes. His future hope is to buy clothes for teenagers to boost his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more clothes

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun M., 44, pictured with his wife, Mrs. Houn Duch, 45, has been married since 1986. They have four children: two sons and two daughters.
