Two of them are married, one of whom lives in the family home. One son is a driver and other son studies in a local school. They live in a small village off of National Road Number 2 about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Bunthoeun and his wife have been farming since they were married. They grow rice and vegetables. Bunthoeun is now asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase a horse cart to carry his produce. This will make it easier for him to transport his produce from the field to the house.

loans.use: To purchase a horse cart to carry his products

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida A. is from the village of Cataggaman Nuevo, Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Florida raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables that she sells. Florida has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Florida joined ASKI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Florida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to expanding her business. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 
---------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Expanding her business.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 56 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y carismático, vive solo, ya que esta separado y sus tres hijos Martha (32), Robert  (28) y Mario (26), son independientes.Desde hace 6 años se dedica al trabajoso negocio de la venta de pollo, actividad que realiza con muchas ganas y buen humor ya que es un trabajo que le da el sustento para vivir. Lorenzo trabaja desde tempranas horas en la mañana y se prolonga hasta la tarde en el “Mercado de Luciana” (uno de los más concurridos por  la zona en la que vive), siempre atiende a todos sus clientes con una amable  sonrisa  y con un broma lo que  entretiene mucho  a sus asiduos clientes, quienes se han hecho muy amigos de él. En un futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio comprando más mercadería para  así obtener  más ingresos a su economía.Es su quinto préstamo con  MFP y es muy puntual con todos los pagos y así se demuestra su  gran responsabilidad.Piensa invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de gran cantidad  de  mercadería en pollos para obtener mejores ingresos, y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 56, is a hard-working and charasmatic man. He lives alone because he is separated. He has three children. Martha is 32, Robert is 28, and Mario is 26. They are independent. He has worked for six years in the demanding job of selling chicken. He does this with a lot of desire and good humor because his work is what supports him. Lorenzo works from the very early hours in the morning until the early evening. He works at the Mercado de Luciana (one of the most popular markets in the area where he lives). He always waits on all of his customers with a friendly smile and a joke, which greatly entertains his regular customers. His customers have made friends with him. In the future he would like to keep improving his business by purchasing more merchandise to get more income. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He is very punctual with all of his payments, and he demonstrates great responsibility. He plans to use the money from the loan to buy more chickens to get more income and keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to improve his business

loans.name: Mereyda

texts.es:
Mereyda tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el centro poblado menor Corral de Arena, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado ovino desde hace 10 años, este negocio nació ante  la necesidad de solventar sus gastos personales y de apoyar al sostenimiento de su hogar. Ella cría las ovejas y las vende a los comerciantes que usualmente visitan su distrito.

Por otro lado hace un año instaló en su vivienda una pequeña bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus vecinos. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad en la zona ya que el mercado más cercano queda a media hora del lugar en donde viven.

Mereyda desea implementar su negocio con nuevos productos pero no cuenta con la disponibilidad del capital suficiente para lograr su objetivo, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera  vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad, sus vecinos la consideran una persona confiable y que constantemente esta preocupada por el bienestar de todo el sector. En la fotografía aparece mostrándonos sus ovejas.
texts.en:
Mereyda is 47 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the small village of Corral de Arena, in the Olmos district, located 2 1/2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a business raising and selling sheep for 10 years. She started this business because she needed to cover her personal expenses and help support her household. She raises sheep and sells them to the traders who usually visit her district. In addition, a year ago she set up a small store in her house where she offers basic necessities and groceries to her neighbors. This business is very useful in the area, as the next closest market is a half hour away. Mereyda wants to stock her store with new products but does not have enough available capital to do this, and for this reason she is requesting for the first time a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian soles) from Edpyme Alternativa. She is a woman who is well-known in her community; her neighbors consider her to be a reliable person who is constantly concerned with the welfare of everyone in the area. In the photograph, she is showing us her sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic necessities and groceries for her store

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin V. is a 28-year-old man who lives in a house in Kompong Chhnang Province. Sin V. is an internal staff member in the Ministry of Social Affairs. He earns a salary of $180 per month to pay for his family’s expenses. He has a partner in his wife, a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals for family and also cares for their child. The family's youngest child is enrolled in primary school. 

Sin V. is taking this loan to purchase a used motorcycle to help him commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat flour

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mr. Norn C. is a villager who lives in Rung village, Takeo province. He and his wife are farmers who own a 2 hectare field to cultivate rice. This couple has four children, three of whom are students in the local school while the other one is too young to study or work.

Aside from farming, Mr. Norn C. is also a farm laborer and can earn a small income to support his family.  Mr. Norn C. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy a motorbike for transportation to his work place.  His wife is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Agnès T. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3ans et demi. Elle est détentrice d'un dépôt de boissons ou elle vend de la bière, du vin, de la boisson sucrée et des liqueurs. Son prêt lui a permis d'augmenter son approvisionnement en marchandises. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Agnès T. is 50 years old, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of a “Banc Villageois” loan group for 3 ½ years. She owns a beverage store where she sells beer, wine, soft drinks and liqueurs. Her loan will allow her to increase her stock supply. She assists her husband in taking care of family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Teresa Magnolia

texts.es:
Teresa M. de 51 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es comerciante ellos tienen dos hijos.  

El esposo de Teresa vendía artículos varios en la Había de Guayaquil (Lugar donde se reúnen todos los comerciantes informales a vender mercadería), Teresa tenia la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio y decidió invertir sus ahorros en una silla y artículos de un gabinete. 

En la actualidad ella tiene 10 años con su salón de belleza y su esposo ahora tiene el local de artículos en su casa.  trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo cortes de cabello, peinados, alisados, etc. Ahora ha implementado dar a crédito los tratamientos para cabello a sus clientes fieles en al tarde sale a recorrer su sector para ofrecerlos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas, tintes, productos de belleza para su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos terminen con éxito sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teresa M., 51, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; her house is cement and has all basic utilities. Her husband is a merchant and they have two children. Teresa’s husband sold assorted merchandise in Guayaquil’s La Había (a place where informal merchants gather to sell their wares). Teresa was desperate to have her own business so she invested all her savings in a salon chair and the equipment for a beauty salon work station. She has now had her beauty salon for 10 years and her husband has his store in their home. She works from very early in the day doing haircuts, hairdos, hair straightening, etc. She has now added providing hair treatment services on credit to her best customers. She goes out in the afternoons to offer these services in her area. She will use the funds to buy salon chairs, dyes and beauty products for her business. She would like to enlarge her business in the future and that her children complete their education successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chairs, dyes, ampules (hair treatment)

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La señora Segundina es una señora con 42 años, apenas estudio hasta el nivel D. primario, tiene 7 hijos. Segundina vive sola pues su esposo viajo a España en busca D. mejores oportunidades pero después D. algunos meses dejo D. llamarlos y D. mandarles remesas. La señora Segundina vive en la zona D. Mallco Rancho zona D. Sipe-Sipe D. la provincia D. Quillacollo.

La señora Segundina se dedica a la producción D. leche cruda, y a la agricultura donD. cultiva, hortalizas y cereales como maíces; toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero D. la zona, y todo su producción agrícola la comercializa en el mercado popular D. Quillacollo. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy precarias, tienen una casa con habitaciones pequeñas hechas D. barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Segundina  es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y sus hijos se levantan muy temprano todos los días para orD.ñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican a pastear a las vacas y cuidar D. sus cultivos, con el riego y cosecha, es una actividad ardua donD. todos ayudan.   

La señora Segundina solicita el crédito para poder comprar una cabeza D. ganado lechero, D. modo que pueda producir más leche, e incrementar  sus ingresos. El ideal que tiene la señora Segundina es que por lo menos todos sus hijos terminen la colegiatura. Segundina desearía que sus hijos logren estudiar una carrera técnica pero esta consiente que ese deseo no podrá realizarse pues tiene muchos hijos, pero por lo menos que terminen su colegiatura.
texts.en:
Señora Segundina, age 42, has only a primary school education. She has 7 children.

Segundina lives alone because her husband traveled to Spain looking for better opportunities. After a few months, he stopped calling her and sending her money. Señora Segundina lives in the Mallco Rancho zone of Sipe-Sipe in the province of Quillacollo.

Señora Segundina is involved in the production of raw milk and in raising crops such as vegetables and cereals like corn. She delivers all her milk production to a dairy cooperative in her zone. She sells all of her agricultural production in Quillacollo’s public market.

The conditions in which she and her family live are very precarious. They have an adobe house with small rooms. They keep their cattle on the same property.

Señora Segundina is very dedicated to her work. She and her children get up very early every day to milk the cows. They spend the whole day looking after the cows and tending their crops, watering and harvesting. It is arduous work, and they all pitch in.

Señora Segundina is applying for the loan in order to be able to purchase another dairy cow that can produce more milk and increase her earnings. Señora Segundina’s hope is that her children will at least finish high school. She would like her children to succeed in studying for a technical career but is resigned to the fact that this hope may not be realized, for she has many children. At a minimum, however, she would like them to finish high school.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed S. is a trader who sells along one of the main business streets in Makeni. He started with sales of cigarettes and later moved to plastic slippers.

He is married to a trader and they have four children who all attend school. He has 30 years of business experience and needs a loan to buy plastic slippers from the neighbouring country of Guinea.

He hopes to use the proceeds to educate his children and build on to his house.

loans.use: To purchase plastic slippers to sell.

loans.name: Ddembe Gayaza, Mubende Group

texts.en:
K. Madina’s main source of livelihood for the past five years has come from selling foodstuffs in Kigunda trading centre in the neighborhood of Mubende Town. It’s with savings from this business that she has managed to sustain her family of five children. The 45-year-old dynamic business lady has reached a point where profits accruing to her business now amount to 320,000 Ugandan shillings a month.

With steady progress in building her small enterprise, Madina reckons her future prospects are rising every passing day. With a loan coming her way, she carries conviction that she will be able to buy more produce like maize, cassava, peanuts, beans and rice, so that she does not run short of supplies.

loans.use: To purchase more produce for her business

loans.name: Luz Helena

texts.es:
Luz Helena vive en Bogotá,  tiene una peluquería  que inició hace más de 3 años, teniendo en cuenta la profesión de su esposo como estilista;  ellos empezaron con dinero que le facilitó un familiar para poner en marcha su sueño y proyecto de vida familiar. Así Luz Helena y su conyuge, desde esa època se dedican  al trabajo de peluquería, donde ofrece servicios de belleza como blower, masajes, peinados, tinturado, rizado, corte y desrizados de cabellos, que realzan la belleza femenina y masculina y proyectan una imagen elegante, formal o informal, al gusto y dependiendo de las expectativas del cliente. En la actualidad Luz Helena está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar insumos de peluquería, como tinturas, shampoo, enjuagues, crema de masajes capilar,  todo esto en mayor volumen con relación a como actualmente lo hace, lo cual es de mucha utilidad porque con el crèdito estaría disminuyendo los costos de consumo diario, haciendo este negocio más atractivo y con mayor capacidad de reinvertirle.
Su máximo sueño es crecer con su familia y tener 2 peluquerías, que generen más empleos, y su mayor desafió está ligado justamente al cumplimiento de esa meta,  porque dispone de muy poco tiempo especialmente para la fase inicial de su nuevo plan de negocios, ya que esta actividad le absorbe mucho tiempo, teniendo en cuenta que el barrio donde se desempeñan  es muy comercial y esto hace que el trabajo siempre sea permanente y ademàs porque la atención de sus dos hijos, en las edades de 5 y 10 años  requiere de ella una gran dedidaciòn y un mayor esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Luz Helena lives in Bogotá, she owns a hairdresser’s she opened more than 3 years ago, also considering her husband is a stylist. A relative provided them with enough money to start the business and to set off their dream and their project for their family life. Since then, Luz Helena and her husband have been working in the hairdressing business: they offer beauty treatments such as drying, massaging, hairdos, dyeing, perms, haircuts and hair straightening: they highlight male and female beauty and create new images that, according to the expectations of their customers, can be elegant, formal or informal. Luz Helena is now requesting her first loan to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) to buy a wider quantity of hairdresser’s products (dyes, shampoos, hair rinses, conditioners) than the amount she now has, something that would be very useful because with the loan she would reduce the expenses of the daily consumption, thus making this business more appealing and easier to reinvest. Her biggest dream is to grow in this business with her family, and to open 2 hairdresser’s thus generating more work; her biggest challenge is exactly to achieve this goal, as she doesn’t have much time to dedicate to the initial phase of her new business plan. In fact, her present activity takes too much time, since the neighborhood where they work is a busy commercial area, and this means there is always a lot of work for them; moreover, she needs to dedicate a great attention to and a put greater effort in the caring of her two children, aged 5 and 10.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hairdresser's products.

loans.name: Yisel María

texts.es:
Yesel María P. R.  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien hace dos años invirtió en  una comideria la cual  ha ido creciendo actualmente trabajan tres señores y  ella y su esposo.  Ella sueña con mejorar su negocio y seguir progresando hasta lograr cumplir su sueño tener un cadena de restaurantes de comida rápida.
P. con el crédito compra la materia prima para su negocio desde granos básicos, carne, repollo, lechuga etc.
texts.en:
Yesel is a hard-working, strong and enterprising woman. Two years ago, she invested in a restaurant which has been growing. Today, Yesel, her husband and three other women work there. She dreams of improving her business and progressing until fulfilling her dreams of having a chain of fast-food restaurants. With the loan, she will buy raw materials for her business, such as grains, meat, cabbage, lettuce, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica E. is from the barangay (village) of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 42 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Monica owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Monica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Monica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is grateful for access to loans and other services such as savings and insurance. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Erlinda is hopeful that her sewing business endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life.

Erlinda’s sewing business requires more capital to sustain its operation. Therefore, she has requested a loan through ASHI to support her business and to meet her customers' demands. Erlinda’s dreams are for her three children to complete college. Additionally, she hopes to continue her business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family. Through the support of ASHI and KIVA, she hopes to see herself and her family someday change their standard of living and move away from the ties of poverty.

loans.use: To support her sewing business

loans.name: Kozi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est agée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants.  Comme activité génératrice de revenus, elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique et divers.
L’activité se déroule dans sa maison où elle met à la disposition des riverains,  ses différents produits. 
Le crédit demandé est destiné à se réapprovisionner  pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle.
texts.en:
This lady, aged 32, is married and the mother of three children. In order to make a living, she sells plastic kitchen utensils and various other items. She sells out of her home where she displays her inventory for adjacent people. The requested loan is intended to cover replenishment of her stock so that she can better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of plastic kitchen utensils

loans.name: Shirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Shirley Del Rosario tiene 31 años, En este caso la señora tiene un negocio de venta de comida para animales como: vacas, cerdos, gallinas y otros. Por lo que esta ubicado en  su casa de habitación y en una comarca, sus clientes son de las comarcas y personas de la ciudad que tienen crianza de animales, con las ganancias del negocio mantiene su hogar y sus estudios universitarios. Por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una joven emprendedora y luchadora. Ella necesita del financiamiento para comprar suficiente productos y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y al comprar por mayor así obtiene mayores ganancias.  Por lo que siempre está pensando en mejorar su local con el fin de ampliar un poco más su actividad.
texts.en:
Shirley Del Rosario is 31 years old. In her case, she has a business selling animal feed for animals such as: cows, pigs, chickens and others. Her business is located in her home, and coop. Her clients are from the co-op, and people from her city who care for animals. With the earnings from her business, she maintains her household and covers her expenses from university studies. She has always been characterized as a young entrepreneur and rebel. She needs financing to buy enough products to cover her clients' demands and to by wholesale to achieve better earnings. For this reason, she is always thinking about improving her location, with the goal of increasing her business volume.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: loan for working capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La Señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja,  provincia D. Azángaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijos (04 dependientes y 01 independiente),  la señora solo tiene estudios D. primaria incompleto(5to).

La señora Juliana esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. compra y  venta D. animales menores.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo  crédito S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar  mas animales para luego engordarlas y poder venderlas en las ferias, también nos cuenta que se ayuda con la chacra.

Su sueño para el futuro  es aumentar el capital D. su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the community bank "Mataro Chico" located in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja in the province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 49 years old and she is married and has 5 children (4 are dependent and 1 is independent). She has a graD. 5 education. Juliana has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 months. She says that with the first loan that Manuela Ramos granted her was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and she supplemented her working capital with those funds. Her business is buying and selling small farm animals. She requests a new loan in the amount of 500 neuvos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of more livestock to raise and resell later in fairs. She also has a plantation. Her dreams for the future are to increase her working capital and improve her earnings. What she most enjoys about the community bank are the meetings and the talks given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Dembe Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en: Out of the increasingly lucrative poultry business, 30-year-old M. Pauline who belongs to Dembe development Group-Mpigi, has been making shillings 450,000 monthly. This mother of fire has worked vigorously to get her business into a reliable stride. She began this business with the help of her husband. Before all this she was, like any other village housewife, subsisting on her small income from small-scale farming. With this loan, she wants to buy more feed for her chicken and pigs. She is also looking at completing her kraal.

loans.use: The purchase of more feed for her chicken and pigs and to pay for the completion of her kraal

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, casada. Se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años. Una pulpería que solo comenzó vendiendo granos básicos, con dinero que su esposo dio, dinero de su trabajo como seguridad.
Ahora cuenta con más inventario, mejores ventas, gracias a su tenacidad de empeño por ayudar a su familia. Y con el apoyo de Afodenic quien ha sido el portador de buenas nuevas a través de los financiamientos. En donde está contenta porque ha sido de mucho beneficios para el bienestar económico.
Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de más productos como: cuatro quintales de arroz, dos quintales de azúcar veinte cajas de gaseosas, golosinas, pollo  productos lácteos. Logrando más la inversión en su negocio ya que la demanda es mucho.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working woman.  She is the mother of two children and she is married.  She has dedicated herself to her business for several years.  It is a small grocery store that began selling basic grains with money that her husband gave her, money from his work in security.  Now it has more inventory and better sales thanks to her tenacious effort to help her family.  With the support of Afodenic, who has been the bearer of good news with regards to financing, she is happy because her economic well-being has greatly improved.  
With this loan she will invest in the more products like: 400 lbs of rice, 200 lbs of sugar, 4 boxes of sodas, candy, chicken, dairy products.  She will invest more in her business because now there is a lot of demand.

loans.use:
Invertira en la compra de granos basicos, golosinas, productos lacteos, pollo entre otros para fortalecer el negocio
For investing in the purchase of basic grains, candies, dairy products, and chicken - among other things - to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen Muhammad Yaseen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a resident of Sumandri which is a small city located in the Punjab. This city is a big trading centre for rugs in Pakistan. All types of rugs (simple and designer) are available there for selling. Yasmeen has a three room brick house and lives in it with her family. She is very responsible by nature and responsibly undertakes her responsibilities as a housewife.  

She is married to M. Y. who has a business selling crockery. He puts his crockery into a four-wheeled cart and goes out to sell in the morning and comes back home in the evening. He visits different streets of the city to sell crockery. 

Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy crockery (jugs, glasses and cups) in bulk quantities to improve his selling. This loan investment will help him sell more variety and earn more from it. 

Note: In the photo, Yasmeen is the lady who is holding the book (called an Asasah Passbook) in her hands.

loans.use: To buy crockery to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred T. is from the village of Lam-an, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mildred is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a photocopying business. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mildred joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Mildred has successfully repaid a loan of 25000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a Xerox machine. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional photocopying machine

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila P. is 34 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rolly P., a laborer. Together they have a child who is currently in college. By the grace of God, Precila has managed to support her child's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continue to provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Precila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy a sachet of shampoo, a bit of cooking oil or an egg. She earns revenue by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling them at retail price.  Her store is located next to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales everyday.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a  loan of 13, 000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her store's inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Precila dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah C. is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Sarah is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Calachuchi.

Sarah is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Sarah has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sarah from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth G. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 35 years old, married and has no children. Maribeth operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Maribeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari (variety) store. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Maribeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda and her husband are both very responsible parents, and they work hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their child the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband; she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent financial needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures and she would like a loan in order to increase her capital by increasing production. Mavjuda and her family are waiting for your quick response. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Mutai

texts.en:
Mutai is a dairy farmer from Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the dairy business for 5 years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk at the local market and a local tea estate. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea.

Mutai is 39 years old and married. His four school-aged children all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help meet the basic needs of his family. He plans to acquire a high-yield dairy cow in the next five years. His major challenge has been lack of funds to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu B. is from the village of Bato. She is 46 years old. Marichu is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Marichu owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2000, Marichu joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Marichu from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juan Uvaldo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 23 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Juan nos cuenta que se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en la ciudad de Pisaq en su propio mototaxi. Ya son tres años que se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte. Juan también se dedica  a la elaboración de artesanía como tableros de ajedrez entre otras cosas, el es proveedor de las tiendas de venta de artesanía de la ciudad de Lima. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar su artesanía.  

Juan pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
23-year old Juan lives in the town of Pisaq, in Calca province, Cusco department, Peru. He earns his living by driving a mototaxi which he owns.  He’s been offering taxi services for the last three years. As well, Juan makes crafts such as chessboards which he sends to craft stores in Lima. He is now seeking a loan to buy more materials for this work.

Juan belongs to the Mosoq Ñusta community bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. He is grateful for the opportunity this loan brings and promises to pay back the money according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy craft supplies

loans.name: Mario Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Mario Jesus, El socio tiene 57 años de edad, el socio  es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio es músico de profesión, el socio tiene una agrupación musical llamada Aroma, él y su grupo se presentan para amenizar todo tipo de compromisos y tocan, cantan todo tipo de canciones como el ritmo de salsa, huaynos, criollas, boleros, vals, tangos, baladas, pop, rock; el socio pertenece al banco comunal desde hace 7 años atrás y el compra instrumentos musicales este es su pasión y siempre que puede compra uno nuevo, el ahora desea poner una tienda de venta de instrumentos, para lo cual necesita comprar algunos instrumentos más. él esta viendo entre más guitarras y castañuelas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un instrumento musical.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo  que le otorgaran y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank named "Until the Triumph"; this bank is located in the district of Huanchac, Province of Cusco, Department of Cusco. 

The member is Sr. Mario Jesus. He is 57 years old, married, and has two children. He is a musician by profession and has a band called "Aroma". He and his group show up to liven up every kind of committment party, and they play and sing all sort of songs, such as salsa, huayanos, native songs, boleros, vals, tango, ballads, pop, and rock. He has belonged to the communal bank for seven years and buys new musical instruments since this is his passion and would always like to be able to purchase a new one. Now he would like to open a musical instrument store, for which he needs to buy some more instruments; he's looking to buy more castanets and guitars. He is asking for the loan to purchase a musical instrument.

The member is happy with the loan that he has been granted and commits to complying with the payment of his cuotas in the established term.

loans.use: El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un instrumento musical.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha O. is 59 years old, married and a mother of two adult children. She resides in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. Editha earns a living by growing assorted crops to sell. She can generate an income of 2500 a month out of this activity. She has been in this business for many years and is still operating at present. 

In 2004, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Editha is requesting an 8th loan of 14,900 PHP,  which will be used to own a parcel of cocoland.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of cocoland (planted with coconut trees).

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj, 31, is married and lives with his wife and son in UlaanB., the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard on the outskirts of the city. 

He and his wife have worked together operating their tailor shop for the past six years. The shop they rent is located on a crowded street in the city center. Now their business has become much more stable and they have regular customers. As a reliable and well-known tailor shop, they always have custom orders. They are trying to expand their business and increase the variety of their products. They are planning increase their capacity and start making uniforms and suits in large quantities. 

Davaadorj is a hardworking person with initiative who says, "We think our future is bright. When you work hard, you always win something. Now, my wife and I are trying to expand our business and save money for our son's future." Davaadorj is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase some more stitching machines in order to increase their work efficiency.

loans.use: to purchase some more stitching machines

loans.name: Vilsa

texts.es: La Sra. Vilsa vive en el barrio Paititi de la zona del plan 3000 vive en casa propia desde hace dos años, tiene dos hijos de 5 años y de 1 año, es madre soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces y chocolates como también a la venta de ropa de invierno, calcetines, medias y ropa deportiva. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de material de construcción y así terminar de construir su baño y su acera y si poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia. La Sra. Es una persona trabajadora, con muchas ganas de superación ya que es madre y `padre para sus hijos y tiene que trabajar mucho para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en: Vilsa lives in the Paititi neighborhood, in the Plan 3000 zone. She has lived in her own house for two years. She has two children, aged 5 and 1, and she is a single mother. Her work is selling sweets and chocolates, as well as selling winter clothing, socks, stockings and sports clothing. The loan that she is requesting is to buy construction materials, so that she can finish constructing her bathroom and wall surfacing and thus provide better comfort for her family. Vilsa is a hard-working person with a great desire for improvement, since she is both mother and father to her children, and she has to work hard to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to finish her bathroom and wall surfacing

loans.name: Melelo

texts.en:
Melelo M., 48 years old, is a livestock trader in Bissil. She is married to Moses N., 55, and together they have five children: Hillary, 26 and working; Lucy, 18 and in form two; Lillian, 11 and in class six; Segel, 9 and in class four; and Likshon, 5 and in nursery school. 

Melelo was introduced to KADET LTD by another customer who is already registered with KADET. Melelo's business of six years gives her a monthly income of KES 19,500. This loan of KES 50,000 is her first loan from KADET and she plans to use it to buy cows and goats for trading. If the loan boosts her business, Melelo will establish a dairy farm. Melelo's dream is to have a big dairy farm and to sell milk to Kitengela and Kajiado customers. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima lives in Chichawatni, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  
She is divorced and lives with her brother. She has two sons and two daughters who also live with her. Both of her daughters are studying. 
Ghulam Fatima is not a burden on her brother. She helps him run his grocery store in his absence. She also manages the household work efficiently. 
In the grocery store, her brother sells daily used items like cooking oil, salt, sugar & spices etc to his clients and earns income. 
Ghulam Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother. Through the loan, her brother will put more groceries to his grocery store which will increase his sales and profits.
 
He has been operating this business for past 15 years and Ghulam Fatima is confident that an investment will put positive changes in his business and increase his income. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her brother.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is a 51-year-old single woman living in the village of Dumabato Sur Maddela Quirino. Filipina has two children who are already married.

She earns about PHP 20,000 after she sells one of her piglets. Filipina said that through her business, she is able to sustain the needs of her children during their school days until such time that they finished their tertiary level of education.

Filipina has been in the business of hog raising for almost 10 years. She plans to use this loan to buy feed, supplies and vaccines for her hogs.

In the future, Filipina hopes to maintain this kind of business because this is the main source of income for the family. She will be grateful if her requested loan is granted because this will be helpful in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, supplies and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en: Magaret sells provisions such as milo (a drink powder), milk, sugar, biscuits and other items in Elmina. She has been educated through junior high school.  She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Magaret has been selling provisions for 6 years.  She also helps her husband take care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy milo, milk sugar, biscuits and other items. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy milo (a drink powder), milk, sugar, biscuits and other items

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, es mecánico de estructuras metálicas, él vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, su forma de trabajar en el taller es bajo contratos de proyectos, por ejemplo la remodelación de vivienda que incluye aquellas viviendas que serán vendidas, cambiar sus techos, puertas y ventanas, a parte también tiene sus propios clientes.
Por el momento necesita de financiamiento para un proyecto, con el que comprara material como hierro de varias medidas y grosor, láminas, pues estos son los principales para atender los trabajos, este préstamo le ayudara a solventar las necesidades de materiales,  también realizara los trabajos que están en los contratos.
Su objetivo es permanecer en el trabajo, ayudando a su familia y con la esperanza de mejorar cada día sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, is a builder of metal structures.  Juan lives with his wife and four children.  He gets his work through project contracts, for example: home remodeling including houses to be put on the market and new roofs, doors and windows.  He has his own clients as well.
For now, Juan needs the loan for a project.  With the loan, he will purchase iron of various size and thickness and sheet metal, as those are the principal materials he needs to work.  This loan will help him to pay for the needed materials.  He will also see to the works that are under contract.
Juan's goal is to keep working to help his family, and he hopes to improve his earnings each day.

loans.use: to purchase iron in various sizes and sheet metal.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon (in the photo) is 53 years old and his wife, Chan is 62 years old, have been married since 1979 and have three sons. One is married and lives in separated home, and one is a garment worker and another one assists his parent in the business. They live in a village aL. National Road number 2 about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhon and his wife are rice farmers. He is asking a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco, conocimos al señor Jaime y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba capital de provincia de La Convención, tengo 29 años edad, tengo un hijo y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que son: elaboración de muebles de madera”. 

Jaime es una persona responsable y emprendedora que saca adelante a su único hijo, él tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio junto con su padre, él fabrica muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, roperos y otros más. 

El socia Jaime pertenece al banco comunal “Cholo de Oro de Kiteni” y accede al préstamo para invertir en el negocio de desea comprar madera, clavos y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
In the lower town center of Kiteni, in the Quillabamba district, La Convencion province, in Cusco, we meet Mr Jaime who tells us:

"I was born in the city of Quillabamba, the capital of the province of La Convencion. I am 29, have one child, and currently live in the city of Kiteni where I run my business: making wooden furniture".

Jaime is a very responsible and enterprising person who is getting his only child ahead. He has a small carpentry workshop which he shares with his father in his home. He makes wooden furniture such as, for example, tables, chairs, wardrobes and other items.

Jaime belongs to the "Cholo de Oro de Kiteni" communal bank and is taking out a loan to invest in his business. He wants to buy wood, nails and other items.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails and other items.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is 30 years old and married with two children, ages two and seven. He runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Abass has owned this business for four years and sells onions, rice and bags of pepper at his store.  His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food items. Abass says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings. In the future, he would like to be a supplier to other partners.

loans.use: To purchases more food items such as onions, rice, and bags of pepper.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 22 años vive en Salcedo cerca de Latacunga, vive con sus padres y un hijo varón que tiene 2 años de edad, Rosa se considera una persona trabajadora.

Trabaja en la crianza de animales, siembra de alfalfa; trabaja junto con sus padres. Trabaja con FODEMI por un tiempo de 1 año y medio, el crédito que solicita es para comprar semillas de alfalfa para sembrar.

Su sueño es encontrar una utilidad buena, tener mejores ingresos, y el sueño más grande es tener su propio terreno.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old and lives in Salcedo, near Latacunga, with her parents and her 2-year-old son.  She considers herself to be a hard-working person.

Rosa raises animals and grows alfalfa.  She works together with her parents.  She has been working with FODEMI for a year and a half and will use the loan that she is requesting to buy alfalfa seeds to sow.

Rosa's dream is to make good profits and better income.  Her biggest dream is to own her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seed

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan is very supportive in nature. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn an income for the family. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Her husband is a daily wage labor, and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. That’s why Siddiqan operates her business to help support the family financially. 

She is the mother of 7 children. Her eldest son is an auto mechanic while the others are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and earn more income. 

She is very confident that she will be able to put her business in a profitable position after the loan investment. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Siddiqan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Karem Joselyn

texts.es:
KAREM JOSELYN  tiene 18 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

Karem se dedica a la  venta de productos de yanbal, avon, y  ropa en catálogos las compras las realiza a través de internet y las entregan a domicilio, Solicita el crédito para  incrementar el negocio, comprar más  productos y obtener más utilidades para poder invertir en más  mercadería.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder tener utilidades al momento de vender los productos y reunir lo suficiente para poder culminar los estudios universitarios.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia. El sueño de Karem es poder apoyar a la familia económicamente a los padres.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música, bailar y lo primordial estudiar.
texts.en:
Karem Joselyn is 18 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her parents in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

Karem is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe community bank which is located in 10 de Noviembre district, in Ventanas canton.  She works in commerce.

Karem sells Yanbal- and Avon-brand products, and clothes, through catalogs.  She makes her purchases on line and delivers the products to people's homes.  She is requesting this loan to increase her business, to buy more products and to obtain more profits so that she can invest in more merchandise.

This loan will be a great help to Karem in making profits when she sells her products.  She will be able to put together enough money to finish her university studies.

The challenge that Karem frequently faces is competition.  Her dream is to be able to financially support her parents.  In her free time she enjoys listening to music, dancing and, above all, studying.

loans.use: to increase her business and buy more products

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 26 years old and has two children.  She does tailoring to earn a living.  She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. Even though she runs her business in a very competitive environment, she has retained her customers because of her good reputation.

Joyce hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana mujer trabajadora, comerciante, con el ciclo anterior mejoro el techo del negocio, ahora continuara con su planes a futuro y a corto plazo de mejorar su condiciones de vida, la infraestructura de su negocio y vivienda. Con el préstamo de este ciclo comprara materiales de construcción como: láminas de plycem, cemento, pernos, reglones entre otros materiales para hacer las divisiones de cuarto en su casa, también embaldosar el suelo, siendo de gran necesidad realizarlo. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo brindado para ir cumpliendo sus planes.
texts.en: Ana is a hard-working woman.  She is a saleswoman and used her previous loan to improve the roof of her business.  She will now continue with her future and short-term plans of improving her living conditions, the infrastructure of her business and the infrastructure of her home.  With this loan, she will buy building supplies such as: sheets of Plycem, cement, bolts, screeds and other materials in order to divide her house up into rooms and tile her floor as this work really needs to be done.  She is grateful to the financial institution for the support they have given her in carrying out her plans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to tile her house.

loans.name: Cristhian Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Cristhian es un cliente que esta en su segunda secuencia de crédito, con buena referencia crediticia, se dedica a la atención de servicio de té, mates, cafés y la venta de sándwiches de pollo, carne molida, carnes frías y huevo, en su anaquel que esta ubicado en la zona Mario Mercado,  el sr. Cristhian por lo que se ha podido ver,  es un cliente joven emprendedor, que trabaja con su familia y con el tiempo piensa expandir mas su negocio, razón por la cual este crédito lo va invertir en otra actividad, para compra de ropa y  de edredones, blusas y otros por mayor, ya que se acerca la época navideña y el venderá estos productos por temporada, por lo cual  esta poniendo empeño a sus actividades, con mucho entusiasmo en cuanto a la ampliación de sus negocios por lo cual esta solicitando  crédito.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a client who is on his second loan cycle.  He has a good credit record.  His business is serving tea, maté infusions and coffee.  He also sells ground meat, cold cuts and eggs from his stand which is located in Mario Mercado district.  Cristhian, as you can see, is a young, entrepreneurial client who works with his family and, over time, plans to further expand his business.

Cristhian will invest this loan in another business activity, buying clothes, comforters etc. wholesale.  The Christmas season is approaching and he will sell these products during this season.  He is putting a lot of effort into his activities and is very keen to expand his businesses.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and comforters

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is married with five children. She is 53 years old and is from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Rosa operates her sari-sari (variety) store in their barangay (village) to make a living, and has had this business for more than two years. Each month she earns about Php10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 30,000 to purchase more products to sell in their store. Rosa has a been member of GDMPC for almost a year. She wishes that her business will become more progressive. She will use her income for an educational plan for her five kids.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: David Abel

texts.es:
David de 44 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Isla trinitaria”. Inicio esta actividad ya que desde pequeño le gustaban los carros, ante era chofer de un bus urbano, ahora con un pequeño capital pudo comprar un bus de transporte urbano.

Su labor la inicia desde muy temprano, termina su labor una vez cumplido el valor indicado que es de $50 dólar.
Su dificultad es cuando el bus se daña, no es fácil de componer. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas de nuevas para su bus. Su sueño es construir su vivienda y la compra de otro bus en donde pueda brindar empleo.
texts.en:
David is 44, and lives in an area on the fringe of the city, called "Isla Trinitaria."  He started this business, as ever since he was a small boy, he has liked cars. Before this, he was a driver of a city bus. Now, with a bit of capital, he was able to buy a city bus. 

He starts work very early, and finishes once he has reached the specified amount of 50 dollars. His challenge is that when the bus gets damaged, it is  not easy to repair.  He is applying for the loan to buy new tires for his bus.  His dream is to build a house, and to purchase another bus, wherein he can offer someone employment.

loans.use: To buy new tires.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, Mr. Chay, 61, is a retired soldier who usually assists his wife to do housework and looks after the family. He has four children, two of whom are already married, and are soldiers who live away with their wives. 

Mr. Chay’s wife helps him in earning an income by selling used clothes in a local market of the province, earning approximately $5.00 per day. But recently she has run out of her stock of clothes, and it is certain that she needs additional funds to purchase more stock again. Therefore, Mr. Chay decided to borrow some funds from Kiva to support his wife’s selling business. With the increased in income, Chay wants to fix and decorate his house.

loans.use: To purchase stock of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Duo Carisma Group

texts.es: Doña Gabina, es una persona que se dedica a la elaboración D. tejidos típicos a mano y a la compra y venta D. leña desD. hace años ella se ha dedicado a estas actividades para poder  mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y darles lo necesario para vivir, ella quiere que sus  hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y poder tener una vidas mejor, por eso necesita un capital para engrandar mas su negocio y comprar mas  materia prima para sus tejidos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos tipicos Doña Yolanda ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio D. venta D. ropa, y venta D. productos AVON, tiene bajo su responsabilidad  a su hijo menor D. edad que necesita el cuidado  D. ella, por eso ella necesita un capital porque el anhelo D. ella es tener mas variedad D. productos y tener un negocio  mas granD. para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gabina makes typical weavings by hand.  She also has been buying and selling firewood for years.  She has devoted herself to these business activities in order to be able to send her children to school and to give them the necessities of life.  She wants her children to be able to finish their education and be able to have better lives.  To do so she needs capital to expand her business and to buy raw material for her weavings.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw material to make typical weavings.

Yolanda has a small business selling clothes and Avon products.  She has a young child under her responsibility, and he needs her to care for him.  That is why she needs capital; her desire is to have a greater variety of products.  She also yearns to have a larger business in order to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make weavings.

loans.name: Crescent

texts.en:
Crescent, 39-years-old, is a goat salesman plying his trade in Ibanda, in the West of Uganda. The father of two has been overseeing his business for a decade now.  

Prior to that, he was mostly engaged in a food sales business.  It was from the food sales trade that he got the start up capital for his current business venture.

Expansion of his business beyond the boundaries of Ibanda is what his plan is for next year.  He is hoping that this Kiva loan will come in handy for making his expansion plans come to fruition.

Crescent says he will use his loan to purchase more goats to resell, not only in Ibanda, but in other neighboring districts.

loans.use: purchase goats to resell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a responsible and loving father to his child and husband to his wife, Mary Ann. He is a farmer who plants rice to sell. He started raising crops three years ago. He needs to improve his farming practices, and as of now, he pays laborers to help him sow and transplant rice seedlings during the planting season.

Christopher is now asking for a loan, because he lacks the funds to pay labor costs and to buy rice seeds to grow. In this matter, he is asking for 12,000 PHP and promises to repay it on time.

With good profits from the business, Christopher also aims to renovate their small house.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and single. He has been running a beauty salon business preparing peoples hair, selling hair products and hair extensions for the last four years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000.  He plans to use the funds to buy more stocks of cosmetics weave shampoos and hair extensions.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  With the anticipated profits he plans to buy further salon equipment.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and open up another hair salon in a different locality

loans.use: to buy hair products, extensions, shampoo and oil for use and sale in his salon.

loans.name: Egnonnam Group

texts.fr: Le groupement EGNONNAM est formé de douze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Claudine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Claudine est âgée de 50 ans, et est mariée à un certain Martin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Claudine a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Depuis cinq ans, Claudine vend des charbons de bois et de l’huile végétale à son domicile ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Claudine achète ses produits au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Claudine et les autres membres du groupement EGNONNAM sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Egnonnam group is composed of twelve individuals all living in the same area in Benin and belonging to the same  "tontine" (a group savings fund). The group’s representative, by the name of Claudine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Claudine is 50 years old and married to a certain Martin. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Claudine stopped her schooling at the primary level. For the last five years, Claudine has been selling charcoal and vegetable oil out of her home, which allows her together with her husband to provide for different family needs. Claudine stocks up in Benin. This is the second time that Claudine and other members of the Egnonnam group are seeking a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to bolster their business and increase their working capital in order to meet customer demand better. The first loan has been duly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and jugs of vegetable oil

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 41 years old, married and has six children. He is a government employee. His son is studying in secondary school. Because of his low salary and his big family he always worries about making enough money to cover his family needs and saving some for his children school expenses. With this loan now he can accommodate all these expenses.
He is requesting a 2500 USD loan to pay for his son's tuition fees and other school expenses. He aims to see his children get best education. 
The story of Ali and his son is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Mahuwena Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUWENA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Françoise, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 44 ans est mariée à un certain Eugène. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Françoise a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour cette raison, Françoise vend des nattes et des balaies à son domicile et dans un marché de sa région depuis quatre ans. De façon secondaire, Françoise vend aussi des fruits de saison. Françoise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Françoise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUWENA un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des nattes,des balaies et des fruits de saison.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano es una de las muchas personas que se han beneficiados con los créditos de KIVA y ADICLA, él cuenta que antes que no tenía acceso a ningún crédito él cultivaba en muy poca cantidad, pero ahora gracias a los apoyos de los créditos su cultivo ha incrementado, con estos avances Mariano está muy contento  pero no conforme por esa razón solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de zanahoria e insumos agrícolas para su cultivo. Mariano tiene el anhelo de mejorar su cultivo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de semillas de zanahoria he insumos agrícolas.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with six children,of which two are in secondary school.Upon completion of secondary school Anna was married to a taxi driver.Income from her husband alone could not meet all the family expenses left alone school fees for the children.That situation forced Anna to find means to help her husband raising the family.She decided to join a training on batik( a type of locally decorated cloth) making from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO).Since she started this business twelve years ago she has acquired a lot of customers from her own made Batik. She now has both regular and new customers.She needs USD  550 to add a stock of raw materials for Batik making.

loans.use: Adding stock of batik making materials

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
This 52-year-old man is a father of 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village.
In the beginning of his business Allahverdi borrowed  $600 and bought a meaty bull-calf.
He has been in this business for 4 years.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 2 meaty bull-calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 meaty bull-calves

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en: K. Zulfiniso has worked with the trade sphere more than 13 years. She has secondary education by specialty – salesman, so she does not feel a lack of knowledge and experience in trade activity. Her family consists of her husband and 3 children. Her husband is her partner and companion in business. In plan of everyday provision of family needs, she does not experience any difficulties – as the scope of her business allows her to solve any kind of problem without great effort. But she has another dream – to build a big house with all conveniences and all conditions – which is not easy to make in rural area, and nowadays all her efforts are directed to it. And as constant capital removal can damage her business, she decided to try loans, which helps not only to means and also helps raise the business level to a higher plank.

loans.use: Continuous provision of good turnover

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru:
Inobat has two children. She is divorced and is raising her sons by herself. She lives with her parents. Her father is a pensioner but his pension is not enough to live on, so Inobat started her business 6 years ago by selling men’s, women’s and children’s clothing. She travels to Karosuu, Kyrgyzstan and Kokand, Uzebkistan to purchase goods. It is very difficult for Inobat to travel to different countries to buy goods because there are problems with transportation and customs inspectors on the borders between countries. But Inobat has gotten used to difficulties and can’t imagine her life without trade.
Inobat is an active client of “MicroInvest”. In the past the loans she received helped her grow her business. With this loan she plans to open her own stall and with the profits she wants to buy a separate flat for her small family.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Инобат мать двоих детей. С мужем она развелась и осталась с двумя детьми на руках. Сейчас она живет со своими родителями и сама растит своих двух сыновей. Ее отец пенсионер и его пенсии не хватает на жизнь. 6 лет назад Инобат начала предпринимательскую деятельность. Начала бизнес с мужской, женской и детской одеждой. За товаром ездит в Каросуу, Кыргызстан и Коканд, Узбекистан. Инобат очень трудно ездить в другую страну за товаром, так как на границе этих городов возникают проблемы с таможенными органами и перевозкой товара. Но Инобат уже привыкла к этим трудностям и не может представить себе жизнь без торговли.
Инобат активный клиент Микроинвест. Полученные займы способствовали развитию бизнеса Инобат в лучшую сторону. В планах у нее открыть лавочку и на доходы приобрести отдельную квартиру для своей маленькой семьи.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Antoli

texts.en:
Antoli is 44 years old and owns a small fried-foods store. She is well-known for her stuffing, kippers, donuts, yaniqueque (Johnny cake) and other foods. She has been in this business for a long time, and it has allowed her to provide her five children with a good education and also help her husband, who is temporarily unemployed. Their children all go to the local public school, where they also practice different kinds of sports.

Antoli feels this is a good time to expand her business and acquire new customers. She has come to us for a loan of $250 to give a brand-new face to her store and buy the new materials she needs to prepare a wider range of fried foods for her customers. She will repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To expand her business and acquire new customers

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is 36 years old. She is a caring and dedicated mother. She has 3 children. She lost her husband about 8 years ago.
