She suffered a great deal, but since then she has been there for her children not only as a mother but also as a friend. She works very hard in her small grocery (convenience) store. Thanks to the great location and her good customer service, her small grocery store has proven to be profitable. She has been able to support her family. The wish of this hard-working single mom is to increase her inventory and to therefore increase sales and to make a profit. Marcelina awaits your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina de 36 años de edad, es madre cariñosa, emprendedora y muy dedicada al cuidado de sus 3 hijos, desafortunadamente perdió a su esposo hace 8 años; este hecho le causó mucho sufrimiento y desde entonces se convirtió en amiga y madre de sus hijos; trabajando arduamente en su bodeguita de ventas de abarrotes y coca.Este pequeño negocio que gracias a la ubicación estratégica y al buen trato que brinda a sus asiduos clientes está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos, que la llenan de satisfacción porque le permite cubrir plenamente los gastos de su hogar.El deseo de esta madre emprendedora es aumentar y ampliar el stock de su mercadería con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas diarias para así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familiaMarcelina espera tu respuesta y apoyo desinteresado.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en: Fiona H. is one of the newly active members of the loan program. She is from the village of Vaiusu and she is a good cook and a good tailor. She has seven kids and her husband is a good engineer. Fiona sells plates of different food at her church center. She joined at the beginning of this year and now she is asking for another loan before the end of the year. She is a hard-working lady and she is going full speed this time to make sure that  money from foreign tourists will come to her during this time of Christmas.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fees, and for supplies for her sewing business and her food stall business

loans.name: Apiah

texts.en: Apiah, 45, is a mother of 3 children. Her husband, A., sells tofu and earns USD10.5 a week. To help her husband, she has opened a food booth at her house where she sells snacks, candies, beverages, etc., earning USD5 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old single man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. Ali owns an accessories store. This is the second time Ali is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 1000 to help him buy new merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his accessories store

loans.name: Thi Cham's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Châm (group leader) is an ex cadre of her hamlet. She raises poultry to make a living. Her husband passed away. She has a son who is in on assignment from the military. She requests a loan of 200600 VND to buy mash for feed for her chickens.
Mrs Ngô Thị Hà sells dried food.
Mrs Trần Thị Dung needs a loan to buy fertilizer and basic goods to resell.
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Sắc, C. Thị Tình, Nguyên Thị Tuyết and Nguyễn Thị Duyên will use the loan to raise pigs and buy basic goods to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Châm là cán bộ cựu chiến binh của thôn. Cô vừa tham gia công tác của Hội cựu Chiến binh, vừa tham gia chăn nuôi để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chồng cô đã mất. Hiện nay cô có một con trai đang công tác tại quân ngũ. Cô vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám chăn nuôi gà thịt.
Cùng mức vốn vay 2006000 đồng như cô còn có:
Cô Ngô Thị Hà vay để đi chợ bán hàng khô.
Chị Trần Thị Dung vay để mua lân đạm làm nông nghiệp và thêm vốn đi chợ sắt.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Sắc, Chị C. Thị Tình, Chị Nguyên Thị Tuyết và Chị Nguyễn Thị Duyên đều vay để chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: raise pigs, sell basic goods

loans.name: Bisiti

texts.en: Bisiti is 21 years old and is married. Bisiti is a cloth seller, having started her business in 2006. She decided to start her business because it would allow her to learn about commercial practices.  Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Obijon

texts.en: Obijon U. lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where agriculture and raising livestock are prominent businesses. It is one of the main businesses in the Asht region.  Obijon is married and has 2 children. He and his wife work on the collective farm but since it is seasonal work, they are also engaged in raising livestock.  Now Mr. U.  applies to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. The loan will be used to purchase pedigree bulls and increase his flock.

loans.use: To purchase pedigree bulls and increase the size of his flock.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. sells sandals, hair gels, boots, and underwear. She is married but her husband's income from repairing cars is not sufficient for Evelyn and her four children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling sandals, hair gels, boots, and underwear.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly studies at the Parvulario Institute and works with her mother to create embroidery labels; this activity is her source of income with which she covers her expenses. Magaly lives in her parents' home located in the city of La Paz.

The credit is allocated for the purchase of a computer, which will help her greatly in order to do her research work at the Institute.

This is her second credit with Impro. The loan requested by Magaly has been approved due to good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Magaly estudia en el Instituto Parvulario y trabaja con su madre realizando bordados de etiquetas; esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre su manutención. Magaly vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona la Portada de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una computadora que le ayudará mucho para realizar su trabajos de investigación del instituto.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Magaly.

loans.use: To purchase a computer to facilitate her studieds at the Institute

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru:
Gulmorod K. lives in the Khuroson town. He is 65 years old, married, and has 8 children. He has secondary education. He is a teacher by training and works in school. Because his salary is very low, he is involved in buying and selling animals. He purchases young sheep at a market, feeds them for one month, and sells them at a profitable price. At this point in time, he would like to purchase 4 sheep, for which he needs funds. For this reason, he decided to obtain a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Камолов Гулмурод житель района Хуросон.Возраст 65 лет, женат, имеет 8 детей. Специальность средне-техническое.По специальности учитель. Клиент работает в средней школе . Но так как заработная плата очень малненькая клиент занимается куплей продажей сельхоз животных. Он покупает на рынке молодых барашкев , откармливает их в течении 1 месяца и перепродает на рынке ,по выгодной ему цене. В данный момент клиент хочет купить 4 барашкев для чего емй нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sheep

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné Dieye est née en 1967 à Bambey, elle habite au quartier DVF de Bambey. elle a une expérience de cinq ans dans la vente de denrées alimentaires. Avec le Ramadan elle veut renforcer son stock afin de satisfaire sa clientéle.
texts.en:
Ngoné Dieye was born in 1967 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF neighborhood of Bambey. She has worked for five years in food commodity sales. With the upcoming observance of Ramadan she wants to strengthen her supply and satisfy her clients.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food commodity sales

loans.name: Mrs. Seum Sorn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people in Toul Vihea Village in Kampong Cham Province make up this village bank loan which will be used for different purposes. Mrs. Seum S. is a village bank president that has a plantation where she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money to buy more rice to plant so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase rice seed. Her husband, Mr. E. Vong, helps with the rice plantation. Mrs. Seum S. is 56 years old and the mother of a 16 year old child who is still attending school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Ten members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed to cultivate on her plantation.

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Srorn O. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who has a hectare of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Sen Nan, is a farmer and pig breeder. He is shown here on the left of the photo.

On their plantation, Mrs. Srorn O. and her husband are facing an obstacle because their soil is infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Srorn O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her field, and she will use the rest of the money to buy pig food for her husband's pigs. 

Mrs. Srorn O. is 33 years old and the mother of four children. Two of the children are enrolled in the local school. The other two are too young for school, as one is four years old and the youngest is five months.  

.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field's soil, and buy pig food for her husband's pigs.

loans.name: Ubaldo Miguel

texts.es: El señor Ubaldo A. es una persona de 25 años de edad, con residencia en el Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán, Guatemala, trabaja en la artesanía, fabricante de cortes típicos de diferentes diseños, casado  y con dos hijos, debido a la demanda que tiene de cortes típicos, se ve obligado a incrementar su capital y taller de telares, por lo que se acerco a la asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo de Q3,504.00 quetzales la cual utilizara para la compra de materia prima y así poder incrementar su producción de cortes típicos. Con la visión de poder mejorar su condición de vida de su familia y ayudar a sus dos hijos a que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que en los tiempos de su niñez sus padres no le pudieron dar la oportunidad de estudiar. Siendo una persona reconocida en su comunidad sin malos antecedentes.
texts.en:
Mr. Ubaldo A. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez in the Totonicapán Region of Guatemala. He works in the handicraft production of typical native dress of various designs. He is married with two kids. Due to the demand of native weaves, he needs to increase his capital and the loom workshop. He approached ASDIR to apply for a loan of 3,504 quetzales to buy raw materials and increase production. As a child his parents were unable to give him the opportunity to study so his dream today is to improve the quality of life for his family and send his two children to school. He is recognized figure in his community and has a good record.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (To raise capital)

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. Both of her children are currently attending elementary school in Atebubu, where she resides with her immediate family.

To support her family, she sells food items such as beans, maize, rice, and groundnuts at the market square. In fact, she notes that she has been in this business for over three years now. Janet explains that she buys her food items from the wholesalers in her community and sells them to food vendors for a profit.

Janet is now seeking a loan in order to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. By doing so, she will be able to sell her goods to a large number of customers (i.e., she will increase her market share) and will thereby increase her profit margin. Notably, Janet belongs to a group in her community known as "Assurance". In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her customer base and to increase profits by purchasing goods (e.g., beans and groundnuts) in bulk

loans.name: Lorence

texts.en:
With her sacrifices and hard work, Lorence deserves to be called one of the empowered women of her generation.  Lorence G. is 34 years old and separated from her husband, taking sole responsibility for their three children: Angel, 11, Le-ann, 4, and Lugirich, 2. She and her children live together happily in Antagan 2nd of Tumauini, Isabela.  

At present, Lorence is striving hard to provide a better life for her children.  She operates a vending business selling homemade native snacks made from glutinous rice and sugar.  She sells her products to her regular customers in the village and earns an average income of PHP 4000 a month.  She has been in this business for three years now and she hopes to maintain it for the future of her family.  In order to do this, she would like to request a loan of PHP 6000 (150 USD) so that she can buy more ingredients for her products and be able to increase her sales. 

Lorence dreams of sending all her children to school and finishing their studies. When that time comes, she will be proud that she made it by herself.  She believes that two heads are better than one, but since she is already separated, she promised to herself that she will be both a good mother AND father to her three children. She is willing to sacrifice for their sake and she also knows that her faith in God will guide her.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients for her homemade native snacks

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary a sus 29 años quiere salir adelante, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Es una vendedora de productos de belleza muy solicitada en su barrio, siempre está muy informada de los nuevos productos que han salido al mercado y no pierde la oportunidad para dar uno que otro consejito de belleza  a sus habituales clientes, puesto que disfruta de vender sus productos y más aun cuando acaba su mercadería. Lleva un año en este negocio y espera posteriormente poder abrir un salón de belleza, donde pueda vender sus cosméticos, ya que actualmente le es muy difícil ir por todos los lugares donde dejó sus productos de belleza y cobrarles uno por uno. Este es el primer préstamo de Mary con MFP, se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta de pertenecer. Este dinero le ayudará ha incrementar su capital de trabajo, planea invertir todo el crédito en la compra de más productos cosméticos.
texts.en:
Mary at 29 years old wants to get ahead. She lives in the house that her parents left her. She is very hard working and has a lot of desire to excel. She is a sales woman of beauty products and is very popular in her neighborhood. She is always well informed of the new products that have come out on the market and does not pass up the opportunity to give beauty advice to her regular customers, she enjoys selling her products and more so when she sells out her merchandise. She has been in this business for a year and hopes to later open a beauty salon, where she could sell her cosmetics, since it is currently difficult to go to all the places where she sold her products and have to collect from her customers one by one. This is Mary's first loan with MFP and she feels very capable of paying it back on time, and has faith in her business and her community bank, to which she feels very happy being able to belong. This money will help increase her working capital, she plans to invest the proceeds in more cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa B. tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción, Junto a su esposo e hijos la señora es comerciante y agricultura al igual que su marido; ellos tiene  a su cargo dos hijos los cuales todavía estudian su primaria, la hija de 11 año le apoya con los quehaceres del hogar ya que ella vende en el mercado oriental , los planes de doña Rosa es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que para ello tiene que darle un buen  mantenimiento a la pitahaya para vender en un precio accesible de ganancias , lo cual necesita comprar insumos para aplicarle al cultivo de pitahaya. Ya que esta se vende mucho cuando la cosecha se da por su rico sabor.
texts.en:
Rosa B. is 31 years old, and lives in the San Juan de la Concepción neighborhood with her husband and children. She is a merchant and a farmer, like her husband. They have two children who are still in primary school. The daughter, 11 years old, helps her with the household chores since Rosa sells at the Asian market. Rosa’s plans include improving the standard of living of her family, which is why she must take good care of her pitahaya (“dragon fruit”) crop so she can sell it for a good profit. She can use these earnings to buy the supplies necessary for the farming of pitahaya. This fruit sells well when harvested because of its delicious flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and agricultural products for better crop production.

loans.name: Liliana Flor

texts.es:
La señora Liliana Flor Sánchez R. tiene 20 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras y vive en Milán caserío de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando porque tuvo su hija que actualmente tiene 4 años.
Liliana vende ropa gruesa, ponchos, pantalones, etc. de acuerdo a lo que se usa en la localidad.
El primer crédito fue de 200 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en la compra venta de ropa de bebé.
Con este crédito de 900 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en uniformes para escolares.
Liliana sueña con tener un carro para su transporte.
texts.en:
Liliana Flor S. R. is 20 years old and a member of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. She lives in the Milan settlement, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru. Se completed ninth grade but did not go on with her studies because she had her daughter, who is now 4 years old. Liliana sells warm clothing, ponchos, pants, etc. according to what is worn in the area. Her first loan, which she used to buy babies clothing, was for 200 soles and was repaid in 4 installments. With this 900 sol loan, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy school uniforms. Liliana's dream is to own a car to move around in.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms.

loans.name: Salote

texts.en: Salote E., 31, is married with two children. She has one year of experience in the elei printing business (a style of cloth printing which is unique to Samoa and is used in much of Samoan clothing). She sells to the villagers and the general public two days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately 155 USD). SPBD loans are Salote’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, paints, brushes, elei board, etc.

loans.name: Delie

texts.en:
Delie S. is managing a small sari-sari store. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband, Bonifacio S., is very supportive of her in her business. In addition to her store, Delie also owns a small rice field. She and her husband till the land and plant rice and vegetables to supplement their income.

She is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise in her store. She thinks that having a larger display of goods will attract more customers. The loan will really help her family increase their income.

CEVI aims to help small business grow. It helps provide easy credit, training and insurance services to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy  additional stocks of merchandise

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Ana Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa cdra. 06, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y por los que cada día se empeña en seguir adelante.

Anita, como le dicen de cariño, es joven y con muchas ganas de cumplir sus sueños en el transcurso de su vida.

Se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas y anticuchos, tiene años ya trabajando con este negocio y le va muy bien ya que tiene bastante acogida en el barrio donde vive. Nos cuenta que una de sus metas es ahorrar mas, e implementar su propio restaurant, para esto tendría que ampliar mas su casa y dejarlo bien acondicionado y se siente con capacidad de lograrlo. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, pollos por kilos que compra a diario y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Cree que si pone más entusiasmo y optimismo podrá cumplir con sus sueños.
Dice: “Agradezco a Manuela Ramos por haberme ayudado a salir adelante y a iniciar mi negocio con un capital, ahora me siento una mujer realizada y capaz”.
texts.en:
Ana Consuelo belongs to the "Mi Sueño" communal bank. She lives on Jr. Santa Rosa cdra 6, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She has a common-law husband, is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children who she supports and who are the reason she perseveres every day. Anita, as she is affectionately called, is young and has a strong desire to fulfill her dreams during her lifetime. She sells prepared meals and anticuchos. She has been working in the business for years and it is going well because she is very well-established in her neighborhood. She tells us that one of her goals is to save more and start her own restaurant. To do this she will have to expand and remodel her house and she feels capable of achieving this. Currently she continues her business and personally attends to her customers with the charisma that characterizes her. With a loan for S/ 1,000.00, she would like to buy ingredients for preparing meals such kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, kilos of chicken which she buys daily and also some utensils for the business so she can give better service to her customers. She believes that with more enthusiasm and optimism she will be able to fulfill her dreams. She says, "I thank Manuel Ramos for having helped me get ahead and to start my business with a loan, now I feel like a fulfilled and capable woman."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Agadadash

texts.en: Agadadash T. has been dedicated to cattle farming for the past three years, and has vast experience in the field, as it is the only business he is in. He is married and waiting for a baby. His wife is also engaged in his business. This work is satisfying, and it enables Agadadash to purchase goods for his home. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Agadadash wants to buy more cattle, so he decided to apply for a loan of 1200 USD. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude for your generous heart.

loans.use: purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
EMMANUEL

La Alcom Emanuel fue formando hace ya 5 años, en este tiempo el  grupo nos enseña que la  unión y la perseverancia  deben reflejarse constantemente en nuestras vidas.
Presidenta: Maria P.. Tiene un negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones que comenzó hace 8 años. Con mucho esfuerzo en el 2001 construyó algunas habitaciones en su  casa que luego  decidió alquilarlas, este es su principal fuente de ingresos  pero además todos los veranos elabora yogurt de acuerdo a la gran cantidad  de pedidos.
Secretaria: Marisol M.. Empeñosa madre de familia  que luego de una difícil situación encontró que en el servicio de hospedaje había una oportunidad para cubrir los difíciles gastos escolares de sus  3 hijos y además podía utilizar el pequeño excedente en satisfacer otras necesidades.
Tesorera: Hilaria M. empezó junto con sus compañeras vendiendo comida informalmente hace 3 años, ahora tiene un puesto estable desde donde también  reparte comida a los obreros de las fábricas aledañas.
Las  socias agradecen todo el  beneficio que les ha brindado nuestros créditos en el crecimiento de sus negocios.
texts.en:
EMMANUEL La Alcom Emanuel fue formando hace ya 5 años, en este tiempo el grupo nos enseña que la unión y la perseverancia deben reflejarse constantemente en nuestras vidas. Presidenta: Maria P.. Tiene un negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones que comenzó hace 8 años. Con mucho esfuerzo en el 2001 construyó algunas habitaciones en su casa que luego decidió alquilarlas, este es su principal fuente de ingresos pero además todos los veranos elabora yogurt de acuerdo a la gran cantidad de pedidos. Secretaria: Marisol M.. Empeñosa madre de familia que luego de una difícil situación encontró que en el servicio de hospedaje había una oportunidad para cubrir los difíciles gastos escolares de sus 3 hijos y además podía utilizar el pequeño excedente en satisfacer otras necesidades. Tesorera: Hilaria M. empezó junto con sus compañeras vendiendo comida informalmente hace 3 años, ahora tiene un puesto estable desde donde también reparte comida a los obreros de las fábricas aledañas. Las socias agradecen todo el beneficio que les ha brindado nuestros créditos en el crecimiento de sus negocios.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia E. has a small bar where she prepares and sells a variety of foods made with pork at Atabadze near Elmina. Emilia has received primary education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a carpenter.

Emilia has been selling pork since 2005. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs and other ingredients for her cooking of goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and ingredients for her cooking

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. is from the town of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Esther is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcab transport services to local community members. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a loan of 23,314 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.en:
K. Zukhra, a widow and mother-of-one, describes herself as a hard-working and enterprising woman. She decided to start a sewing business many years ago because she wanted her child to get a good education. She started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop, and after learning the trade was subsequently offered a job. Eventually she started a small shop in her home. It has gone very well since then and she has been able to grow the business, making her famous in her community and increasing customer demand. Currently Zukhra is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni ($1150 USD) which she will use to purchase new sewing machine with computer-based embroidery so she can fulfill all her customers' requests. Zukhra is very grateful for your support in helping to grow her business and move ahead. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 22 años, es un joven muy carismático, es el tercero de 8 hermanos y vive en la casa de sus padres. El año pasado acaba de graduarse como profesor y actualmente viene dictando clases en uno de los colegios de su pueblo. Adicionalmente, tiene un negocio propio, el cual consiste en la venta de productos de panadería, como: pan de molde, queques y en temporada navideña, el tradicional panetón, productos que ofrece de casa en casa a sus familiares y vecinos para un pago al contado o al crédito.  Por otro lado, los fines de semana David trabaja en sus cultivos de café, pues también le gusta mucho esta labor, ya que desde niño apoyaba a sus padres en las chacras. La temporada más rentable del café es en los meses de junio a agosto y con el dinero que obtiene apoya a sus padres y hermanos menores en sus gastos. El dinamismo de David es muy contagiante y motivador para sus vecinos y también incentiva a sus hermanos para realizar un trabajo colectivo, porque sus anhelos son de que toda su familia progrese.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y ha demostrado ser un cliente muy responsable y bastante entendido en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cafetales y también incrementará la cantidad de sus productos de panadería.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old. He is a very charismatic young man. He is the third of eight siblings and lives in his parents house. Last year he graduated as a teacher, and he currently teaches classes in one of the high schools in his town. In addition, he has his own business, which consists of selling baked goods, like: bread, cakes and at Christmas time, the traditional Christmas cake. He offers these products from door to door to his family and neighbors for payment by cash or credit. In addition, on the weekend David works growing coffee. He also greatly enjoys this work as he has been helping his parents on their farm since he was a child. The most profitable season for coffee is in the months from June to August and with the money he obtains, he helps his parents and his younger siblings with their expenses. David's energy is very contagious and motivates his neighbors and encourages his siblings to work together because his aspirations are that his entire family progresses. This is his second loan with MFP and he has demonstrated himself to be a very responsible and knowledgeable client in his community bank. With the money he solicits, he will buy chemical fertilizers for his coffee and also increase the quantity of baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae D. J., 22 years old, is a single young businesswoman. Hard work and patience is the guiding principle of Mae. At present, she would like to borrow PHP 5,000, which will serve as additional capital for her sari-sari (general store) business. Expansion of her store is what she wants to happen in order for her to support her family's needs.

Mae would be thankful if her loan request is approved. She is aiming for the improvement of her store and to have a better living.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: M. Joseph is a hard-working businessman and a permanent resident of Kyankuta Kirongo ward. He runs a timber business at Kaguta Road, Kyenjojo town council. He is a single father of seven children; his wife died five years back. He wishes to purchase more timber to expand his business. Timber is in high demand, so he wishes to increase his stock so as to meet the demand of his customers. His dream is to see all his children through school and see them having a great future.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to expand his business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian G. sells palm oil, frytol oil (vegetable cooking oil) and other kinds of oil for cooking, and also for the making of local soaps, at Elmina fish pot.  Vivian has received a senior high school education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. Vivian has been selling palm oil, frytoyl, and so on since 1999. She helps her husband in the payment of utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy palm oil, frytol and other kinds of oil to re-sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy palm oil, frytol and other kinds of oil to re-sell.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Nguon S. is 22 years old and sells fruits in the Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$1.30 every day, while her husband is a horse-cart driver making US$4.10 per day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$500 that her husband needs to purchase a new horse-cart.

loans.use: To purchase a horse-cart.

loans.name: Rosavic

texts.en:
Rosavic is a single 35-year-old entrepreneur trying to earn income to help her family with their daily needs and to save for her future. She lives in the village of Brgy Alejandria, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental.

Rosavic joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in October 2003 in order to open her own business. Upon receiving her first loan, she started a fish-vending and ready-to-wear (RTW) business so she could help her parents. Unfortunately, her fish-vending business lasted for for only two years.

When she received her 6th cycle loan, she invested in a pig-fattening business and added it to her RTW business. With succeeding loans, her businesses got bigger and earned good money. She also invested in frozen products for additional income. She is able to earn about $152 a month at a minimum. She saves most of her income for the future and for her family.

With the utilization of her previous loan of 7,000 PHP to buy frozen products, Rosavic was able pay in full and on time without any delay, giving her recognition as a good performing member by maintaining her good credit record to the center and to NWTF-PD. At present, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for her pig-fattening business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her pig-fattening business

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda es una madre de familia de 62 años de edad, hace dos meses falleció su esposo y actualmente  vive junto a una hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas en la puerta de su casa. Ella vende frutas de acuerdo a la estación climática a sus habituales clientes. Este negocio le ha ayudado a afrontar los gastos familiares y actualmente se vale de él para sustentarse.

Olinda desea ampliar su negocio durante esta temporada ya que las frutas como el mango, la ciruela, el pacae y el tamarindo abundan durante el verano y estas frutas son muy solicitadas en esta época para preparar bebidas debido al sofocante calor. Olinda no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Olinda no ha decaído a pesar de la ausencia de su esposo y desea seguir trabajando. Su más grande anhelo es instalar una bodega con la cual pueda seguir saliendo adelante en los próximos años.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 62 year old mother. Her husband passed away two months ago and she currently lives with one of her daughters in the district of Cayalti, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years she has run a small fruit-selling business at the entrance of her home. She sells seasonal fruits to her usual customers. This business has helped her to cover household expenses and she currently relies on it to support herself. Olinda hopes to expand her business during this time of year because fruits such as mango, plum, pacay fruit and tamarind are in great supply in the summer. These fruits are very sought after in this season to prepare drinks, because of the stifling heat. Olinda does not have enough funds to do this herself, and for this reason she is for the first time asking for a loan of 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Olinda has not let her husband’s absence get her down, and she wants to keep working. Her greatest hope is to set up a small grocery store with which she can keep moving ahead in the coming years.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit to expand business.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Moeun P. is a widow and a good mother to two children. One child still attends school, while the other child works as a truck driver. To help contribute to the family’s income, Moeun P. distills traditional white wine out of her home, which she then sells. In addition, Moeun P. uses the leftover distilled wine to feed a few pigs for extra revenue. She is able to make $7.66 each day, which she uses to help her family’s financial crisis and ensure that her school-aged child attains the highest level of education. Moeun P. is taking out her loan to purchase food and ten piglets to breed.

loans.use: To purchase food and ten piglets to breed.

loans.name: Enike

texts.en:
Enike L. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy more powdered milk, sugar and tea leaves. Enike is 39 years old and married to a peasant. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more powdered milk, sugar and tea leaves

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité Nuevo Horizonte nace hace poco mas de 7 meses para tener acceso al crédito y demás servicios que ofrecen la fundación. Se unieron varias vecinas que se conocen desde hace varios años y a partir de ahí tomaron el habito de reunirse todos los domingos por las tardes, se ayudan bastante y todas juntas están aprendiendo a construir su comité. 
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de los artículos dependiendo de la actividad a que se dedica. .
Así la Señora Rosana se dedica a la venta de ropa y lo realiza de manera ambulante visitando a los clientes a quienes ofrece sus productos para vender.
Las actividades a que se dedican las demás integrantes son:

texts.en:
The “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) Committee started more than seven months ago so that its members could access credit and other services offered by the Foundation. The group consists of several neighbors who have known each other for many years and conducts its meetings every Sunday evening. They help each other out and are learning together how to build their committee.

This loan will be used to purchase items based on their respective business activities. Sra. Rosana sells clothing as a traveling merchant who visits her customers to offer the products she has available to sell. The business activities carried out by each member are as follows:

1. Mirna G. – clothing sales 2. Leila B. – shoe sales 3. Isabel B. – food sales 4. Zulma A. – sales of cakes /sweets 5. Ramona O. – sewing 6. Paulina C. – clothing sales 7. Jazmin G. – food and beverage sales 8. Luz G. – clothing sales 9. Reinera D. – vending kiosk 10. Zunilda G. – costume jewelry sales 11. Cresencia R. – grocery store 12. Dora P. – food sales 13. Laura I. – cosmetic sales 14. Romina A. – fruit sales 15. Ever A. – clothing sales 16. Liz A. – clothing sales 17. Petrona P. – costume jewelry sales 18. Lilia T. – charcoal sales 19. Claudelina C. – clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Mikisa Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: M. Jessie at the top left is the leader of her lending group and also appears in the group photo. She is a widow with 3 children, one of them a professor, and she takes care of her siblings. Jessie has had a retail shop in Kikooza for 8 years and although her shop has inadequate capital, she is able to make 100,000/= as profits every week. She is where she is with her shop because she has a good selection of what she sells hence attracting more customers each day. She hopes to expand her shop to be able to sell more as well as maintaining her good standard of living. She is a hard-working lady and hopes to expand her shop by buying more general merchandise for her shop with the loan.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with general merchandise.

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang D. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3ans et demi et a bénéficié de 7 prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés sans difficulté. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits halieutiques tels que du poisson séchés et du poisson fumé, de l'huile de palme et des balais traditionnels.
texts.en:
Mbayang D. is a 49 year-old married mother of eight. She has been a member of a Banc Villageois (credit association) for three and a half years, and has received seven loans which have all been successfully repaid. She operates a small business selling fish products such as dried fish, smoked fish, and other products, such as palm oil and traditional brooms.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her financial prospects

loans.name: Rosa Janet

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene a su cargo dos niños con necesidades especiales. Viven en el sector Tambo Real, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, situado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas junto a su esposo desde hace ya varios años. Ella tiene una hectárea de terreno heredada de su padre en donde siembran granos y verduras para venderlas y hacerse de ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos familiares, adicionalmente ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (aves y cerdos) con la cual se generan un ingreso extra.

Actualmente Rosa y su esposo han sembrado maíz en su terreno, el cultivo esta en buenas condiciones y ellos necesitan brindarle mantenimiento, por este motivo se han visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensan utilizar en la compra de abonos y foliares para mejorar la calidad de su cultivo.

Rosa es una mujer bantante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder hacer mejoras en la vivienda en la que vive ya que esta construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old, is married and has two children with special needs. They live in Tambor Real, a rural zone in the Pitipo district, Ferreñafe Province, located an hour away from Chiclayo city. Rosa has worked in agriculture with her husband for several years. She has a hectare of land, inherited from her father, on which she sows grains and vegetables to sell so she can cover the family's expenses. She also raises and sells farmyard animals (birds and pigs) for extra income. Currently Rosa and her husband have sown corn on their land. The crop is doing well, and they need to maintain it. This is why they had to ask Edpyme Alternativa for their first loan of 1000 new soles, with which they want to purchase supplies and foliar fertilizers to improve crop quality. Rosa is very hard-working and dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to improve their house since it is built of rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and foliar fertilizers for maintenance of corn crop

loans.name: Sari Amertha 1 Group

texts.en: Ni Made Y. (0) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. Ni Made is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Amertha 1 (MUK-0016). Ni Made is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Ni Made joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from MUK. Ni Made plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here. ***************************************************** Ni Made Y. (0) merupakan 42 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Made adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 4 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Amertha 1 (MUK-0016). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Made bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari. Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir. Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria tiene la edad de 48 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante, además que las personas ya conocen que ella se dedica a esa actividad por eso le encargan una variedad de ropa. Además, así podrá asegurar a su hijos estudios universitarios, ya que ella no pudo finalizar sus estudios es por eso que quiere proporcionarle estos ingresos. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria is 48 years old and has one child who is still in her care. She has been selling clothes as a traveling merchant for more than three years. People know that she offers a variety of clothing. In addition, she wants to secure a college education for her children since she was not able to do the same for herself. This is why she earns an income. Ana Maria will invest her loan in the purchase of trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses. She dreams of making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more clothing

loans.name: Nyame Mmre Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a 41-year-old woman who describes herself as hard-working.  She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 3 and 18 years old.  She hopes she can help all of her children secure decent jobs. For the past 7 years, Veronica has operated a trading business where she sells yams and bags of rice.  She will use the loan to buy more yams and bags of rice.  Veronica would like to eventually open a big supermarket in her community.

Veronica is the leader of the trust bank group named "Nyame Mmere", which means “God's Time” in Twi.  Twi is the most commonly spoken language in Ghana, especially in the Ashanti region.  There are 7 members in this group.  The other group members are engaged in trades such as charcoal retailer, palm oil retailer, groundnut (also known as peanut) retailer and an egg retailer.  Veronica ensures that all of the members attend meetings and submit timely repayments. She believes that she was elected group leader because she is a unifier.

loans.use: To purchase rice and yams in bulk

loans.name: Sea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sea S. , a 32-year old mother of two children who are attending the local public school,  is the leader of a four-perS. group loan In Boeng Kraom village in Kandal Province. Sea is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land upon which she grows crops to sell in order to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Choeurn K., is fisherman.  Sea is now requesting  a loan to buy timber to repair their aging home.

loans.use: To buy timber to repair her house

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rosalia tiene 45 años de edad,  la socia es madre soltera y tiene un 1 hijo de 18 años de edad; La socia tiene un pequeño taller de costurería. La socia hace prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de costura, ella comprara telas, hilos y otros.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosalia belongs to the YANAPAKUY communal bank. She lives in the district of Santiago, in Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. She is 45 years old and the single mother of an 18-year-old son. She has a small tailoring workshop, where she creates clothing for men, women and children. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying materials for her tailoring business, including fabrics, thread and other supplies. Rosalia infinitely values and appreciates the loan offered to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics and thread to make clothing

loans.name: Hot

texts.en:
Mr. Hot R. is a humble villager living in a rural area of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is a domestic house constructor who has been working in this sector since he was single. Now he is married with a lovely young kid who depends on his income. His wife stays at home to care for the kid and also works on the field by growing rice and vegetable crops to sell for a profit.

In the past, not having their own animal, Hot R.’s wife always hired a neighbor’s cow to help plow their farmland. Hot R. now hopes to reduce this fee by asking for a loan to purchase an ox. With any remaining cash from the loan, he will buy fertilizer to fatten the crops.

loans.use: To purchase an ox for plowing

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn B. is 33 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Tinabalan outside of Gingoog City in Northern Mindanao. Ronalyn owns and operates a mini-restaurant from which she serves a variety of different meals to customers from the local community. Ronalyn has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ronalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to renovate the business. Ronalyn is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, of 9000 PHP to be used for business supplies and working capital. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase business supplies and obtain working capital.

loans.name: Helen Group

texts.en:
Helen T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Helen Group. Helen is 41 years old, married, and has seven children between four and 24 years old. She also cares for one sibling. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to lack of financial support. For three years, she has been selling soft drinks and water on Benson Street, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more crates of soft drinks and more gallons of water. She describes herself as an earnest woman. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sopherger is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks and water to sell.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Marcos;  El tiene 47 años de edad,  es viudo y tiene 2 hijos,  se dedica a la mecánica automotriz, el socio tiene un taller de mecánica y mantenimiento de autos, el socio estudio esta profesión desde muy joven y toda su vida se ha dedicado a esto, es un negocio super rentable y le gusta mucho su profesión, el socio desea comprar algunas herramientas para implementar su taller. El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de herramientas para implementar su taller.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marcos is a member of the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” loan group, based in the Santiago district in the province and department of Cusco. Marcos is 47 years old. He is a widower with two children and works as a mechanic. He owns a vehicle repair and maintenance garage. From an early age he studied to become a mechanic and he has been in this line of business all of his life. It´s a very profitable business and he enjoys it very much. He would like to buy some tools for his garage and so is requesting the loan to pay for them. He is thankful for the loan, which he values highly, and pledges to pay it back in the agreed terms.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of tools for his garage.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del Banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desD. hace diez años, pertenece al distrito y provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 67 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, cursó hasta primero D. primaria, tiene seis hijos, todos independientes.
Se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, para pagar al Banquito Comunal debe vender 02 unidades cada cuatro meses. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó su capital D. trabajo.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar dos toros.
Su visión es seguir adelante con el negocio del engorD. D. ganado vacuno. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son los intereses que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Maxima has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past 10 years. It is located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 67 years old and she is married. She has a graD. 1 education. She has six grown children. She is a cattle farmer and to make her payments she must make 2 sales every four months. The first loan requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was for 300 nuevos soles and it was use as working capital. She requests a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase two bulls. Her dream is to keep her cattle farming business prosperous. What she most enjoys about the community bank is the interest earned from the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls.

loans.name: Liverpool Group

texts.en:
Habiba S. is in her early thirties and is married with five children. She owns a food stall which she has been operating for one year. The stall is open from 5 am to 10 pm daily, and earns Habiba a good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use this loan on improving the condition of her food stall, as well as decorating it. Habiba's dream is to increase her profit so that she can improve and expand her house.

Habiba will share the loan with her loan group, Liverpool, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for paying back the loans.

In the picture, Habiba is seen in the front row, 1st on the left, wearing light blue.

loans.use: The improvement of her stall

loans.name: Mary Maame Zinabu

texts.en: Mary Maame Zinabu S. is married and has three children. She has no educational background. Mary sells porridge at Elmina. She has been in this business for six years. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mary will use the loan amount to purchase more ingredients to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to add another kind of business to her trade.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients to prepare porridge

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a resident of Sumandri, which is a small city located in Punjab. This city is a big market for rugs in Pakistan. All types of rugs (simple and designer) are available there for buying.  

She performs her duties as a housewife as well as a business person. She not only manages her household responsibilities well but also gives the required time to her clothing business. She sells clothes to financially support her family. She imports clothes from Faisalabad, which is very near to Samundri and famous for its textile industry, and sells to her local area clients. She has a good number of clients and receives regular orders every month.
 
She is married to M. R., who operates a dairy business. He has some dairy cows at his home and sells their milk to different milk shops in order to earn a good income.  

Surriya has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her clothing business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity that will lower her purchasing cost and enable her to attract more clients by introducing more of a variety of clothes to them. She is very confident that she will be able to make good changes to her current business situation with the help of this loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book in her hands (called the Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy clothes of a different variety for her clothing business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic P. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marivic from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying, harvesting and selling green bananas and coconuts in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional crops. Emma is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. is 40 years old and is married to George.  They come from Katito and have four children between the ages of 20 years and 14 years old. 

Hellen has a food Kiosk that she has been running for the past four years. She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy food ingredients like flour, cooking fat, sugar, salt etc.  She is also in dire need of plates and cups to add to her stock. Hellen earns a montlhy income of Kshs 5,000. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children. 

Her desire is to be able to open up a big hotel one day in the future

loans.use: Buy food ingredients, plates and cups to add to her stock.

loans.name: Julieven

texts.en:
Julieve Manawan is 21 years of age, married, and a resident of Bocator, Tangub City. For her source of income, she operates a sari-sari store business. For two years, she was able to maintain her business even in hard times.  Julieve is presently earning an average net income of about 3,000 PHP,  which is very helpful for herself and her close relatives.

Julieve joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in its products and services.  PAGLAUM MPC is one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and was awarded for being the most outstanding cooperative in the Philippines by the COOP-LGU Partnership in 2006. As a newly recognized member, Julieve was able to borrow  3,000 PHP, which she used  to add to her capital for her existing sari-sari store business. The future income from this business will be used for her daily basic needs, loan repayments, and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To acquire additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Teresforo

texts.en: Teresforo is a 62 year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda, with an ambition of having a family estate. He is a farmer and has been in this practice for forty years now which has enabled him to pay school fees for his children as most of them are now graduates.  His business plan is to become a commercial farmer owning at least a hundred acres of tea plantation.  Teresforo needs the loan to plant tea.

loans.use: Planting tea

loans.name: Talaat

texts.en: Talaat is a 21-year-old young man from Hebron. Talaat studies mechanical engineering. He graduates next semester and will start working on his graduation project and final seminar. Talaat came to FATEN for a loan to pay for last semester's tuition fees as well as purchase all the items needed for his graduation project. Talaat's brother is a Palestinian National Authority employee, who will help him pay back the loan until he graduates and starts working. Talaat appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: For university tuition fees

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna V. is a 44-year-old single woman who lives in La Castellana in Negros Occidental province in the Visayas islands. She supports her family through two businesses: a sari-sari (general) store and a pig-fattening venture. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP.

Johna is borrowing 20,000 PHP, her fifteenth loan from NWTF, so that she can fund her operations. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Johna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her sari-sari store and pig-fattening business

loans.name: Doris Maria

texts.es:
Doris Maria  de  30 años de edad, labora como asistente del Alcalde del Coral Chontales desde hace 3 años, cuando ella se va a su trabajo sus hijos quedan al cuido de su mamà, su compañero de vida la ayuda economicamente con los gastos de hogar ya que son bien unidos segun referencias laborales, personales y crediticias es una mujer bien responsable con sus compromisos y ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida en su vivienda mediante prestamos con Kiva a quien agradece mucho por esta oportunidad.   

Solicita su segundo credito para comprar materiales de construcciòn y una vez que tenga cierta cantidad mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que su salario es bien bajo y no ajusta para comprar de un solo el material. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es mejorar sus ingresos economicos y que a sus hijos no les falte nada
texts.en:
Doris Maria, 30, started working as an assistant to the mayor of Coral Chontales three years ago. When she goes to work, her mother cares for her children. Her life partner helps financially with the household expenses and they are very united.  According to her professional, personal, and credit references, she is a very responsible woman when it comes to her obligations. She has been working to improve her quality of life through Kiva loans and is very grateful for this opportunity.

She is requesting her second loan to buy construction materials, and once she has enough, she will improve the structure of her home. Her salary is fairly low and not sufficient to buy the materials all at once.

Her greatest dreams in life are to improve her income and for her children not to lack anything.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Edgar Percy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar Percy; el tiene 68 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio es trabajador cesante de una empresa privada, el socio cuenta con un carrito que a veces suele trabajarlo brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia, ahora el socio desea comprar una congeladora para así poder alquilarlo y tener otro ingreso mas.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de un congelador para  poder alquilarlo y de esta manera sacar un dinero extra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar Percy is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Sebastian” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 68 years old, married, and has three children. Edgar was released from his job at a private company. He now has a small automobile that he occasionally uses to provide taxi services. Edgar is a cheerful individual and enthusiastic about moving ahead with his family. Now he wants to buy a freezer that he can rent out to generate additional income.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a freezer that can be rented out to earn some extra money. Edgar is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer that he can rent out for extra income

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married lady with a three-year-old child.  She operates a mobile-money transfer business for a living.  She has been running the business for eight years.  She was previously selling second-hand clothes.  She has improved her business through Faulu Kenya and now has better living standards.  She hopes to open another outlet of her business in the future.  She has requested  60,000 Kes to buy airtime float.

loans.use: To buy airtime float (cellular time)

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 29 years old, single and a very hardworking, gentle man. Jean has a shop in which he sells rice, salt and maize flour. He has been in business for two years, and his shop has enabled him to meet his needs.

Jean is requesting a loan to buy rice, salt and maize flour in order to increase his profits. In the future he plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy rice, salt and maize flour

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
