Eugenia es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío La Matanza del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Eugenia cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brindan. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 37, lives with her family in the tiny village of La Matanza in the agricultural Tambogrande district around Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque region.

Eugenia has a small general store in her house that she has run for four years. There she sells many everyday items, groceries and basic necessities to her neighbors and customers from around the area. The business has been well received due to the high quality of the products and service offered. With the income from this business she has been able to help with her family's household expenses. 

Due to the increased demand that her store has been experiencing, she has been thinking about enlarging it and getting more products. Therefore, she thought it best to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which she hopes to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath Y. is a widow with one son and three daughters. One of her children attends school and the others have full-time employment. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.    

Sambath is a garment factory worker. She is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kidne G. is 40 years old, married to a farmer and makes a living by selling fish. She and her husband have four children, only one of whom is not yet in school. Her long-term goal is to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fish. She is 30 years old, married, with 2 children and all of them go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Herrinta

texts.en:
Herrinta is married to an electrician.  She has four children.  She has been through junior high school.  Herrinta sells doughnuts in front of her electrical and provisions shop at Elmina, which she has done for 3 years. 

She uses her income to support the education and feeding of the children.  The loan when received will be invested into the doughnut, electrical and provision business.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Herrinta plans to reinvest back into her business.  She is currently standing in front of the electrical shop.

loans.use: The loan when received will be invested into the doughnut, electrical and provision business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide for his second crop of corn

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
From the province of Siem Reap, Mrs. Pich has been working in the agriculture sector since 2000. She makes a low income from this business, $4 each day, to cover the daily expenses of the family. Her husband also contributes to the family's income; he fishes along the Tunle Sap River. 

Mrs. Pich usually sells fish that her husband catches, as well as those she purchases from other fishermen, for additional income. Presently, the couple has to hire a motor taxi when they need to pick up their fish to sell because they don't have their own vehicle. 

This is the reason why Mrs. Pich is seeking a loan in the amount of $700 to buy a new motorbike for picking up her fish. She will also use part of the loan to purchase more fish for resale. Mrs. Pich has three children; one is married and two are single.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike and also to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco, conocimos al señor Benigno y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Cusco, tengo 44 años edad, tengo seis hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kocineri – Kumpire a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mi actividad económica que es la construcción de casas, agricultura y crianza de animales menores”. 

Benigno es una persona emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a la construcción de casas y le ha ido muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos. Benigno y su esposa pertenecen al banco comunal “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” de la Asociación Arariwa. El sueño de Benigno es convertirse en una empresario y ser distribuidor mayorista de pollos y desea trabajar por las zonas de Ivochote, Kimbiri, Pichari, etc.
texts.en:
In the minor town center of Kiteni, Quillabamba district, La Convencion province, in Cusco, we meet Mr Benigno and he tells us:

"I was born in the city of Cusco. I am 44, I have 6 children, and I now live in the city of Kocineri - Kumpire, 10 minutes from the city of Kiteni, where I have my businesses: building houses, agriculture, and raising small animals".

Benigno is an enterprising person who gets his family ahead. For 10 years he has built houses and it has gone very well for him. He currently needs a loan to purchase chickens. Benigno and his wife belong to the  Asociacion Arariwa's "Choclo de Oro de Kiteni" communal bank. Benigno's dream is to be a businessman and a wholesale chicken distributor. He wants to distribute to the Ivochote, Kimbiri, and Pichari zones, among others.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Marcelo Ruben

texts.es: Macelo Rubén es un hombre muy trabajador él tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo, el dio inicio a su negocio por cuenta propia ya que tenía experiencia por sus padres que le habían enseñado este medio de vida. El financiamiento que el solicita es para la compra de dos cerdos. El sueño de él es brindarle ciertas remodelaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Marcelo Rubén is a very hardworking man.  He has two minor children in his care.  His economic activity is buying and selling pigs.  He started the business on his own initiative since he had experience from his parents who had taught him this way of earning a living.  The loan he’s requesting is to buy two pigs.  His dream is to do certain home improvements.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 44 years old, married and has three children. Emmy is starting a business venture involving planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Emmy needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as wheel-barrow, knives, axe and spade.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve her business.

Emmy joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Emmy's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as wheel-barrow, knives, axe and spade

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 25 лет. Разведена. Имеет одного ребенка. Сейчас она живет вместе с родителями. Ее отец и брат находятся в России. Сама Махбуба занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки яблок, винограда, риса и масла.
texts.en: Mahbuba lives in the Khuroson district.  She is 25 years old, divorced and has one child.  Currently, she lives together with her parents.  Her father and brother are in Russia.  Mahbuba is involved in sales of fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for eight years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of apples, grapes, rice and oil.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, rice and oil

loans.name: Roberto José

texts.es: Roberto está estudiando Licenciatura en Informática y Computación, está en la última etapa y el crédito solicitado es para pagar los cursos de graduación y así obtener su título. Roberto tiene un empleo y con eso cubre los costos de escuela. Con su título espera poder aspirar a nuevas oportunidades de trabajo, ya que sin el título es muy difícil poder conseguir un buen pago salarial. Su inspiración es su madre ya que como madre soltera pudo mantener el hogar y sacar a sus tres hijos adelante. Lleva dos años tratando de conseguir su titulación y espera que con el préstamo lo pueda finalmente hacer.
texts.en: Roberto is studying towards a Bachelors in Computer Science; he’s in the last stages of it and is asking for a loan to cover graduation costs so that he can obtain his degree.  Roberto has a job and can cover school costs from it.  With his degree he hopes to attain better job opportunities because without the degree it’s been very difficult to earn a good weekly salary.  His mother is his inspiration because she’s managed to raise her three children as a single mother.  He’s been trying to attain his degree for two years and hopes that with the loan he’ll finally be able to do so.

loans.use: to pay graduation costs.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru:
Катерина – из Ужгорода. Она торгует на одном из местных рынков, продает мужскую и женскую одежду. У Катерины одно торговое место, товар всегда пользуется спросом, есть своя клиентская база. Бизнесом Катерина занимается уже около 12 лет. Размер чистой прибыли превышает 3 500 гривен. 

Катерина планирует вложить 10 000 гривен в закупку дополнительного количества одежды для продажи в своем киоске. Катерина предприимчива и трудолюбива. Она полна сил и энергии и готова усиленно трудиться, чтобы и в дальнейшем развивать свое дело и улучшать свои условия проживания.    

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Katerina is from Uzhgorod.  She sells men's and women's clothing at one of the local markets.  Katerina has one retail outlet, her merchandise is always is demand, and she has her own customer base.  Katerina has been involved in business for about 12 years.  Her net profit exceeds 3 500 hryvnia.  Katerina plans to invest 10 000 hryvnia into the purchase of an additional inventory of clothing for sale at her store.  She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working person.  She is full of strength and energy and ready to work diligently to further develop her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an additional inventory of clothing for sale at her store

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is a 39-year-old farmer from the village Vazisubani, Gurjaani District. Khvicha lives with his family: wife Lela, 19-year-old daughter and father. Khvicha’s daughter is a student. 

Khvicha owns a peach garden on family owned 2 hectares of land. He also seasonally grows strawberries on 0.15 hectares and fruit for wine on 0.2 hectares. Khvicha sells all harvested fruit locally. Khvicha owns a tractor. He tills his own land as well as that of neighboring farmers. The family also owns a horse. Khvicha’s father works as night watchman in a local store. The total average income of the family is 660 Laris (approximately 400 USD) per month.

Khvicha requested credit to finance 3 activities. He will purchase an additional 0.7 hectares of agricultural land. He will use it productively and increase the amount of fruit sold. He will also use the credit to purchase chemicals to treat the peach trees for parasites. That is the prerequisite of a good peach harvest next summer. With the third part of the credit Khvicha will renovate part of the family house. After using the credit for the above mentioned purposes, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase land and chemicals for treating peach-trees for parasites

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconut water and dried coconuts.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem, 37, is in the business of cultivating rice in Prey Chor, Kompong Cham province. She is married with 4 single children, all of whom live under her care and income. Some of them are at the age for attending school but they are still not enrolled yet because of the family’s condition. The main source of her income comes from her husband who provides a battery charging service to the people in and around the community. He charges KHR1,000 per battery for a bigger battery and KHR5,00 for a smaller one. He’s able to earn an average of $4.00 a day. 

The main core of this business activity is based on how the electric generator works. But unluckily, her previous device is too old and dangerous to use. So Choem decided to request some funds from HKL and Kiva to support her husband's business. She’ll use these funds to buy an electric generator which will allow her husband’s business to further improve in the future. With the increase in her income, she’ll send her children to join a class in a local school next year.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in Uganda. He is married and has six children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells different types of clothing. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale, and it will help Joseph to generate greater profits and improve his family's well being. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a wholesale business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 27 years old and married with four children. The oldest child is seven years old. Milagros’s husband is a fisherman.

Milagros provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community. She also sells fish at the market. Milagros said she is able to help buy her family’s daily needs through these jobs. She requested a loan to buy nail polish, a cuticle remover, and an icebox for selling fish. 

Milagros hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, a cuticle remover, and an icebox for selling fish

loans.name: Randall Francisco

texts.es:
Randall es un señor de 27 años de edad el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

El tiene la motivación y la ayuda de sus familiares, lo cual le facilita seguir con su vida. Además  le es muy importante adquirir este medio de transporte, ya que la demanda es cada vez más fuerte y los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado, ya que Randall es obrero de construcción.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Randall es un micro crédito de ¢596,000(quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para comprar una motocicleta para movilizarse a su trabajo todos los días, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Randall es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Randall is a 27 year old man who lives with his family in Osa, which is located in Caña Blancal, in the province of Puntarenas. This area is known for being a rural zone much visited for its beaches. Its main economic activities are tourism and agriculture.

He has both the motivation and the support of his relatives which makes it easy to get on with life. In addition, it is very important to him to acquire this form of transport as the demand is getting stronger and the residents have been satisfied with the service provided, as Randall is a construction worker.

What Randall is currently asking for is a microloan of ¢596,000 (five hundred and ninety six thousand coronas) (CRC) to buy a motorcycle to get to work every day and to give the best possible service and support to his project.

Randall is a member of  the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, one of the 150 member organisations of EDESA in Coasta Rica. With this loan he hopes to grow on a personal and economic level. He also notes that thanks to these kinds of organisations and their loan facilities he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his work.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 37 years old and married to John Maina. She and her husband are blessed with two children. She runs a boutique where she sells clothes, accessories, and other ladies' items. She runs an M-PESA [a mobile phone-based money transfer service] as a secondary business. She has been in  this business for 10 years, earning profits of KES 11,000 per month, which provide for her family’s needs.

This is her first loan with KADET, which she will use to add more float [money supply] to her M-PESA business. She hopes to earn more profit, which she will use to boost both of her businesses.

In addition to growing her business, Alice hopes to buy a plot of land and to educate her children to her utmost ability.

loans.use: to increase the money supply for her money-transfer service.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Rona has a food shop or sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 49 years old and a single mother of two children.  She has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 with KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop within her locality.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Djrado Group

texts.fr: DJRADO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, Dédodede Pierre (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 42 ans. Pierre est mariée à une certaine Léa. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Dédodede Pierre vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Dédodede Pierre a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Dédodede Pierre vend depuis dix ans du maïs et de la farine de manioc dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Dédodede Pierre vend des fournitures scolaires. Dédodede Pierre s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Dédodede Pierre sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJRADO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: "Djrado" is a group comprising three people who live in the same area in Benin. The group representative, Dédodede Pierre (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 42 years old. Pierre is married to a woman named Léa. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Dédodede Pierre lives together with his wife and children. The couple provide for the household together. Dédodede Pierre ended his studies in primary school. To meet his various needs, Dédodede Pierre has sold maize and manioc flour in his area for ten years. On the side, he also sells school supplies. Dédodede Pierre gets his supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying his customers and expanding his business, he is seeking a fifth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Djrado group. This loan will serve to better respond to the demands of their customers and earn higher profits. The four previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, manioc flour, and boxes of school supplies.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: ESPOIR est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marina Alida (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans. Marina Alida a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Marina Alida est mariée à un certain Nicolas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Marina Alida vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Marina Alida vend du poisson frais depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marina Alida s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marina Alida sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ESPOIR, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du poisson.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge résidant à Adidogomè. Agée de 51 Kossiwa est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Kossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de culottes et de tricots en vue de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.

loans.use: Acheter 200 unités de colottes et 250 unités de tricots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Josephine would like to stock her small household items store.

loans.name: Estebina

texts.en:
I have dedicated myself to selling candy, drinks, water, juice, cookies and the the like for four years. My business is located in the suburbs near one of the country's public hospitals. It's for this reason I need to add more supplies to my business, since there are a large amount of visitors daily, and that will help me generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me dedico a la venta de dulces, refrescos, agua, jugos, galletas desde hace cuatro años, mi negocio esta ubicado en las cercanias de uno de los hospitales publicos de nuestro pais, es por eso que necesito surtir mi negocio ya que a diario los visitantes son bastantes, esto me ayudara a mejorar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Buy candy, water, fruit, churros, cookies, juice, etc.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a small welding shop in Kirkuk. He was married two months ago. His house is rented, as well as his shop. He applied for his first loan from Al-Aman to purchase a new welding machine. He wants to paint his shop and hire two laborers to work with him on the new welding machine. He wants to expand and develop his shop. As he said, "I want to see my shop grow."

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new welding machine

loans.name: Akim

texts.en: A. Akim is a dynamic and courageous 29-year-old man. He is married and has a 5-month-old daughter. Akim owns an artisan cereal processing workshop in Koumassi, a township in the southern area of Abidjan, where he lives with his family. His workshop is in Koumassi’s open market and nearby his potential customers. Akim heard from AE&I in July, 2005 from his sister and joined our microcredit program at the same time. Akim has performed very well so far. He wants to acquire new machinery and repair parts to increase his performance and processing capacities.

loans.use: Arowossegbe Akim will use the loan to purchase new machinery

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with 6 children and is a poultry and dairy farmer. She has been in this business since 1998 and is a member of Twegatte Women’s Group where she works as the treasurer of the group. She hopes to buy feeds once given the loans and her future plan is to set up a modern farm at her home place in Bukeka. She supplies schools and some traders from Busia with eggs and the milk is sold to the local community.

loans.use: Judith wants to buy animal and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old. He has 3 children. They are going to school. He has a small bakery shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new bakery machine. He also wants to paint the shop and renovate it by expanding the area. He plans to hire two unemployed people to work with him in order to increase his income, develop himself, and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new bakery machine

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng C., age 41, is a vendor selling foodstuffs and provisions from her home, earning around $2 each day. Her husband is a policeman, making $1 each day. They have four children, two who work as security guards and two who are students. Cheng would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work. She can also use the bike to purchase supplies for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Ami

texts.en: Ami, a 48 year old widow, has been selling vegetables at her house since her husband passed away a long time ago. She has to work by herself to provide for her family's needs, earning USD5 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital, and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 25-year-old single man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. Mohamad sells mobile phones. This is the first time Mohamad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 1200 to buy new merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his mobile phone business

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en: Iluminada is in her late thirties, and she and her husband have three children, two girls and one boy, all of whom go to school. Her husband is mechanic. To supplement her family’s income, Iluminada sells fruits and vegetables, and she also prepares spicy sausage pork. Her business helps her support her own university studies. Actually, Iluminada studies Educational Psychology. The entrepreneur says that education is the only gate to richness. “People don’t strike it rich; anyone has to work hard to improve her living conditions," she adds. Iluminada will use her loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and raw materials for her business. She says she’ll keep working hard for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables for a small business.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 42 years old and the married mother of 3 children, who are currently in school. She has been preparing and selling cooked rice, yams, and assorted biscuits for schoolchildren in her village for 8 years now. Paulina wants to use her loan to buy more bags of rice, crates of eggs, frozen foods, and more tubers of fresh yams. Paulina is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, tubers of fresh yams, vegetables, and frozen foods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. sells plastic bags and other products to fishermen. She is single and her income is not sufficient to support her and her two children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling plastic bags and other products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and the mother of 6 children. All her children are currently in school. Grace treks to the nearby villages to buy her products and retails them in Kumasi, where she has good sales and gets additional income to support her family. She wants to buy more farm products to avoid price hikes as the country enters the farming season. She wants to use the loan to buy plantains and cocoyams. Grace is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bunches of plantains and bags of cocoyams

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac A. is a tailor who sews different styles of clothing for his customers. He is 52 years old and married with four children. Isaac lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where he has been in business since 1980. He is seeking a loan of $850 to buy another sewing machine and more materials to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and more material to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 32 años, vive con su pequeño hijo de 8 años. Cada día trabaja en su propio salón de belleza, brindando todo tipo de servicio en cuanto a peinados, maquillaje, cortes y coloraciones de cabello, etc. Inicio este negocio después de haber concluido sus estudios de cosmetología, eso fue hace 11 meses y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar, atiende en su salón 4 veces a la semana, es una gran satisfacción ejercer lo que ella considera su vocación, por ello que seguirá adelante.
Sandra se esfuerza por su hijo, ya que es  el motor que impulsa su trabajo.
El préstamo será invertido en implementar su salón de belleza con más espejos, también con otros instrumentos que necesita.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old and lives with her 8-year-old son. Every day, she works in her own beauty salon, offering every type of service, including hair-styling, make-up, cuts and coloring, etc. She began this business after finishing her cosmetology studies 11 months ago; since then, she has not stopped working. Her salon is open four times a week. Sandra experiences great satisfaction from following her vocation, and she will succeed for this reason. Sandra works hard for her son, who is the driving force behind her efforts. The loan proceeds will be invested in outfitting her beauty salon with more mirrors and other needed equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Outfitting a salon with materials and instruments, and installation of mirrors.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 22 years. She is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder daughter runs a beauty parlor. The next to her is in the 9th standard grade. Her younger daughter and her younger son are in the 5th standard grade. Her first two sons help their father in the making of lathe machines (machines that make tools).

Sugran baji's husband buys spare parts and makes lathe machines that he then sells in different cities of Pakistan (Karachi, Multan). He has been in this business for the last 30 years.

Sugran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has successfully repaid her 4 loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy spare parts to make another lathe machine to help her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to make a lathe machine

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs.Oem P. was born in 1964 and now lives in Banteay village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer and she owns a small piece of land where rice is cultivated to earn an income. Her husband, Mr. Kim Heng, is a farmer. On this plantation, he faces an obstacle because of infertile soil and does not have much money to improve his field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs.Oem P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to harvest the rice. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: Doña Angela Maritza está solicitando a AFODENIC refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción del pantri ), trabaja como Afanadora del Hospital Jacinto Hernández,  desde hace 22 años, tiene 2 hijos: la mayor de 15 años estudia 4to año de Educación Secundaria y el menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado de Educación primaria, su esposo trabaja como Auxiliar de Mantenimiento en el Hospital, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar,  doña Angela es una mujer  responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy humilde, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, ella se siente agradecida con esta institucion ya con los créditos anteriores obtenidos ha mejorado su vivienda y ha comprado electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia,  su sueño es  que sus hijos estudien, tener salud y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Angela Maritza would like AFODENIC to refinance her seventh loan to remodel her home by constructing built-in cabinetry. For twenty-two years she has worked as a cleaner at Jacinto Hernández Hospital. She has two children. The elder is 15 and in the fourth year of secondary school. Her younger child is 10 years old and in fifth grade. Her husband works as a maintenance assistant at the hospital. She and her husband share household expenses. Angela is a responsible, honest, hard-working, and humble woman. She lives in Zone 2 of the New Guinea neighborhood, an area where the population grows daily. She is grateful to AFODENIC for previous loans that have enabled her to improve her home. She has purchased electronic appliances which have greatly enhanced living conditions for herself and her family. Angela's dream is that her children continue to study, maintain good health, and find stable employment so that they can help their family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a pantry

loans.name: Agbelengo

texts.fr: Agbelengo A. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Il réside à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Là, il taille les pierres que la population utilise dans la construction. Ce commerce est très florissant étant donné que la demande est très forte et il demeure le principal vendeur. Avec ce crédit, il espère accroître son exploitation afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Agbelengo A. is 33 years old and the father of two school-attending children. He lives in Lavie, a village located approximately 135 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. There, he carves stones used for construction. This business is very flourishing since the demand is high and he is the main supplier. With this loan, he hopes to expand his quarry to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his quarry

loans.name: Parveen Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of N. A. who is a transporter by profession and loads various items on his donkey cart and delivers them from one place to another. He has 30 years of experience in this business. Parven baji has resided in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years.

Parveen baji is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting education from a school which located near their house. Parveen baji and her husband are very happy to send their children to school. They feel themselves to be good parents. Parveen baji is involved in a clothes-sewing business. She has been sewing clothes since her children started going to school. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her children. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband.

She is the leader of two-person group. The other member, Shamim baji, wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 67 años, cinco hijos que están casados.  
Trabajo 27 años en el ministerio D. defensa, como auxiliar D. farmacia, ahora es cesante, se dedica a su casa y a vender productos D. belleza por  catalogo, también hace marcianos y  los venD. en su casa.  
Ella necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para la compra D. productos D. belleza.  
El sueño D. Yolanda es viajar a Chiclayo  y  vivir allá.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor. Yolanda is 67, married, and has 5 married children. She worked for 27 years in the ministry of defense and as a pharmacy aiD., now she is unemployed and dedicates herself to her home and to selling beauty products by catalog. She also makes "marcianos" and sells them from her home. She needs a loan of $325 to purchase beauty products. Yolanda´s dream is to move to Chiclayo and live there.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of $325 to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula T., 35, is married with six children.  She has three years of experience in the barbecue business. She sells to the public five days a week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $166.  SPBD loans are Paula’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees and school uniforms and also for buying ingredients needed to run her barbeque business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making BBQ and to help with her children's school fees

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo Zenón y sus 4 hijos; Bryan de 24, Antoni de 19, Aron de 15 y Alexander de 9 años. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa, en su casa, ya que trabaja por pedidos, siendo un trabajo muy esforzado, bebido a que debe caminar casa por casa de sus clientes llevando prendas y cobrando. Realiza este trabajo porque le gusta la costura, quiere crecer en su negocio y además busca la manera de solventar los gastos de sus hijos que están estudiando. Lo bueno  es que tiene buenas ventas, especialmente en ciertas  temporadas donde la demanda es muy buena. Actualmente quiere fijar su labor en la temporada escolar, y en las próximas fiestas por el día de la madre. Carmen se encuentra en su 3er préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y siempre es muy responsable en los pagos, ya que todo su grupo es muy cumplido. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para elaborar prendas por el día de la madre y la otra cantidad la utilizará para comprar útiles escolares y venderlos por esta campaña de inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old and lives with her husband, Zenón, and their four children: Bryan, 24; Antoni, 19; Aron, 15; and Alexander, 9. She makes and sells clothing in her home, working to order. It is very tough work, as she must walk house to house delivering the clothes and collecting payments. She began this business because she enjoyed tailoring. She hopes to expand this business as well as find a way to cover her children's educational costs. The good news is that her sales are strong, especially in certain seasons where the demand is good. Now she wants to focus her work on the school season, and the upcoming Mother's Day festivities. This is Carmen's third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very responsible with her payments; he whole group is very accomplished. She will use this loan to buy greater quantities of cloth to make Mother's Day outfits, and also to buy school supplies to sell for the start of classes.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make clothes

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a vegetable and meat vendor in their village in Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 4,000 that she will use to improve her vending business and hopefully help it become a sustainable one. She hopes that, through her business, she can provide for the needs of her family. She prays that her loan request will be approved by the lenders.

Olivia has been married for almost 30 years to her husband Gregorio. She is now 48 years old and their two children are: Jenerson, 26 years old, high school graduate and Alvin, 24 years old, a technician. They live simply in their village and love developing camaraderie among their fellow men in their community.

loans.use: To improve her vegetable and meat vending business

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en:
Mr. Piseth H., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sochan Keo, 34, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1993 and have one daughter, who is in grade 7.

Piseth has been a policeman for six years. His wife is a Trai producer (Trai is a kind of Buddhism material that Cambodian people use for a traditional ceremony in Buddhism.) She buys elements from the market in Phnom Penh to make Trai and also sells at the market in Phnom Penh.

Piseth wants to runs another motor taxi (tuk tuk) business to earn extra income to support his family. That is why he is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to connect with his motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a motor taxi (tuk tuk)

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita B. is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 50 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Emerlita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling fruit in the local community. 

Emerlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emerlita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Pardohol

texts.ru: Пардохол Умарова проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 39 лет. Замужем, детей не имеет. Муж работает на заводе. Пардохол более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она торгует сухофруктами. Клиентка просит унас кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Pardohol U. lives in the Tursun-Zoda region. She is 39 years old, married and has no children. Her husband works at the local factory. Pardohol has been selling dried fruits at the market for the last 10 years. She is planning to use the loan to expand her inventory of fruit.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Martha A. en la ciudad de León donde a diario vende sus productos tales como cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, colonias, jabones, entre otros.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito debido a que tiene la necesidad de invertir en la compra de los cosméticos y por eso espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma mejorará su condición en el negocio y así saldrá adelante beneficiando a su amada familia.
texts.en:
Señora Martha A. makes a living by selling cosmetics in the city of León. Every day, she sells products like creams, perfumes, deodorant, cologne, soap, and other items. She has turned to Ceprodel to request a credit because she needs to invest in the purchase of cosmetics. She is waiting very confidently knowing that she will receive her credit. In this way, she will improve the condition of her business and will get ahead, which will benefit her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Awurade Kasa Group

texts.en:
Diana is twenty eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. She is a trader. She sells crates of eggs. Diana is also the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade Kasa’ which means "Speak Lord". She is seated first from right. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and then resell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group provide guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children good educations.

loans.use: To buy supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en: Chadi is a 34-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a fishing equipment sales shop since 2000. Today, Chadi is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance on his shop and purchase new tools to increase his income.

loans.use: perform maintenance on his shop and purchase new tools

loans.name: Amatour Ramath

texts.fr: Amatour Ramath est née en 1985 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Ramath est célibataire sans enfant. Ramath vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis vingt quatre ans. Ramath a fait des études universitaires mais c’est le commerce que Ramath a choisi de faire. En effet, Ramath va au Nigeria, État frontalier au Bénin pour acheter ses articles. Ramath vend des tissus de tout genre (Hollandais, WAS, Hitarget, Bazin…) et des foulards à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Ramath a déjà cinq ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Ramath veut renforcer son fonds de roulement, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de tissus Bazin

loans.name: Bih

texts.en:
Bih H. is a widow with four children. She lives in Nitop in Bamenda, Northwest Cameroon. Being a widow, she must fend for herself and her children, in this case through her firewood business. Additionally, Bih has encountered problems such as illness within the family and problems faced by her son in the Southwest region, costing Bih much money to remedy the situation. Notwithstanding that, Bih H. is quite ready to fight through life to the last moment with every morsel of her strength.

This is why she became a GHAPE beneficiary in 2008. She prefers to work with GHAPE because their loan conditions work well for her. This is Bih’s second loan from GHAPE. She plans to buy firewood, then transport and split it. Firewood is always needed in her community, so her business is sure to be successful. With the profits from this loan, she plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs and pay off medical bills. She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business and financial management, basic health maintenance, life skills and family values. Clients are also required to deposit a small amount of money into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to split and sell

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuân Thị Lê, born in 1969, lives in Xuan Trach, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She lives with her parents-in-law, her husband, who is a builder, and her daughter, who is a worker. She has two children: her son is in the military. Xuân Thị Lê's main job is farming, but she raises pigs, too. In her free time, she looks for additional work. The family's monthly cumulative income is about 5,000 VND. Xuân Thị Lê is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 4,142 VND to buy pig feed.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Vẻ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1957 and has two children. She would like to borrow 4,578 VND to use for her small business.

Luyến Thị Đào was born in 1966. She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of 5,014 VND to buy goods to sell.

Đông Thị Nguyễn was born in 1974 and has two children. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5,014 VND to buy food for the domestic animals she raises.

Thủy Thị Lê was born in 1971. She makes rice paper and wishes to borrow 5,450 VND to buy rice.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel trabaja en la confección de mantas y polleras tiene una tienda en alquiler; tiene 4 hijos, si bien viven en casa propia la misma es de adobe y ladrillo ubicada en la zona Nueva Jerusalén Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.
El esposo trabaja como transportista inter-departamental.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (tela), de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO, sus créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Isabel.

loans.use: compra de telas para su negocio de confección de mantas y polleras.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is already 37 years old. She is married to Victor who works as a soldier. They have three loving children, namely, Mark Anthony, 18 years of age, college level; then Karen Joy, 15 years of age, a fourth year high school student; and Kevin Mark, 9 years of age, a grade 3 student. The family is presently residing at Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. Their house is located near Alinam Elementary School.

Marilou has been engaged in retail vending for almost two years; her weekly net income is Php 1,000. She desires to a apply for the loan amount of Php17,000 for additional working capital and for business expansion.She wants to buy additional commodities for her store to acquire more customers. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Help The Poor Group

texts.en:
Bawa G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called “Help The Poor”. She is 42 years old and married with five children aged between 4 and 20 years old with educational levels of kindergarten through 12th grade.

Bawa is a 9th grade drop-out due to poverty. She and her family live in the Plumkor community, a residential area that is very crowded with people that migrated from rural Liberia during the civil crisis; it is south of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Bawa’s business is foodstuffs. She buys foodstuffs wholesale like pepper, seasoning, garden eggs (eggplant), etc., and sells retail on a table to residents of her community. She has been running this business for nineteen years and started with LRD 2,000 (approx. $30). She organizes her goods and sells at an ideal location, satisfying her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She is hoping to improve to a shop.

Bawa needs this loan to purchase more pepper, salt and seasoning to improve her business. She dreams of building a house for her family and changing their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more pepper, salt and seasoning to improve her business

loans.name: Mary Apondi

texts.en: Apondi is twenty four years old, married, and has been blessed with a two year old son.  She owns "Mama Tony Fashions" where she makes and sells dresses to local customers at Manyatta market.  Her business challenges are strong: there is competition from similar businesses, and significant price inflation of materials for making dresses.  She will use the proceeds of KES 15,000 to purchase rolls of fabric and tailoring materials.  In the future, she wants to open a big tailoring shop.  Apondi describes herself as creative and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rolls of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria T. is from Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Apolinaria is married and has three adult children. Apolinaria owns and operates a business making and selling foods in the local community. She is just starting this business.  She also manages a sari-sari store, which sells snacks and a variety of other products.

In July 2009, Apolinaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Apolinaria has successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from PMPC. She is now requesting a second loan, this one for 10,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase food for sale & additional stocks for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food products for sale & for additional stocks for her store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma C. is from the village of Danao. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Alma owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Alma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton S. V. (pictured) was married a long time ago to Heng. They both are the good parents of two kids. Both of the kids are still young and attend the local primary school. Ton S. V. and her husband earn their daily income by cultivating rice and some vegetable crops, which they will sell when the crops mature. In addition to farming, they raise ducks to produce eggs and then sell. 

Ton S. V. wants to improve her duck-raising business, which is the most profitable one for family. She has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more feed and small ducks to breed.

loans.use: To purchase more feed and small ducks to breed

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden M. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at home and is requesting a loan to open a restaurant.  Kiden is 30 years old and a widow. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a restaurant

loans.name: Ana Cesilia

texts.es: Ana Cesilia tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la vetan de ropa, hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que son la parte más importantes en su vida. El negocio inicio hace aproximadamente 10 años, cuando decidió viajar a Managua a comprar mercadería y le dio muy buenos resultados pues le proporciono el alimento diario, es por eso que se ha interesado a mejorar sus ingresos con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Cesilia is 52 years old; she sells clothing. For more than 10 years, she has dedicated herself to this humble business. She is a woman who likes to work, and she has always liked to help her 3 children get ahead, since they are the most important part of her life. She started this business about 10 years ago when she decided to travel to Managua to buy merchandise, and she had such good results that she was able to provide her family's daily bread. That's why she is interested in increasing her income from this business. The loan she is requesting is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and cosmetics. Her wish is to increase her business to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Celestino's Group

texts.en:
Celestino L. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 55 years old. Celestino is the group leader of a 18-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Celestino is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Celestino owns & operates a business venture into making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Celestino has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Celestino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celestino is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Celestino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly made up of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Italo es el presidente del grupo “LA BUENA AMISTAD” conformado por 13 socios,  amigos y compañeros D. trabajo en un mercado D. la zona, todos se dedican al comercio minorista y  con mucho esfuerzo tratan D. surgir cada uno en su negocio.
Italo es vendedor D. pan empezó en este negocio hace 15 años, al principio lo hizo como ayudante D. panadería fue un amigo que le dio la idea D. dedicarse a la venta D. pan por que se ganaba un poco mas.el empezó vendiendo pan en una canasta al principio le daba  vergüenza por que era muy joven pero su habilidad le ayudo a tener buenas ventas es así que el dueño D. la panadería le facilita un triciclo para que venda D. casa en casa,le fue tan bien que con el producto D. su trabajo pudo ahorrar y comprarse su propio triciclo actualmente venD. pan por su cuenta y reparte pan  por la zona D. los Olivos D. Pro, ahi es muy conocido y querido por sus clientes, por  otro lado también tiene un puesto D. venta D. abarrotes en el mercado esto le  genera otros ingresos,  su préstamo actual lo usara para pagar su cuenta en la panadería que le da crédito.  
En un futuro cercano Italo quiere tener su propia panadería el sueño del negocio propio sabe que lo lograra para eso trabaja con mucho esfuerzo.

* Italo  aparece en la foto  con camisa blanca .
texts.en:
Italo is the president of the “LA BUENA AMISTAD” (Good Friendship) group maD. up of 13 members who are friends and co-workers in a local market. All are very small merchants and are trying, with a lot of effort, to succeed in each of their businesses.

Italo sells bread. He began this business 15 years ago. At first, he maD. bread as an assistant in a bakery. A friend gave him the idea of selling bread because he could earn a little more. He began selling bread on an itinerant basis from a basket. At first, he was bashful because he was very young, but his ability helped him to have good sales; so the owner of the bakery provided him with a tricycle equipped to carry bread so that he could sell from door to door. He did so well with his work that he was able to save and purchase his own tricycle.

Currently he sells bread on his own and distributes it throughout the Olivos D. Pro zone. He is very well known there and well liked by his customers. He also has a stall in the market selling groceries. This generates additional income.

He will use the current loan for paying his bill at the bakery that supplies him bread on credit. In the near future, Italo wants to have his own bakery. He dreams of having his own business and knows he will achieve this dream because he works very hard.

Italo appears in the photo with a white shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying a bakery which supplies bread

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married with a son. She is a farming entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, Kherson region. Katerina owns several greenhouses and grows versatile farming produce for retail sale. She grows corn, peppers, cabbage, and squash. Katerina is very responsible and disciplined. She started this venture 3 years ago. Her diligence and natural composure have helped her succeed in this business. 

Katerina has invested about 70,000 Grivnyas in this venture. Her income is about 30,000 – 33,000 Grivnyas a month. Katerina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase drip irrigation units for her greenhouses as well as some fertilizers and peat. Besides greenhouses, Katerina also owns a cow and breeds rabbits.

loans.use: to purchase drip irrigation units and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of  Camp Phillips Bukidnon. She is 34 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane makes and sells food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities. Mary Jane's husband contributes to the family's income by providing motorcycle transport to passengers from their village (photo taken with her husband's motorcycle).

In 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. GRACIELA, TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES VIUDAD, TIENE UNA HIJA QUE ES MAYOR DE EDAD QUE VIVE CON ELLA. LA SRA. GRACIELA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "AMPLIACION VILLA EL POLVORIN" INTEGRADO POR 9 PERSONAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO. 
DEBIDO A LAS NECESIDADES, EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR BRINDANDO SERVICIO DE LIMPIEZA EN CASA, CON LO CUAL PUEDE ASUMIR ALGUNOS DE SUS GASTOS.
SU PROXIMA META ES PONER UN RESTAURANT, PARA LO QUE HA SOLICITADO EL PRESTAMO.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela is 38 years old, widowed, and has an adult daughter who lives with her. She is part of the group “Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin”, which consists of nine individuals who live in the District of Carabayllo. To meet her needs, Graciela started providing housekeeping services in order to pay for some of her expenses.

Her next goal is to open a restaurant, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a restaurant

loans.name: Kyankyere Twetungure, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Through hustling and toiling, B. John, just 25 years old, has managed to invest in the timber sector for now close to three years. He was driven into this business by the fact that there is a lot of demand in the prevailing market, and this was after he left school since he could not easily get a job in his profession.

With a lot of work requiring timber, like furniture workshops and building and construction, John hopes to expand his business on getting this loan and open up supplying stores in different locations. This will enable him earn more revenue and be able to maintain a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To expand his business through marketing and opening up new locations

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 54 years old. Lucena is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lucena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Lucena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by owning and operating a general store and by selling frozen products. She lives in DSB, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental with her 55-year-old husband, Domingo, who works as a foreman in a construction firm. They have six children who are between 14 and 32 years old. Two of them are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and selling frozen products, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Helen is now borrowing PHP 24,500 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Helen aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana is the wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She is an uneducated lady, who couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial conditions of her family. She owns a small house with two rooms in an area of Vehari known as Liaqat Park. 

Her husband operates a business selling medicines. He supplies medicines to different medical stores and to clinics as well. He has seven years of experience in this business.  

Ramzana also helps him financially by operating a domestic-sewing business. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 
She is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will be able to buy medicines in bulk and earn a good profit on them.

loans.use: Purchase medicines in bulk to resell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a welder. She has no formal education.

Ama sells foodstuffs in Elmina and has been in this trade for five years now. She uses her income to help her husband in taking care of the family. Ama will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs for sale and distribution.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs for sale and distribution

loans.name: Surchase Group

texts.en: Patience S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Surchase Group. Patience is 28 years old, married and has two children aged two and 10. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling. For 5 years, she has been selling sausage in Waterside Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of sausage. She describes herself as very friendly woman. Her goal is to grow her business. In the photo, Rose A. is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of sausage

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Gabriela;  Ella tiene 27 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo;  se dedica al comercio minorista, La socia vende frutas en el mercado central, ella compra al por mayor del terminal de Quillabamba es una provincia de clima cálido y es llamada la ciudad del eterno verano, aquí existe muchas variedades de frutas ricas y a este paradero llegan muchos vendedores de frutas a comprar de los vendedores directos. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería de frutas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Patron de Santiago de Santiago community bank in the Santiago district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Her name is Sra. Gabriela. She is 27 years old, partnered and has one son. She operates a retail business, selling fruiits in the central market. She buys wholesale supplies of fruits in the market at Quillabamba, famous for its warm climate and known as the city of eternal summer. Many fruit-sellers go to the market because of the large variety of delicious fruits on offer and the many wholesalers who have businesses there. Sra. Gabriela will use the loan to stock her business. Sra. Gabriela is grateful for the loan and she is fully committed to repaying it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cases of olive oil.

loans.name: Concepción Valerio

texts.es:
Concepción Valerio B. F. vive en el municipio de Malambo y se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas desde hace mas de veinte años, cuando adquirió su experiencia en un restaurante en el que trabajó durante 5 años y cuando se retiró, con su liquidación emprendió su sueño de ser independiente en un sitio estratégico de Barranquilla.
