texts.en: Seun is 32 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living selling textbooks, and has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She extends thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is a 60-year-old widow with four children aged between 13 and 22 years. She resides and owns a five-roomed house, where she is staying with four people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  

She owns a stall selling charcoal and bananas. She does her shopping from delivery vans, which get the items from villages. On average, she receives 10 customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for 10 years. She is servicing her 17th loan, working with the same group mates. 

Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and the rainy season, because when it rains very few customers come to her stall since it is in muddy place. Nulu wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas. She is aspiring to see her business grow stronger and to start selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Prince

texts.en:
Prince is a 40-year-old trader. He is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. He is a very resourceful man whose hard work provides a livelihood for the family. 

He supports his family through the sale of used clothing. Used clothing has a very big market share in Ghana, because brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically-active poor. Therefore, used clothing has created markets for many Ghanaians. 

Prince has been in this business for five years. He travels to the nearby city of Accra to purchase goods. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase his inventory. He believes this loan will help him save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu R. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer and is requesting a loan to buy other items like soda, water, and milk powder to sell. Dudu is 25 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar and restaurant.

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy items like soda, water, and milk powder to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda C., 30 years of age, is the wife of Rolando C., an electrician. Her husband is the one who assembles the video game machines and videoke (amateur singing to a recorded music video background) machines and sells them to their customers.

Yolanda and Rolando are now living happily in Barangay III, Tangub City and are blessed with three children all of whom are now of school age.

The couple has run this video game and videoke machine-assembly business for already ten years. From the average of two units being assembled and sold, they are earning an average net income of P6,000 a month. With eight units of videoke machine and several video game machines operating in the city, they are also receiving an average share from all these units of not less than P5,000 every 15th and 30th day of the month.

Just this year, Yolanda joined Paglaum MPC because she is interested in our programs and services. With a good character and with capacity, she was given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P50,000 with the purpose of purchasing additional parts and accessories to assemble new video game units and to recondition all other old units for sale.

The future profits from this loan will be used to save for their children’s future and for their daily needs. The couple plans to expand their business to other cities and nearby municipalities.

loans.use: To purchase accessories amd parts for video game and videoke machine assembly

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia, de 27 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Desde muy joven Lilia se dio cuenta que tenía que ayudar con los gastos familiares, para que la plata alcance en su hogar, es por eso que cuando terminó sus estudios de secretariado empezó a trabajar en la universidad de su localidad como secretaria, donde le va muy bien. Ahora, Lilia ha logrado implementar una tienda de abarrotes para sus padres, con la cual su vida está cambiando poco a poco.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a las personas que llegan hasta la universidad  para pedir información, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener en orden los papeles de la oficina, ya que hay días en que tiene mucho trabajo. 
Para el futuro, espera continuar trabajando duro para ayudar a sus padres y darles una mejor vida.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Lilia con MFP, desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con la mitad del dinero que solicita comprará más productos para la tienda de la familia, y con lo restante pagará sus estudios complementarios a su profesión.
texts.en:
Lilia is 27. She is a happy and unassuming young woman. She lives in her parents’ house. She wishes to help them with the household expenses. Ever since she was very young Lilia realized that she had to help with the family expenses so that there would be enough money. That is why, when she finished her secretarial studies, she started to work as a secretary at the local university. It is going very well for her. Now, Lilia has set up a grocery store for her parents. With the store her life is changing little by little. What she likes most about her work is helping people who come to the university to ask for information. She has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is keeping all the office papers in order. There are days she has a lot of work. In the future she hopes to continue working hard to help her parents and give them a better life. This is Lilia seventh loan with MFP. She wants to make all of her payments on time to be able to have access to another loan. She also knows that she has the support of her communal bank. She will use half of the money to buy more products for the family store. With the rest she will pay for additional professional education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her parents' store

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites G. is from the village of Holy Friday, Mallig, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Marites is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marites is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom S. is 41 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. She was married, but divorced her husband, and she doesn't have any children. Prom S. owned a piece of farmland that she inherited from her grandparents, on which she plants rice and a few vegetables. She will harvest and sell when her crops come to maturity. Prom S. saw that a rice selling business is a suitable one for her to earn extra income. Because she doesn’t have money to invest in this business, she requests a loan to buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers to resell and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from other farmers to resell

loans.name: Hartur Socrates

texts.es:
La Sr. A. R. HARTUR SOCRATES tiene 28 años de edad vive en casa de su padre juntamente con su cónyuge tiene un hijo de  dos años de edad se dedica al servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Ica
El cuenta con un carro propio el cual lo trabaja diariamente activo que lo adquirió producto de su trabajo y   con los ahorros que pudo juntar ya que anteriormente tenia una mototaxi y lo vendió para la compra del carro.  
El joven tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y amigos  donde  manifiestan que es  trabajador responsable y sobretodo puntual en sus labores.
texts.en:
A. is 28 years old and he and his wife live in his father's house. They have a two year-old son. A. drives a taxi in the city of Ica. He has his own cab, which he runs daily, that he bought with the savings from his work driving a "moto-taxi" (a kind of 3-wheeled taxi), which he sold to buy his cab. He has good references from his friends and neighbors, who say he is responsible, hard working, and above all on time with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his taxi business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic S. is 20 years old and has three children between one and three years old. She lives on an island with more than 60 other families. Marivic owns a small boat which her husband uses for catching fish. The income she gets from her fishing business helps her a lot, especially in buying food and clothes and meeting other basic needs.
Marivic would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing materials such as baits and nets.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials such as baits and nets

loans.name: Stella Maris

texts.es:
La señora Stella Bogarin  vive en casa propia, es casada. La misma se dedica a la compra de tabaco y elabora de ellas cigarros  tradicionales que la vende a señoras y señoras de avanzada edad quienes consumen este tipo de cigarros. 
Sus ventas las realiza por la ciudad de Luque y en el mercado municipal donde provee a algunos vendedores. A la fecha la titular ha retirado dicho  préstamo para la compra  tabacos en una buena cantidad ya que encontró una oferta  y la misma le estaría dejando buen margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Stella Bogarin lives in her own house and is married. She is dedicated to buying tobacco and making traditional cigars, which she sells to women and older women who consume these types of cigars. She sells in the city of Luque and in the municipal market where some sellers are found. To date, the owner has requested this loan to purchase tobacco in a good quantity since she found an offer which would give her a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tobacco.

loans.name: Darling Scarleth

texts.es:
La Señora Darling Scarleth G. D. es casada tiene un niño de apenas dos añitos de edad,  tiene un puesto de venta de comida rápida ubicado al frente del Almacén mundo Elegante de Chinandega, lleva alrededor de 8 años de tener su  propio negocio anteriormente ella le ayudaba a ver el negocio a su mamá a Darling le gusto la idea de poner su negocio y no seguir dependiendo de ella lo inicio con un capital de C$5,000.00 aporte de su esposo, comenzó  vendiendo hogdog y gaseosas. 
La Señora Darling G. en la actualidad vende hamburguesas, shanwis, enchiladas, tacos, hogdog, gaseosas etc. Habre su negocio de lunes a domingos de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde sin descansar un solo día tiene dos trabajadores con ella  que le ayudan a preparar la comida su negocio lo a acondicionado poco a poco con estos financiamientos
texts.en:
Señora Darling Scarleth G. D. is married and has a son who is just 2 years old. She has a stall where she sells fast food located in front of the "Mundo Elegante" store in Chinandega. She has had this business for about 8 years. Previously she helped out with her mother's business. This gave her the idea of having her own business so that she would not continue to be dependent. She started out with capital of 5,000 Nicaraguan cordobas that was contributed by her husband. She began selling hot dogs and soft drinks. Currently Señora Darling G. sells hamburgers, sandwiches, enchiladas, tacos, hot dogs, soft drinks, etc. She operates her business from Monday to Sunday from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening, without resting even one day. She has 2 people who work with her who help her to prepare the food for her business, which is gradually becoming a well-equipped business with these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sausage, bread, soft drinks, tomato sauce and cabbage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: EL SR. ARMANDO VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA CARPINTERIA, SE DEDICA A ESTA PROFESION HACE 15 AÑOS, TIENE 1 HIJO PEQUEÑO, SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA AL CUIDADO DE SU PEQUEÑO, EL SOLO SE ENCARGA DE LA MANUTENCION DEL HOGAR, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PONER EN CONDICIONES A SU VEHICULO QUE ES SU HERRAMIENTA PARA TRANSPORTE DE SU MERCADERIA, TIENE DOMICILIO PROPIO LO CUAL LO ADQUIRIO CON FINANCIAMIENTO, Y TRABAJANDO FUERTE, PARA CUBRIR DICHAS CUOTAS, POR LO TANTO EL SE SIENTE CONTENTO YA QUE MEDIANTE FINANCIAMIENTO A LLEGADO A TENER SU PROPIAS COSAS, SUS DESEOS ES TENER UN NEGOCIO ESTABLE Y SOLIDO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Armando lives in the town of El Torno, which is 40km from the city of Santa Cruz. He has been a carpenter for fifteen years. His wife is responsible for looking after their young child. Armando is in charge of supporting his household by himself.

His loan will be designated for his vehicle, which is used for transporting his goods. Armando has his own home that he purchased with the help of financing. He continues to work hard to cover his loan payments. Armando is happy that the loans have helped him acquire his own things. He hopes to have a stable and solid business.

Armando is extremely grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his work vehicle

loans.name: Karubanda Twimukye, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hardworking M. Lauben, aged 42, is the married father of six children. He went into a carpentry business venture now close to fourteen years ago. Having a strategically located business in Karubanda, Kihihi town, in western Uganda, he gets many customers, earning him 300,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

With this loan, Lauben is looking forward to restocking his business with more materials like timber and nails and also doing more advertising to increase the numbers of his customers. This will definitely give his enterprise a new lease of life and also help him improve on his sales and enable him to take good care of his family requirements like school fees, medical care and the like.

loans.use: To restock his business with materials like wood, nails, and more

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Juan Luna St., Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by her general store, eatery and rice retailing business. Gemma’s 40-year-old husband, Ceasar, helps his wife in managing the business. Their four children, currently all in school, help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.
Gemma joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family income by engaging in her general store, eatery and rice retailing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 21,700 PHP from her business activities.
Gemma is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 17,500 PHP was used to fund operations of her general store, eatery and rice retailing business, which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking her fifth loan, for 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use for her general store, eatery and rice retailing business. Gemma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Las Méndez Group

texts.es:
El grupo los M. está conformado por cuatro féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras que se dedican desde hace años al comercio de frutas y verduras actividad de gran demanda en Nicaragua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Jesenia del Carmen M. quien desde hace 10 años inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras con su esposo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María del Socorro F. Muños comerciante del mercado oriental desde 1995, Miriam M. J. 1990 inicio a vender frutas y verduras y Esmilda del Carmen Martínez también comercializa perecederos en este populoso mercado.
texts.en:
The M. group consists of four hardworking and entrepreneurial women; for several years, they have been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables, something that is in great demand in Nicaragua. The coordinator of the group is Jesenia del Carmen M., who started selling fruits and vegetables with her husband ten years ago. Her fellow group members are María del Socorro F. Muños, who has been a vendor in the Eastern market since 1995; Miriam M. J., who started selling fruits and vegetables in 1990; and Esmilda del Carmen Martínez, who also sells perishable goods in this bustling market.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a ticket to Russia for her daughter

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en: Shafoat B. is a married mother of four children. She sells kid’s clothing in the central market of Istaravshan. She has a wide variety of merchandise combined with reasonable prices. Shafoat has been in this trade for 16 years. She is trying to do everything she can to provide for her family and give her children a decent education. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and growing her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations. Shafoat is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to sustain her business and help ensure it continues to provide enough income to live on. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for increasing stock

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Marcos de 36 años y su única hija Yelisa de 13 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo Carmen ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva papa y alverja, productos que luego lleva a vender al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y aún disfruta mucho cuidar sus cultivos y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, espera mejorar su producción y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono, con lo cual espera mejorar su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and she is an unpretentious and hard working mom. She lives in her own house, together with her husband Marcos, 36, and their only daugther Yelisa, 13. They are the reason for her hard work. With a great deal of effort Carmen has worked the fields and made them fertile. She sows potatoes and peas and she sells the harvest on a wholesale basis in the city of Tarma. The income from the sales has granted them the necessary finances to support the family which is why she puts all she's got into her business. She has been harvesting for 4 years and she very much enjoys the work. The hardest part is distributing the product to the markets. The sacks are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future she would like to improve production to see better revenues. This is the eighth loan cycle with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has always been on time in the past and she is committed to being on time again. In her community group she is a very involved member, always on top of the group's business dealings. With the loan of one thousand nuevos soles she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, so that the next harvest will be stronger.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
El señor Gabino G. tiene ya más de doce años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta inmobiliario y mercancía para la elaboración de los alimentos. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo, ya que este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.  
Porque tiene contratos con diferentes compañía para la entrega de platillos y no quiere perder eso clientes.
Planea pagar el crédito  con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Bertha Alicia Míreles esposa del señor Gabino ya que el día de la visita el se encontraba entregando varios pedidos de comida y quien nos atendió fue señora Bertha Alicia.
texts.en:
Gabino G. has been making and selling food for over 12 years. The business needs furniture and merchandise for making food. He is requesting a loan because at this time he does not have the needed money to make the investment. He has contracts with different companies to deliver the dishes, and he does not want to lose his customers. He plans to pay the loan with part of his earnings from the business, which is the family’s only source of income. The person in the photo is Bertha Alicia Míreles, Gabino’s wife. The day of the visit he was delivering food orders, and Bertha Alicia assisted us.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his food business

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, el se ha destacado por ser un hombre muy trabajador pues él ha dado mucho esfuerzo en su negocio,  no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con financiamientos, pues ha sido muy satisfactorio. Por lo que tenía que buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia, el alimento de estos animales es muy caro, pues él se preocupa por mantenerlos muy gordos. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos y el alimento necesario. Desea proporcionar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jacinto earns his living by buying and selling pigs. He has been in this business for more than nine years. Jacinto has distinguished himself as an extremely hardworking gentleman who puts great effort into his business. This is not his first experience working with loans and he has found them satisfactory since they provide a way for him to generate income for his family.

The feeding of his animals is very expensive and he is concerned about maintaining their weight. This loan will be used to buy pigs and the necessary feed. Jacinto wants to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire pigs & purchase animal feed

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Hera Devi M..  She is married and has one child who is 30 years old.  In 2009, she established her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.  She wants to purchase more chicks with this new loan from BPW Patan.  In the future, Hera Devi plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.  This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buying new chicks

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Carmelita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa N. is a 43-year old married who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  Cosmetics  & Personal Products Sales and Fish Vending businesses. She lives in Zone 5, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Cosmetics and Personal Products Sales and her Fish Vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. 

Luisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she  could  purchase more stocks to sell.   This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Luisa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stocks of cosmetics and personal products to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov U. (pictured above) and her husband, Bey Pich, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them is a garment factory worker, two attend school and the other two are security guards. 

Pov is a weaver. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. She has asked for a Kiva loan several times already. Now she is applying for another loan of $1,000 to purchase weaving materials for continuing her weaving business and to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Pring N., 64, is widowed and resides with her two children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. N. is a housewife while two of her children are employed at a casino in the town, earning an income of about USD 100 each per month. N. has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: James Mwangi

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Naivasha since 2006. He is 56 years old and takes care of his two children all by himself since his wife passed on.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to plant potatoes and pay his casual workers with the loan amount. 

In the future, James hopes to buy a posho mill which will supplement his farming income.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to plant and to pay his casual workers

loans.name: Kipekera Group

texts.en:
M. M. is in his early twenties and is single with no children. He has owned a charcoal business for one year. He works from 6.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be M.'s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his first loan to increase his charcoal stock and has paid back this loan successfully.  He hopes to obtain a new loan with which he will use to open a fruit and vegetable business. His dream is to buy land on which to build his own home.

M. will share his loan with his loan group K., which has a total of 18 members.  The members of the group will help each other to pay back the loan.

In the photo, M. is in front wearing a green T-shirt.

loans.use: To open a fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Yurither

texts.en: Yurither is a 45-year-old widow with three children. She sells flowers to earn a living for her family. As the family's breadwinner, she works hard in her business and she hopes to expand it. So far, she has managed to improve her business through Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more flowers.

loans.use: to buy more flowers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants a loan to buy more drugs for his shop. He is a 32-year-old married clinical officer with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a permanent rented house. He dreams of educating his children, increasing his sources of income and upgrading his drug shop to the pharmacy level.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in his shop

loans.name: Luzbe

texts.en: Luzbe P. lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been operating a fish retailing business since 2000. It is her hope that she will be able to continue her business. She works very hard to earn enough income for her family's basic needs. Funding from CEVI will greatly help her realize her plan of expanding her business. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish for resale. Luzbe is 29 years old with six children.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Claudio Rene

texts.es: Claudio René tiene 27 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Esta es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de bar y restaurante. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio inicia por siempre le ha gustado este tipo de actividad con esfuerzos propios, el siempre ha sido un hombre luchador y que disfruta de su negocio.  Este financiamiento lo realiza con el fin de comprar ciertos productos necesarios en su negocio.
texts.en: Claudio René is 27 years and has 2 children in his care.  This is the first time that he has taken out a loan.  Claudio's business is a bar and restaurant business and he has been in it for more than 5 years.  He started his business because he has always liked relying on his own hard work.  He has always been a hard-working man and he enjoys his work.  He is taking this loan to buy certain products that he needs for his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bubukharia

texts.en:
Bubukharia S. is 50, married and has four children. She was born in the south of Kyrgyzstan, where all in her family were engaged in cotton cultivating. In 1998, Bubukharia’s family moved to Petrovka village in the northern part of the country. Her elder son followed his parents’ steps and graduated from State Agricultural University; the others help in the household.  

In order to find means of subsistence, Bubukharia decided to engage in cattle breeding. With the initial capital of 10,000 soms (KGS), she managed to develop her farm to a monthly profit of 20,000 KGS. With the revenues, Bubukharia was able to build a house for her family and hold weddings for her sons. 

Now Bubukharia wants to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a milk cow, which will allow her to increase sales of milk products. In the future, she dreams to develop a huge farm and build a house for her younger son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Adjélévi

texts.fr: Madame Adjélévie a 47 ans et est mariée.  Elle a 2 enfants à charge. Pour participer au ménage, elle  fait la vente de bijoux et perle. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1985 et s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au Bénin à Cotonou. Ensuite elle revend au grand marché de Lomé. Elle sollicite de Wages un prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mrs. Adjélévie F. is 47 years old and is married. She takes care of two children. To cover her household expenses, she sells jewels and pearls. She has been doing that since 1985 and she gets her stock from Accra in Ghana, and Cotonou in Benin. She then sells them at the Lomé Grand Market. She is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can get more stock.

loans.use: to purchase pearls and jewelry

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette S. is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner. She is from Langatian Roxas, 22 years old, married, and has to infant child. Janette operates a business in agriculture sector primarily raising pigs in her backyard.

In 2008, she joined PMPC. Janette successfully paid her previous loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which was used to buy materials for the construction of additional pig fencing. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, this will be used to buy three piglets worth 1,500 PHP each as well as pig feed. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Janette from PMPC.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María De La Cruz tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y con su familia en casa propia en el distrito de Mochumí, pertenenciente a la provincia de Lambayeque. Está ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María De La Cruz se dedica a labores ligadas a la agricultura.  Actualmente tiene cultivos de maíz, el cual una vez cosechado lo vende en el mercado de Moshoqueque, el cual es muy concurrido ya que es un mercado mayorista.  Los ingresos que percibe los invierte en su familia.

María De La Cruz desea comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus terrenos de cultivo, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María De La Cruz is 65 years old, married, and lives with her family in their own home in the district of Mochumí - part of the Lambayeque province - located 35 minutes from the province's capital city of Chiclayo.

María De La Cruz works very hard in agriculture. At the moment she is growing corn and, once it's been harvested, she sells it on the the well-attended, wholesaler market in Moshoqueque. The income earned is spent on her family.

María De La Cruz wishes to purchase manure and fertilisers, so she thought it appropriate to apply for loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilisers

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop, selling from home to her neighbors. In addition, she also does some farming, which contributes to her other source of income. A major challenge Mwanaisha faces is that of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, dry fish, tomatoes, sugar, and kerosene. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, dry fish, tomatoes, sugar, and kerosene

loans.name: D. Benjamin

texts.fr: Né en Mars 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Benjamin est marié à une photographe du nom de Louise et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Benjamin s’est installé à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il y vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Benjamin a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. C’est aussi un photographe. Parallèlement à cette activité, Benjamin  est gérant d’une buvette à Cotonou. Benjamin se ravitaille en boissons à Cotonou également. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Benjamin sollicite auprès de ALIDé un premier prêt.
texts.en: Born in March 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Benjamin is married to Louise, a photographer, and has three dependent children, all in school. Since about a dozen years ago, Benjamin has in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where he lives together with his wife and children. The spouses jointly provide for the family needs. Benjamin dropped out of high school. He also works as a photographer. Parallel to this activity, Benjamin manages a snack  bar in Cotonou. Benjamin stocks up on drinks in Cotonou. With the goal of expanding his business and better meeting his customers' needs, Benjamin is seeking his first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy Sobebra brand drinks

loans.name: Clonel

texts.fr: Clonel est nouveau client avec ACB, il est marié, il est âgé de 29 ans.il a 3 enfants entre un an et 6 ans. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB, et il va utilisé le prêt pour acheter une moto pour l'utiliser en taxi moto. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est accroitre son business des taxi-moto ou taxi mini-bus.Dans l’avenir il voudrait  être propriétaire d’une mini bus à utiliser comme taxi –bus, et pour sa famille, il voudrait construire des maisons pour sa famille, scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au niveau universitaire, et améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Clonel is a new client with ACB.  He is married, is 29 years old, and has 3 children between the ages of 1 and 6 years.  This is his first loan with ACB and he will use it to buy a motorcycle to use as a motorcycle taxi.  His strategy to expand his business is to add more motorcycle-taxis and a mini-bus taxi. In the future he would like to be the owner of a minibus for use as a taxi-bus, build houses for his family, send his children to school until they reach university, and improve his family’s well-being.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to use as a motorcycle  taxi .

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La señora Margot es socia del banco comunal Las Fresitas del  Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, brinda servicio de vulcanizado, su negocio se encuentra en uno de las calles más transitadas de la ciudad, el trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposo, y como no tiene con quien dejar a su pequeño también lo llevan con ellos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará  24 cámaras para autos, 2 cajas de rodajes, 10 llantas, 1 paquete de parches fríos, 1 litro de pegamento, 10 metros de cabes, 1 juego de llaves.
Está comprando estos productos debido a que el servicio que brinda demanda también el cambio de algunas partes o accesorios, de esta forma también tiene una ganancia a parte de lo que cobra por el servicio.
La señora Margot muchas veces también tiene que meter la mano (como se dice) para que los clientes no tengan que esperar, gracias a Manuela Ramos ha permitido que su negocio prospere y genere ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the communal bank "Las Fresitas" in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali.  She is 21 years old, married, and has one child.

She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  She has a tire repair business located on one of the busiest streets of the city where she works with her husband.  Because they don't have anyone who they can leave their child with, they bring him to work.

With this new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 24 inner tubes for automobiles, 2 boxes of wheels, 10 tires, a bundle of cold patches, a liter of glue, 10 meters of cables and a set of keys.

She will buy these products because there is demand for the services that she provides.  She also sells spare parts and accessories, because in this way she can generate earnings from what she charges for these items.  

Margo also at times has to do the repairs so that her customers don't have to wait.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business is prospering and is generating enough income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes and wheels

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
Jorge Washington tiene 26 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, trabaja en tereenos de los padres. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para la produccion de maiz y arroz.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. No enfrentan desafios muy immportantes. Su sueño es comprar terrenos propios para trabajar.

Le gusta salir a caminar con la familia y realizar compras en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jorge Washington is 26 years old, he is married and lives with his wife and children.  He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Rios.  

This group is called SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, and it is located in the Sibimbe precinct which is part of the Ventanas Canton.  This group has 20 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice.

Jorge works in agriculture, planting corn and rice.  He works on his parents' land.  He makes purchase in Ventanas every month and sells at the market in the same locality.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of products for the farming of corn and rice.  The support from this loan would help him financially to meet his needs.  They are not facing any very important challenges. His dream is to buy his own land to work.

He likes to go for walks with his family and to make purchases in the market.

loans.use: to buy products for the farming of corn and rice.

loans.name: Seydina  Mouhamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Seydina Mouhamed du Banc Villageois de Gabar est créé depuis le 14 mai 2010, il est composé de dix huit femmes qui habitent le même village et qui ont comme principales activités le maraîchage et l'embouche.


Madame Fatimata la responsable est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée mère de six enfants; elle fait du maraîchage et aussi de l'embouche; sur la photo elle est debout à l'extrême droit habillée en robe blanche avec un peu de bleu.


Elle achéte ses semences et produits phytosanitaires dans les villes et les moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle revend les récoltes et les moutons au marché du village et dans les villages environnants.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter des moutons pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus à la vente après 4 à 5 mois d'embouche.


Avec les bénéfices obtenus elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille, elle souhaite aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Seydina Muhammad of the Gabar Village community bank was created on 14 May 2010, it consists of eighteen women living in the same village, whose main business is gardening activities and fattening. 
Fatima is the head of the group, she is 38 years of age, married and mother of six; she is gardening and also fattening, in the picture she is standing on the far right, wearing white and blue clothes. 
She buys seeds and pesticides in the city and sheep in the weekly markets. She sells crops and sheep at the village market and in the surrounding villages. 
She wants to use her loan to buy sheep to increase her herd and achieve a good revenue through the sale after four to five months of fattening. 
With the profits she will obtain she will support her husband with the family expenses and increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and livestock to raise.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jenny has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Jenny is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jenny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca Atalia

texts.en:
Blanca lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants. But you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life there. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets and its trade in livestock – the largest in the country.

Blanca is a 63-year-old widow. She has five children, now adults, aged 38, 36, 34, 30 and 23. She lives with her youngest child, her son Pablo, who is currently attending university. In her spare time, Blanca loves to walk.

Blanca buys and sells clothes, which she orders from a catalog. She learned this work from her sister-in-law. This is Blanca's second loan with Fundación Alternativa and her first loan through Kiva. She will use her loan to buy new merchandise. You can see some of her merchandise, in this case some colorful underwear for sale, in the photo. 

Blanca works on her clothing business for about five hours a day. She has been able to shorten her workday because of the help of her son. She says the hardest part of her work is charging her clients. 

She has dedicated her life to working so that she could provide education for all of her children. This was especially difficult when they lived in Quito and were renting their home. Blanca's dream is to see her youngest child finish university and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
This is Genalyn, a 27-year-old resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines, who is married to Jerwin, a barber, and the mother of one child. By the grace of God, Genalyn has managed to support her child's schooling while she and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Genalyn operates a buy and sell business, purchasing general merchandise from wholesalers and then reselling it for a small profit. Her products are footwear, sandals, etc., and customers are attracted to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations, Genalyn is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Genalyn dreams of having another store and giving her child a good and high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 29 years old. He is married without children. He sells various goods such as bags, cloths, etc. and he has four years of experience in this business. He works from 6 am until 7 pm every day except on Sunday and he currently employs two people to help him.

Samuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as bags, cloths, shoes, sugar, etc. to sell. Once his business is expanded, he hopes to reinvest in this business and to save for the future so he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as bags, cloth etc to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Raúl de 36 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el poblado de Santa Rosa (Dentro de la selva Ayacuchana), se encuentran los cultivos de Rebeca, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que sus plantas de cacao y café, son muy bien cotizados en la ciudad de Santa Rosa y San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, y le satisface el ver su producción luego de varios meses de cuidado y dedicación. Durante el tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza hace trabajar sus tierras con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es controlar las enfermedades de cada producto que se apoderan mas y mas de los granos de cacao y café. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar sus tierras y así beneficiarse con los frutos de cada planta. Este será su décimo crédito con MFP y espera beneficiarse una vez mas con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir progresando y por ende se compromete en devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 32, and is from the town of Santa Rosa.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband Raúl, 36, and their three dear children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life.

Rebeca farms near the town of Santa Rosa in the rural part of Ayacucho department.  Her products are very good. That is why her coffee and cacao plants are highly valued in the towns of San Francisco and Santa Rosa, where she sells all of her harvest. 

What she most likes about her work is harvesting her crops. She finds it satisfying to see the fruits of her labor after many months of care and dedication.  During the times of harvesting and weeding, she works her land with the help of day laborers. 

She has been doing this work for 15 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be controlling crop diseases that are affecting the cacao and coffee beans more and more. In time, she hopes to develop more of her land, and in this way benefit from what every plant produces.

This will be her tenth loan with MFP, and she hopes to benefit once again from the support of the lenders in order to continue making progress.  Consequently she is committed to making her scheduled payments on time.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles, she will buy natural fertilizers to improve her land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Divina Gracia

texts.en:
Divina Gracia is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Divina Gracia requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia Viviana es casada, tiene 43 años D. edad, curso los estudios D. educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 2 estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría D. toda clase D. telas típicas, cuenta con 15 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para capital D. trabajo para la compra D. hilos D. varias clases y colores para producir mas: cortes típicos, sabanas y servilletas. espera en el futuro ver un negocio amplio.
texts.en: Ofelia Viviana, 43, is married.  She completed elementary school and has five children two of which are going to school.  She weaves all sorts of traditional textiles.  She has 15years’ experience and her husband, who is in the same occupation, supports her efforts.  She’s asking for a loan to use as working capital to buy yarn in assorted colors and types to make more traditional fabrics, sheets and napkins.  She hopes in future to see a large business.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es: Yessenia, de 23 años, es una mujer joven, alegre y sobre todo entusiasta a la hora de trabajar, ella es soltera y no tiene hijos aún.  Estudia en la universidad, vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y sus dos menores hermanos de 18 y 15 años. Ella junto a sus padres trabajan mucho para poder surgir y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Yessenia consiste en la tapicería de asientos y toldos de vehículos de dos y tres ruedas, tiene un local en su casa y ahí es donde funciona su negocio, lleva realizando este trabajo por un año aproximadamente, asimismo cuenta con la ayuda de su padre ya que la inversión es de ambos. Por otro lado, estudia  en una universidad de la ciudad y desea poder seguir adelante y surgir a lado de su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que como es un negocio familiar puede estar a lado de ellos, además el movimiento es a diario y le hace rotar mucho su dinero. Le esta yendo bien y espera poder mantenerlo por el momento hasta que se consolide y puedan ampliar implementando más equipos. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le va bien trabajando con el grupo, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para poder seguir con su inversión ya que de eso vive y estudia. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para tapicería, entre ellos agujas especiales, hilos, lonas y otros más que se necesita para hacer su trabajo.
texts.en: Yessenia is 23 years old and she is a young and happy woman who is always enthusiastic when it comes to work. She is single and she still does not have children. She is in university and she lives at home with her parents and her two younger siblings, aged 18 and 15. She and her parents work hard to keep moving forward and to have a better quality of life. Yessenia's work consists of upholstering the seats and awnings of two and three-wheeled carts. She has a space allocated in her house from where she manages her business. She has been in business for approximately one year. She is helped by her father, as it was a joint investment. She is also enrolled in the university in the city and she wants to keep moving forward and break forth with her family. Her sales are daily and it results in a frequent rotation of her investment. It is going well for her and she hopes to keep it up until she is able to expand by adding more equipment. This will be her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). It is going well with her group and she is very thankful for the opportunity given her to keep on going with her investment. This is how she is able to live and to go to school. With the funds she requests she will purchase upholstering materials, among them: special needles, threads, awnings, and other materials she needs to do her work.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, and fabrics.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. Damiana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Damiana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Santos Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Santos tiene 34 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos.

Él aprendo la agricultura, desde los 10 años de edad. Fue su papá quien le enseño, ya que no tenían un empleo fijo y son varios hermanos. Por lo que encontraron en la agricultura un medio de subsistencia y un modo de vida. Él actualmente siembra maíz con riego por gravedad (sistema a través del cual se dispersa el agua para regar los cultivo, sin usar dispositivos solo por la gravedad, se busca una pendiente para derramar el agua y que esta busque su cause, atravesando todo el cultivo) ya que es época seca, aunque cuando llueve manifiesta don Santos tienen perdidas por inundaciones, ya que el agua es poca profunda.

Don Santos camina a pie durante quince minutos desde  su casa hasta la carretera principal, donde aborda un autobús durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad donde compra los insumos agrícolas.

Don Santos esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes, 80 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, los cuales vende en elote bajo riego  por gravedad.

Al comprar los insumos de una sola vez, don Santos consigue precios más bajos y evita viajar tanto a comprar por poquitos. Además estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; esto permitirá que su producción aumente y también sus ingresos.

Don santos trabajara fuerte, para construir una casa de ladrillo, ya que actualmente vive en una de adobe y sin habitaciones.
texts.en:
Santos is 34 years old.  He is married and has two children.

Santos learned to farm when he was 10 years old.  It was his dad who taught him because they didn't have a regular job and he has several siblings.  In farming, they found a way of making a living and a way of life.  Santos currently sows corn with a gravity irrigation system as it is the dry season (a system through which water for irrigating the crops doesn't need any mechanisms, just gravity.  A slope is found for the water to run down and find its level, watering all the crops). However, when it rains, Santos says that they lose crops through flooding as the water is not very deep.

Santos walks for fifteen minutes from his house to the main road where he boards a bus which takes thirty minutes to get to the city where he buys his farming supplies.

Santos is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo so that he can buy 12 sacks of fertilizer, 80 pounds of corn seed, and other supplies that he needs to sow 14,000 square meters of corn which he waters with a gravity irrigation system and sells on the cob.

By purchasing his supplies all in one go, Santos obtains lower prices and avoids having to travel to buy in small amounts.  In addition, he will be certain that he can give his crops the care they need, when they need it.  This will allow his production to increase and also his income.

Santos will work hard to build a house from brick as he currently lives in a house made from adobe which doesn't have internal room divisions.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer, 80 pounds of corn seed and other supplies he needs to sow 14,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Srauy

texts.en:
Srauy (in the photo) and her husband, Po are farmers. They grow papaya, eggplant and other vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition, Srauy is also a weaver. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Srauy is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y con 2 hijos, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Juan Velasco Alvarado Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. Milagros vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y  no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Milagros se dedica a la crianza de animales menores contando con 20 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local.  Asimismo cría gallinas.  Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura contando con 1,50 has de terreno agrícola el cual tiene limón que cosecha semanalmente, existe una buena relación familiar.

Milagros desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de aves y para realizar mejoras en el corral de los pavos y gallinas, esto con la finalidad de que logren un mejor peso y tamaño y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio en el mercado, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  Para esto ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milagros is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. She lives in her own home in the village of Juan Velasco Alvarado in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Piura region and located four hours away from Chiclayo, the capital of the Department of Lambayeque. Milagros lives in the rural section of the district and does not receive basic services.

She raises small animals, which includes 20 turkeys. Milagros raises and fattens her animals before selling them at the local market. She also raises chickens. Her husband is a farmer who has 1.5 hectares of farmland for growing lemons, which are harvested on a weekly basis. They have a good family relationship.

Milagros wants to buy balanced feed for fattening her birds and to make improvements to the coops that house the turkeys and chickens. In the end, she wants her birds to reach a good size and weight so that they can be sold at the market for a good price. This investment will enable her to continue growing her business so that she can improve her quality of life. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced poultry feed and to make repairs to the coops.

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Lamrana is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lamrana was born in Kamasikie village about thirty-eight years ago. She is married and has two children who are attending primary schools. Lamrana sells palm oil, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. She has been doing business for four years now. 

With the help of this loan, Lamrana and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. She will use her share of the loan (700,000 SLL) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, Maggi cubes, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Solidarité Plus Group

texts.en:
Françoise is the leader of the Community Bank named “Solidarité Plus.” It consists of 28 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Françoise has been a micro-entrepreneur for years. She runs a general store to the east of Kinshasa. She works hard with good management skills in order to achieve her goal of one day opening a large store in her area. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her US$ 600 per month. 

Françoise is a trustworthy client of MFI HOPE RDC, having nine times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying the items needed by her customers and reselling them at profit. 56 years old, Françoise is married and the mother of six children, whose ages vary between 4 and 18 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase her store’s stock by buying more items needed by her     customers.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 25-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two daughters, and parents-in-law, in Telavi, east Georgia. 

Ketevan and her husband operate a small business. They run a market selling food products. Ketevan is requesting a loan to purchase stock for her store. She is applying through the Start Up Program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This program enables her to take out a loan of $2500. With the loan, Ketevan will be able to offer her clients a wide assortment of products. In the future, she hopes to expand the shop. 

The loan will help Ketevan support her family.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock and expand her food market

loans.name: Claudia Valentina

texts.es: Claudia, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en una de las aldeas de Tela, Atlántida. Claudia realizaba trabajos de estilista para generar ingresos y hace dos años decidió por establecer una pulperia donde ofrece productos como golosinas, dulces, pastas, carne de pollo, refrescos, pan, lácteos, arroz, frijoles y otros abarrotes. Con este negocio recibe mas ingresos. Con el fin de surtir mas su negocio solicita la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras para comprar refrescos, carnes, pan y granos basicos para surtir y vender en esta temporada. Así podrá ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Su meta es poder fortalecer el negocio y  brindarle mejor educacion a sus hijos.

loans.use: Comprar refrescos, carnes, pan y granos basicos para surtir su negocio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
My name is Catarina C., and I am a 39-year-old native of Salamanga, Matutuine district, Maputo province. I am a married mother of 4 children, and I attended school up until the 6th grade. I could not continue my studies due to the 16-year civil war that severely affected the Matutuine district. During the civil war my parents took refuge in neighboring South Africa. For two years I worked as a cabinet-maker in a carpenter’s shop and after that I worked as a housemaid for two residences. In 1989 I married a young Mozambique man who at the time also worked in South Africa. With the end of the civil war in 1992 my husband and I decided to return to Mozambique. In 1994, after settling the family in the city of Maputo, I dedicated myself to the sale of diverse products from my residence. My family found it difficult adapting to urban life and in 1995 we decided to move back to my native home of Salamanga, Matutuine district. That same year I began to work on a project of reintegration for those returning from neighboring countries; I worked as a sewing instructor. At project’s end in 1996 I returned to the sale of everyday goods at the local market. In 1998 I rented a small commercial establishment belonging to my brother, and to this day I continue to work there. At this time my husband and I and 4 other employees depend on this business. With the loan I intend to acquire a vehicle to transport diverse cargo to my commercial establishment. This would facilitate our contribution to the increased rent and to the availability of diverse products at accessible prices to more than 100 families residing in the town of Salamanga.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Catarina C. de 39 anos de idade, Natural de Salamanga, distrito de Matutuíne Província de Maputo, Casada Maritalmente, Mãe de 4 filhos, tendo sido escolarizada até 6ª classe, Não conseguiu continuar mais com os estudos devido a guerra civil dos 16 que afectou severamente o distrito de Matutuíne. Durante a guerra os pais refugiaram-se na vizinha África do Sul em 1985, Por lá começou a trabalhar numa Carpintaria com a Função de marceneira, por um período de Dois Anos e mais tarde veio a trabalhar como empregada Domestica em duas residenciais. Em 1989 Casou-se Maritalmente na Africa do sul com um jovem moçambicano, que na altura se encontrava a trabalhar naquele pais vizinho. Com o fim da Guerra em 1992 decidem com o marido voltar a Moçambique em 1994, Tendo fixado a família na cidade do Maputo e lá dedicava-se a venda de produtos diversos na sua residência, segundo ela, não foram felizes com a realidade urbana assim viram-se obrigados em 1995 a voltar para Salamanga no distrito de Matutuíne, zona de origem. Ainda no mesmo ano começou a trabalhar num projecto de reasentamento dos regressados dos países vizinhos como facilitadora dos cursos de corte e costura. Findo o projecto em 1996 retomou a sua actividade de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade no mercado local. Em 1998 alugou um pequeno estabelecimento comercial do seu irmão, onde continua a trabalhar ate hoje. Neste momento ela e o marido dependem deste negocio com mais outros 4 empregados. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir uma viatura para transporte de cargas diversas para o estabelecimento comercial sob sua gestão, contribuindo deste modo para aumento da sua renda e disponibilização de produtos diversos a preços acessíveis para mais de 100 famílias residentes na vila de Salamanga.

loans.use: To buy vehicle for supporting her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a charming 31 year old lady, has two children and is separated from her husband. She lives in the town of Ruai in the outskirts of Nairobi. By natural instinct Susan started braiding her sister’s hair when they were growing up. As time went by she became an expert in plaiting and braiding hair. A close friend of hers who was operating a salon suggested she learn how to apply chemical to clients’ hair and also how to style hair. Her friend taught her the skills free of charge over a period of two years. Susan saved Ksh 5,000 (USD 76) while she was a member of a merry-go-round group in her village. From this money, she rented a stall for Ksh 2,000 (USD 30) in the year 2005. With the balance she bought a mirror for the stall and then started plaiting clients’ hair since she did not have enough money to purchase salon equipment. Her friend Catherine Wambura then gave her a blow-dryer free of charge in order to support herself. Clients flocked her stall and by the end of the year 2005, from her small savings and proceedings from her business, Susan managed to buy a dryer. Today her salon is one of the most frequently visited salons in Ruai. Due to the growing number of customers and the desire to give them first class service, Susan is requesting for a loan of USD 475 in kind, which will enable her to purchase a blow-dryer, hair dryer, steamer, and various chemicals. This will greatly help to support her business since she could not steam clients’ hair before due to lack of a steaming machine. This equipment will greatly boost her business. She intends to pay her loan within a period of 8-12 months.

loans.use: To purchase  a blow drier, Hair drier, Steamer ane Hair relaxing chemicals

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a widow with a grown son named Arthur. She lives in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. Liana sells groceries (cereal, noodles, coffee, tea, fruit and veggies, etc.) in the local market. It is her only source of income. She has been in this business for 16 years and has gained many loyal customers. Loans from Nadiya Ukraine and her personal strengths have ensured the successful growth of Liana’s trade. She is an enterprising and active hard-worker who usually works long hours. Her customers have only positive references for her. Liana has repaid nine previous loans without any delinquencies

Liana is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase new types of food inventory and attract new customers. We believe her constant desire to see her business grow and expand is her best motivation and guarantees prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase groceries wholesale

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu S. is a forty five year old widow with four children.  Being the sole bread winner, she does gardening in the village to supplement her business income.  She decided to live in Magburaka town so her children could access education.
