She invested her previous loan in hiring laborers to work in her garden while part of the loan was used to run her small business of selling peanut butter, sugar and onions.  She planted rice and vegetables and sells the surplus.  She said the petty trade enables her pay her loan installments before the harvest.  She therefore needs a loan of $175 to expand her petty trading for more profit that will be invested in the farm in the coming season.

loans.use: Expand her petty trading business to generate profits for her farm.

loans.name: Dinh Toan

texts.vi:
Mr Toàn is a hard working man. He was a poor peasant, empty handed. He has learned how to breed pigs in order to raise above poverty. Today he has a job and breeds pigs at home. His wife, Quyên, buys scrap material to resell to companies. He wishes to have capital so he could expand his pig breeding into a business so he could provide his children a good education.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si,.Kiva volunteer.

Anh Toàn là một người đán ông chịu khó, hay làm. Từ một người nông dân với hai bàn tay trắng anh đã học tầp cách chăn nuôi để dần kinh tế gia đình thoát khỏi cái đói nghèo. Hiện nay anh đi làm thuê và chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Quyên vợ anh đi chợ hàng ngày mua phế liệu rồi bán cho các đại lý thu mua. Anh vẫn hi vọng có thêm nguồn vốn để có thể mở rộng chăn nuôi cũng như sản xuất, để có điều kiện cho các cháu ăn học tốt hơn.

loans.use: Having loans for breeding pigs

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong C., age 27, runs a stand in front of a primary school selling biscuits, candy and other treats to young students passing by, making around $1 each day of income. Her husband works selling rice crops from their home home, earning only around $1 to $2 per day in revenue. They do not have children. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase more rice for her husband’s inventory, and the remainder to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for her husband’s inventory, and the remainder for repairing her house.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en: I live in Riawind with my husband and children. I have been in this city for past twenty years. My husband makes and sells shoes; my elder son is a local transport driver and the younger drives a rickshaw. This would be my second loan from Asasah, the microfinance institution. Last year we used this loan for our shoes business and this year we request an additional loan for the same. We plan to offer socks along with shoes. My group members also request loans.  Zainab S. requests this loan to expand her beauty parlor. Khursheed B. will invest in their business . Inayat B. will invest this loan in their shoes business. Shamim M. makes embroidered clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To expand shoes manufacturing business

loans.name: Clemencia's Group

texts.en:
Maura, Doris and Clemencia are part of the “Aleli” community bank. Maura and Clemencia have been members for four years, and Doris has been a member for six years. In their community bank, they have learned to save and to work efficiently.

Maura is 58 years old. She is married and has eight children. Maura sells candies and fruit at the Abelardo Quiñónez school in the San Juan Bautista neighborhood of Ayacucho. Her son, who is a student at this high school, helps her.

Doris is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Doris has a store where she sells food staples, such as rice, flour, and sugar, as well as fruits and vegetables. She started her business several years ago with very little capital, and it has grown considerably.

Clemencia is 35 years old. She is married and has four children. Clemencia makes chocolates. She uses a traditional Ayacuchan method using cocoa, sugar, and cinnamon. She sells her products in the open-air markets and stores of Ayacucho. In addition, with the help of her children, she travels to the provinces to sell her products there.

Maura, Doris and Clemencia need loans of 600, 800, and 400 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in soft drinks, oranges, mandarins, bananas, fuel, beer, pasta, cocoa, and sugar.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning-savings account that each associate has. Maura, Doris and Clemencia plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s schools and to improve their businesses. Their dreams are that their children will be professionals, their businesses will continue to grow, and they will continue to move forward.

loans.use: Maura, Doris and Clemencia need loans of 600, 800, and 400 soles respectively  (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying soft drinks, oranges, mandarins, bananas, fuel, beer, pasta, cocoa, and sugar.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil, born in 1975, is married, and has one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Agdam region of Azerbaijan. He settled in Baku city.

Gabil has run a taxi business for 4 years. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts to maintain his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain the taxi

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is the mother of five children, who are all currently in school. She has been buying and selling rice, beans and groundnuts for the past twenty two years. Salamatu travels twelve hours to buy her products from the Northern part of Ghana. She wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of beans and bags of groundnuts.

Salamatu is a member of the group called “Shie Allah” (meaning except God). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Salamatu would like to buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Sam-Ath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-Ath M., 49, and her husband, Mr. Nat Mak, 48, were married in 1986 and have five children; four sons and one daughter. All of their children are in school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-Ath has been a weaver since 1979. It’s skill she learned from her parents and she also taught her husband to becme a weaver in 1997. Beside weaving, her husband also raises pigs and produces  rice wine as well. The couple sells their finish products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Sam-Ath is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Mr. Gregorio D. is a small businessman who has a store in his home located in the neighborhood called ’31st of December’ in the city of Managua. Together with his wife he runs his business; all his children are independent of him.

Gregorio wants to provide his wife an improved and respectable house where both will live in their old age. He started the store with his own funds and through five years it has been improving; he would like for his business to continue to grow little by little in spite of the difficult economic climate.

He will use the loan to acquire inventory such as basic grains and housewares, and in this way stock up his store and improve the availability of goods to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Gregorio D. es un pequeño comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio 31 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Managua. Junto a su esposa administra su negocio, sus hijos ya todos son independientes a él.

Don Gregorio quiere brindarle a su esposauna casa mejorada y digna para que ambos vivan su vejez. Empezó la pulpería con esfuerzo propios y a través de cinco años la ha ido sacando adelante, desea que su negocio se siga desarrollando poco a poco a pesar de la difícil situación económica.

El préstamo lo utilizará para adquirir inventario como granos básicos y productos para el hogar, y así surtir su pulpería y mejorar su oferta hacia sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of housewares and basic grains

loans.name: Gloria Leticia

texts.es:
Gloria is married and she has three children who are 16, 13, and 4 years old. She began the business when her husband got laid off from his job, and she put part of the severance in a business because she didn't want to go through so many problems because after the layoffs happened it took a lot of time to find another job, and she suffered a lot for want of money that they suddenly didn't have in order to support their family or to pay for the house. Because of this she decided to have a business so that that situation would never happen again. She has had her paper store for three years, and she has successfully grown a base by her efforts and those of her family. Now her eldest son he helps her attend the store.

She needs a loan of USD $500 that she will repay in 6 months in order to invest in her business, buying merchandise. With your help, Gloria will move her life upwards and onwards!

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13, y de 4 años. Inició el negocio cuando liquidaron a su esposo de su trabajo y entonces ella invirtió una parte de la liquidación en el negocio aparte porque ya no quisieron que pasaran por tantos problemas porque cuando lo liquidaron tardo mucho tiempo en conseguir otro empleo y sufrió mucho por la escasez de dinero ya que no tenían para la manutención de su familia ni para pagar su casa de así que decidió tener un negocio para no volver a pasar por eso. Desde hace 3 años tiene su papelería la cual ha logrado hacer crecer en base a su esfuerzo y el de su familia ya que ahora su hijo mayor le ayuda a atenderla.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertirlo en su negocio, comprando mercancía. Con tu apoyo Gloria saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Motar

texts.fr:
This stockbreeder buys sheep, fattens them, and then resells them for competitive prices at the market. Now, M. would like to grow the number of his livestock, and in order to accomplish this, he is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Cet eleveur achete des moutons les engraisse puis les revend sur le marche a des prix competitifs. Maintenant, M. voudrait accroitre son cheptel c'est pourquoi il sollicite un pret pour y arriver.

loans.use: Breeding

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Iliana desde muy pequeña ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, y desde hace 4 años que se caso empezó a dedicarse a la venta de edredones, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, y para tener sus propios ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su inventario y estar preparada para la época de frío.
texts.en:
Since she was very little, Iliana has been a very hardworking person. Four years ago she married and began selling quilts to help her husband with the household expenses and to have her own income. She needs a loan for US$250, which she will repay in three months, to buy merchandise and thereby increase her inventory to be prepared for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Ream L., 30, is married and lives with her husband in Kork Russey, in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She  started a business in 2002 selling various grocery products, making an average of $15/day in income. Her husband is a rice farmer and and the output he gathers only feeds his family. Ream L. is really happy with her increase in sales and is happy to see her business improving.
Inflation rate in Cambodia is still a big concern especially with the high price of goods on the rise. Ream L. uses a taxi to in order to purchase large quantities of grocery products from wholesalers to resell. The majority of the products have doubled, as well as the cost of taking a taxi back and forth.
In order to deduct her business transportation expenses and to help accelerate her business output, Ream L. is asking for a loan from KIVA to purchase a motor-bike so she can purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to use for her business transportation.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy U., 41, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Vun, 44, married in 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Both of their daughters are garment factory workers and the two sons are studying in primary school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Chanthy is a tailor. She used to work in a garment factory before operating her own business. Her husband raises cows. The couple hopes that their business will be able to support their two sons while they study to as high a level as possible. Chanthy is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Tocossone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ayant acquis une très grande expérience sur la transformation des produits locaux lors du premier prêt de Kiva et surtout ayant bien réussi à mener leurs activités, les membres du groupement TOCOSSONE 2 de l'écovillage keur Goumak reviennent auprès de Kiva solliciter un renouvellement de prêt. Avec ce prêt, elles vont pouvoir redynamiser leurs activités de :
- transformation des fruits (mangue, papaye, orange, banane) et légumes (carotte, choux, navet) 
- transformation de l'huile,
- transformation de céréales locales
texts.en:
Having acquired a great deal of experience in processing local products with the help of their first Kiva loan, and especially having successfully managed their small businesses, the members of the TOCOSSONE 2 group of the Keur Goumak ecovillage are returning to Kiva to request a renewal of their loan. With this loan they will be able to dynamize their businesses in: processing fruit (mangoes, papayas, oranges, and bananas) and vegetables (carrots, cabbages and turnips); processing oil; and processing local cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for processing fruit, vegetables, and cereals

loans.name: Mr. Choeun Kev Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of twenty-four members, is located in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province. Each bank member plans to use their share of the loan for different purposes. 

Mr. Choeun K., the village bank president, was selected by the members. He is a laborer who earns a small income that supports his family. His wife, Mrs. Mao Yath, is a pig breeder. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. 

Thus, Mr. Choeun K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for his wife's breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions by selling the pigs that they buy with the loan. He is 41 years old and the father of three children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for his wife's pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is powerful figure in her Bank of Hope. She operates a successful used-clothing business that gives her community access to clothing. She and her son live in a "batey" (sugarcane community) outsiD. of San Pedro D. Macoris. She would use this loan for a cement floor. Cement floors promote hygiene and health, and they are durable.  Please help the Esperanza Home Improvement Department make her dream come true. Thank you!

loans.use: A new cement floor

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch U. is a widow who lives in Tei Muoy village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a dry fish seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more dry fish to resell. She is 58 years old and she has a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish to resell.

loans.name: Fuailelagi

texts.en:
Fuailelagi A., 55, is married with seven children. She has three years of experience in the plantation and fishing businesses. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week.

She has had two previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (about $416).

SPBD loans are Fuailelagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a new fishing canoe, fishing gear and chemicals for the plantation.

loans.use: To buy a new canoe, fishing gear, goggles and chemicals

loans.name: Yoeung

texts.en:
Yoeung S., 43, is currently living in a medium-sized wooden house with six occupants. She has given birth to four children who are single and still live in the family home. Two of them are employed: one is a garment worker and the other is a local building worker. S. now cultivates a rice crop on her own farmland, which she can plant twice a year. Her husband works as a construction foreman.

S.'s house is too old so her family's living arrangements are not comfortable. Therefore, she would like to request a $700 loan in order to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Tatu J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Tatu M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 20. Tatu has been running a batiki business since 1990. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called batik. Batik is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed in traditional ways with various colors and symbols of native African people.

Tatu works at her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Tatu currently earns about 160USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 975USD in order to purchase more materials in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Tatu thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more materials in bulk for making clothing

loans.name: Olarinwaju

texts.en: Olarinwaju is a mother of six and she is 53 years old and married to O.. She sells kitchen utensils and gift items. Olarinwaju hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric D. S. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, married, and has two infants. Ric is starting a business providing barber services to local community members. He is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ric joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve his business. This loan will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 


About GDMPC:
Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Jumanne M., age 65, is married with three children, ages 28, 24, and 21. He has a "Genge" (Kiswahili for a stand selling fruits and vegetables) business which he started six years ago. He works daily from 5 am until 7:30 pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 105.

This will be Jumanne’s 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to expand the business by buying more fruits and vegetables; he paid school fees and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a new loan to further increase his stock in the "genge".

Jumanne will share this loan with his loan group, Mapinduzi, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Jumanne is the 1st on the right in the blue shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Elba Jeannette

texts.es: Elba Jeannette R. D. de 29 años vive junto a su esposo y su único hijo en Lourdes Colón. Ella posee una tienda, de la cual obtiene la mayoría de dinero para solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual tenga el poder adquisitivo para surtir su negocio con más bebidas, pan, Golosinas, entre otros productos más considerados de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Elba Jeannette R. D. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in Lourdes Colón. She owns a store, which provides the majority of income to pay for her family's expenses. She has requested a loan so that she can purchase more drinks, bread, sweets, and other products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
H. Vũ Thị (426990794) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three school-aged children. H. operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling liquor such as beer and wine in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fifth taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza del Socorro F. tiene la edad de 55 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora. Maritza se levanta muy temprano ya que tiene que buscar sus productos en diferentes departamentos porque es la única manera en la que encuentra de una manera mucho más favorable. Ella tiene muchos clientes y todos  la buscan porque ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosmético y calzado. El sueño de Maritza es poseer una librería en su vivienda con todas mercadería necesaria.
texts.en:
Maritza del Socorro F. is 55 years old and has 3 children. She is dedicated to the sale of general merchandise. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. She has always been a very responsible and hardworking woman. Maritza gets up very early to go to different areas to find the products that she sells since it is the only way to get better prices.

She has many customers and they look for her since she offers them in the street. She is asking for a loan that will be used as working capital for the purchase of clothing, cosmetics and footwear. Maritza´s dream is to start a bookstore business at her house with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Danielle

texts.en:
K. Danielle was born in Porto-Novo. On the edge of town, a short walk from her home, she runs a small stand, where she sells food, candy, drinks, and cell phone cards. She also has a telephone, which she lets her customers use for a fee. During the school year, Danielle sells her products to students at different schools in Porto-Novo.

Business is going well, but could be better. Danielle would like a loan in order to restock her inventory in order to increase her sales. Specifically, she will buy rice, cell phone cards, and peanut oil.

Danielle is married and has four children. Her husband works for an electricity company in Porto-Novo. Her oldest child is 16 and her youngest is seven months.

loans.use: To buy more rice, peanut oil, and cell phone cards

loans.name: Agnes Kerubo

texts.en:
Agnes has been in the rental housing business for five years. Agnes's business is in a slum area, serving low income earners who reside in the slum. She intends to use her loan to renovate the floors of her rental houses. With the extra profit generated as a result of the loan, she plans to build more rental houses. 

Agnes is 41 years old and married to 42-year-old Peter Mbaruka. Peter works for a security firm. They have three children called Faith Mora (22 years old), Damaris Mwende (17 years old) and Viona Mumbua (5 years old).

Agnes was introduced to KADET by current members, and she has no loans from other MFIs. Agnes states she is trustworthy and her hopes and dreams are to own several rental houses.

ABOUT KADET
KADET Ltd. is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to rural communities through the microfinance model. KADET is the only MFI in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities served. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, KADET has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on KADET from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To renovate the floors of rental houses

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P. is 55 years of age and she and her husband of 30 years are blessed with one child.

Fe is a rice farmer in need of financial assistance. It is her first time joining a microfinance institution like CEVI. She hopes to have a good partnership with CEVI.

Fe applied for a loan of Php 6,000, which will be used to pay for farm inputs. Aside from the financial service she obtained, Fe will be able to save because of CEVI’s low interest rate.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Idrissa Dembélé est âgé de 29 ans et vit avec ses 2 enfants et sa femme  dans la  quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des  chaussures, pendant plus de 8 ans, au marché de Bougouni et cela  sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’apprendre la vente d’articles divers de  boutique auprès de son beau-frère.  Il exerce cette activité il y a environ 5 années  et la maitrise parfaitement de nos jours.
Pour le renforcement de son commerce, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son  premier prêt  individuel pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique.  
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni auprès des grossistes et revend en détail au comptant et à crédit à  une   clientèle  composée de toute la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui servira à  agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Idrissa Dembélé is 29 years old and lives with his two children and wife in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended a modern school, he quickly began earning an income, notably through commerce in shoes eight years ago at the Bougouni market. But this was unsuccessful. And so he decided to learn about selling various store items with his brother-in-law. He has been in this business for five years and has now mastered it. To bolster his business, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan, which he will use to buy various goods for his shop. He stocks up in Bougouni from wholesale merchants and sells the goods retail, cash or credit accepted. His customers are made up of the entire local population. With this loan, he plans on realizing a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will serve to expand his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for his store

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela P. is from the village of Greenhills Suarez , Iligan  City. She is 43 years old. Angela is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Angela raises livestock (primarily pigs) for sale.  Angela has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately PHP 4000  a month.

In 2009, Angela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services.  She is requesting a loan of PHP5000 to purchase piglets and other young livestock to raise for future sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angela from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a livestock business

loans.name: Virgen Estrella De Oropesa Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Virgen Estrella D. Oropesa, are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 14 members in Oropesa, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. All the group members live in Oropesa.  There is only one man in the group but he feels right at home with these strong hard-working ladies.  They all have a great sense of humor.

The president of the group, Tania Gladys, was born in in Quillabamba and is 53 years old and lives in Oropesa.  She is married and lives with her spouse and 2 children.  She has been selling bread for the last 9 years.  She will use this loan to buy more supplies for her bakery - flour, butter, sugar, etc. 

Most of the members are involved in making a special type of bread called “chuta”. Oropesa is the bread-making capital of the Cusco area.  Walking down the streets, the smell of bread permeates the air.  With this loan, most of the group members will grow their panaderías, or bakeries, buying flour, sugar, and butter to make and sell more bread.  

Some of the members also make chicha (a Peruivan drink maD. from corn) and will use the loan to buy more corn.  Some raise cuy (guinea pigs) and will use the loan for food and medicines for their animals.

All of the members appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(EDY MARLENY is not pictured in the photo)

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur EDY MARLENY from  Peru

loans.use: Breadmaking supplies

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nary H. is a group leader of four members who all live in the Kshach village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables. Now she does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds. Thus, she is asking for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Chuong Oun, is a construction worker. This couple has four children who attend the local school.

loans.use: Buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Mrs. Crispina M. is married, 50 years old, and has two adult-aged children. She is a resident of Dulapo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman but his income is not enough to sustain the needs of her family so she decided to make her own income by buying, cultivating and selling flowers.

In 2005, Crispina joined Paglaum MPC because of their programs and services and is now applying for a loan of Php 10,000 as additional capital to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, pots, and other things needed for her business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticides, pots, and other things needed in cultivating flowers

loans.name: Bak's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Bak T. is a group leader of six who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Nis Ny, helps her on the farm. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income.  Mrs. Bak T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse for her husband to transport goods and passengers for an income. Mrs. Bak T. is a mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a horse for her husband to transport goods and passengers for an income.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma L. is from the village of Bangko, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan city. She is 43 years old. Erlinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business of making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging n business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic V. is from the village of Banquero. She is 23 years old. Marivic is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting variety of vegetables for sale. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products she offers.. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Parda

texts.ru: Одинаев Парда проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Родители и брат живут вместе с ними. Сам Парда занимается торгвлей. У него магазин, где он продает корма животных. В этой деятельности более 4 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. На полученный доход хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Parda O. lives in the Yavan region. He is 38 years old; married with 2 children. His wife is a housewife. His parents and brother live with him. Parda is in the sales business. He owns a store, in which he sells fodder. He has been in this business for over 4 years. He is requesting the loan to increase the volume of sales. With the profits he wants to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase volume of trade

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Sory, 36, lives in El Seybo, Dominican Republic. She has a perfect repayment record on past loans, and her story is typical of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Sory lives with her husband and four children in El Seybo, a small rural town in the heart of the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be tough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare among other issues. Despite these difficulties, Sory has a successful small business selling clothing to people in her community. With this loan, she will buy underwear, women’s pants, and bedsheets to sell at a small markup.

This is Sory’s eighth loan with Esperanza International. In less than three years, she has been able to increase her loan size by nearly ten times, a true testament to her hard work. With continued profits, Sory hopes to keep the growth of her business going and finish the construction of her home in order to give her family a more comfortable place to live (a common construction technique in the Dominican Republic is to build in stages as one acquires the money to do so). In addition, her profits have given Sory confidence that her children will grow up with a good education and have the opportunity to pursue any profession they desire, a luxury Sory did not have while growing up.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, and that restore self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for your willingness to consider helping Sory!

loans.use: to buy pants, undergarments, and sheets to sell to her customers

loans.name: Santos Sabina

texts.es: Santos Sabina, es de 49 años de edad, se dedica a la confección y venta de roba para dama, tiene 5 hijos 2 barones y 3 mujeres quienes le ayudan en atender el negocio, en ASDIR es el primer crédito que solicita, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y participativa en su comunidad, el crédito lo invierta en la compara de materiales para confeccionar sus productos.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old and makes and sells ladies clothing. She has five children, two gentlemen, and three ladies who help her run the business. This will be her first loan through ASDIR. Her personal references tell us that she is a very responsible person who contributes to her community. She will use the money from this loan to invest in materials and supplies that she needs to make her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and Supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 33 years old and married with two children who go to school. She sells used clothes in Kitengela market in Nairobi to earn a living. She was previously employed but needed more money and so started her own business. Catherine is a hard-working lady who does her household chores at the same time as running the business. She has been saving part of her profits with her group in Faulu Kenya, called Mlachake, which guarantees loans to its members. She has requested a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of used clothes for sale and hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To add to stock of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón C. P., tiene la edad de 60 años, está en unión libre, y vive con la señora y sus cuatro  hijos de 26,24,14 y 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en su pulpería. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ramón C. P., age 60, is in a common law marriage and lives with his wife and their four children, ages 26, 24, 14, and 12. The loan that he seeks is for the purchase of inventory for his business. He wants to have a larger and more varied inventory to offer in his small grocery shop.

He began this business several years ago and has very good customers. That’s why he sees a need to offer a greater variety of products in the business. In addition, this will bring greater earnings for his household.

This is the first time that he has sought a loan from FUDECOSUR, and he is very grateful for the assistance he has been offered. For the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to continue improving as a person and as a businessman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory for a grocery store.

loans.name: Santos Silvia

texts.es:
Santos tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus hijas y a sus nietos en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de prendas de vestir de primera mano y usadas en un pequeño puesto cercano al mercado de la ciudad, ella compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Trujillo y la ofrece a sus clientes durante todo el dia, también realiza ventas por pedidos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en   el sostenimiento de su familia y en solventar sus gastos personales.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería de modo que pueda captar mas clientes y pericbir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una madre bastante luchadora y que siempre ha dado todo de si para sacar a sus hijas adelante, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener una tienda de ropa mas grande. En la zona donde vive ella es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, los que la consideran una mujer alegre y colaboradora.
texts.en:
Santos is 42 years-old, separated, and lives together with his daughters and his grandchildren in the district of Chepén, belonging to the province of the same name, located in the La Libertad region, and hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For a year he has been selling articles of clothing, both new and used, in a little stall near the city market. She buys her merchandise in the city of Trujillo and offers it to her clients all day long. She also sells by order. The income she makes she uses in caring for her family and paying her personal expenses. Santos would like to grow her business by purchasing more merchandise “de modo” (currently “in”, “fashionable”), which would earn her more clients and profits. In order to achieve this goal, she has asked for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1000 nuevo soles. Santos is a very hardworking mother, and she has always given everything to provide for her children. Her greatest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to have a larger clothing store. In her neighborhood she is very well known and admired by her neighbors, who consider her a very happy and helpful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new and used clothing to grow her business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha S. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Angk village, Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Meng Kong, earns a small income as a cow middleman to support his family. To maintain her farming crops, Mrs. Sokha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. This couple has four children; two are students in the local school while the other two are too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For her home and personal family expenses (sickness)

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who live in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. They will each use their portion of the loan in different ways to improve their businesses. 


Mrs. Phally T. is the group leader, selected by the other members. She owns a general store at the local village where she can earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. Mrs. Phally T. is, therefore, asking for a loan to buy more groceries for resale. 


She is a widow with four children: one of them is a security guard, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has a child who is not in school. Florence has owned a beauty salon for one year. To help expand her business, Florence is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, a Kiva partner. The loan will be used to buy more materials for the beauty salon. Florence hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to expand her business. In the future, Florence hopes to pay school fees for her child and help her family. About BRAC Uganda: This loan is administered by BRAC Uganda, a registered non-governmental organization (NGO) in Uganda that is also a part of the BRAC international network. BRAC Uganda attempts to address poverty through a holistic model, offering programs in education, health, water and sanitation, agriculture, and microfinance. BRAC Uganda’s microfinance program aims to provide the poor with easy, reliable and efficient access to institutional financial services, and reaches over 150,000 families in Uganda. For more on BRAC Uganda, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/65, and join our lending team, Friends of BRAC Uganda, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_brac_uganda

loans.use: To add more materials for the beauty salon

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MANKO est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Aïssata D. à droite de la photo portant des lunettes de soleil est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un commerce de draps de lit, de rideaux, d’arachides et de bracelets pour enfants. 

Son prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin d’accroître ses bénéfices

Elle a comme objectif de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group MANKO came into being six months ago. It is made up of 11 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They also all belong to the same "Banc Villageois" SANTHIABA COKI2. Mrs. Aïssatou D., on the right in the photo, wearing sunglasses, is the group leader. She is 56, married and the mother of one child. She is also raising two other children who were confided to her care by relatives. She sells sheets, curtains, peanuts (groundnuts) and bracelets for children. Her loan will allow her to bolster her stock so that she can make more profit. Her goal is to help her husband with the expenses of supporting their family and at the same time, put aside more savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Further develop and advertize her business

loans.name: 1 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Cascada  es uno de los doce centros focales que se encuentran en la ciudad de El Alto. Al mismo ha ingresado la asociación comunal de “1 de Marzo”, este grupo consta de ocho socias y está iniciando su segundo ciclo a la cabeza se encuentra la señora Lucy como presidenta.

La  señora Lucy refiere que es su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución.  Su negocio es el macramé, su crédito inicial fue de Bs.500.- y le sirvió para la compra de flecos para las mantas, actualmente está haciendo una solicitud de Bs.300.- con el mismo objetivo. Este trabajo le permite cuidar su hogar, pues lo realiza en su mismo domicilio y la venta es segura, por que sólo trabaja a pedido de sus clientes.  Con respecto a los servicios de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta el Consultorio de Salud y su capacitación, por el trato del personal.

La base de la A.C. “1 de Marzo” también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, tejido de mantas y gorras, venta de chinelas, artesanía Tejido de Alpaca, trenzado de mantas, venta de mantas.
texts.en:
The Cascada Focal Center is one of the 12 focal centers in the city of El Alto. The “1 de Marzo” communal bank has joined it. This group has 8 members and is starting its 2nd cycle led by group president, Lucy. Lucy tells us that this is her 2nd cycle in our institution. Her business is macramé. Her initial loan was for Bs.500 and she used it to buy fringes for the blankets. She is currently requesting Bs.300 for the same purpose. This work allows her to care for her home because she does it there and the sales are a sure thing because she only works based on prior orders from her customers. With respect to Pro Mujer services, she states that she likes the Health Center and the training because of the personal attention. Other “1 de Marzo” communal bank members have their own businesses. Among them are: sweater knitting, blanket weaving, blanket and cap weaving, slipper sales, handicrafts, Alpaca woolens, blanket braiding, blanket sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fringe.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es:
El señor Filemón H. M. tiene 34 años convive con la Señora Simona Flores Villarroel más de  12 años, tienen 2 hijos menores dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, en la escuela rural de la comunidad, la actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, oca, haba en el terreno que tiene 2 hectáreas sector Cotani Bajo Sector Churo, son una familia humilde de pocos recursos pero muy trabajadores, están a 45 km de la ciudad de Cbba para ellos  acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil.  

El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. Donde Don Filemón H. M. necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico, semilla de papa para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola, Filemón nos comenta que la producción agrícola ha sido poco por factores climáticos como la sequia, si este año no siembra no tendría alimentación ni dinero tampoco ahorro para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Filemón H. M., 34, has lived together with Mrs. Simona Flores Villarroel for over 12 years. They have two minor, dependent children who are in primary school at the rural school in the community. His main activity is potato, oca (an Andean tuber) and lima bean farming on a 2 hectare field in Cotani Bajo, Sector Churo. They are a humble family of few resources but are very hard working. They are located 45 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba and it is very difficult for them to come to the banks to request loans. CIDRE took the initiative to go to this rural zone where Mr. Filemón H. M. needed money to buy organic manure and potato seed for the next planting season. Filemón mentioned to us that production has been poor due to climactic factors, mainly the drought. If he doesn’t plant this year he won’t have food or money to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es: Carlota del Carmen se dedica es la venta de refrescos. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues ha sido de gran ayuda. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio es en las afueras de un dispensario, en donde las enfermeras, doctores, pacientes entre otras personas. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ha sido muy importante ya que es el trabajo que realiza todos los días para mantener a su familia. Este crédito lo realiza para comprar gaseosas, hielo, bolsas plásticas, jugos y frutas.
texts.en:
Carlota del Carmen sells refreshments. She has collaborated with the Foundation for a long time because it’s been a big help. Her business is located outside a dispensary where the nurses, doctors and patients, among others are her customers. She has been in business for over 8 years because it’s been very important in that it is the work she does daily to support her family. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks, ice, plastic bags, juices and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, ice, plastic bags, juices and fruit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 31-year-old woman, married with four children aged 12, 8, 6, and 1. She cares for her family and lives in her own permanent house. Her family goal is to educate her children. Her home address is Masindi, Uganda. 

She is into the poultry business and has been doing it for two years now. She started with a few chicks but now has many and the challenge she faces is that chicken feed is expensive. In future she wishes to expand her business to supply both broilers and layers. She needs the loan to buy more chicks.

loans.use: Buy more chicks for her poultry business

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Nurgul K., the leader of the group, is 55, married, and has three children. Her daughter is married and both of her sons work as loaders in a private organization. The main family income is derived from cattle breeding and milk selling, earnings from which have made possible the building of a house and the purchase of a car. Nurgul will use the loan to purchase a cow, and in the future she wants to arrange a son’s wedding and open a shop.

Munar B., a 59-year-old widow with five children, earns money by cattle breeding and milk selling. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase a washing-machine.

Maksat N., 37, is married and has three sons. He will use his part of the loan to obtain a cow for breeding.

Gulbubu J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 56, married, and has six children. The family earns its livelihood by cattle breeding, milk selling and farming. The loan's purpose is to buy milk cows.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa S. is a 67-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating  threembusiness ventures:  Piggery, Rice Grinding and Furniture Sales businesses.She lives in Humayan, Brgy. Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 7 years now and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Piggery, Rice Grinding and Furniture Sales businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,500. Ninfa is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she  can  fund her business operations.   This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Ninfa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operation of her piggery

loans.name: Shu's Group

texts.en:
The group for this loan consists of four people. They are located in Preaek Ta Pov village, Kandal province.  This group selected Mrs. Shu M., a 30 year old, married woman, as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Shu M. earns her living by selling fish in the market. Since her fish selling is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to help expand her business. Her husband, Mr. Thab Saly, is 32 years old and works as a construction worker. With their businesses, they are able to earn some income to support their three children. Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy more fish to expand the business

loans.name: Ashignov

texts.en: Ashignov N. is 61-year-old single parent with one adult daughter. He and his daughter live together in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Hovd Province in Western Mongolia. His only daughter, age 19, attends university. Ashignov operates a coal-selling business in his town.  He purchases coal directly from local mines and uses his large Russian truck to transport it back to his town. Since 1985, he has been driving a big truck and has gained a lot of experience as a driver. He hopes to purchase a larger truck in the future. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to make necessary repairs to his truck to transport more coal.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his truck

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 33 years-old and is married with three children aged between four and 17 years-old.  He also takes care of one orphan who is 14 years-old. Denis has eight years experience selling seeds for Irish potatoes. He employs four people and his business is open from 7am until 4pm every day except on Saturday. 

Denis has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company to purchase more equipment and other stock.  He would like to own a small shop one day if he can make enough profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for a farm seedling business.

loans.name: Adrian Bladimir

texts.es:
Adrian Bladimir S. S. tiene 21 años y vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Adrian Bladimir es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Adrian Bladimir tiene un soda bar. El abrió su negocio hace 3 años. El compra sus productos en Matilde Esther. Con este crédito Adrian Bladimir desea ampliar su negocio de soda bar y poner comidas rápidas. El crédito le ayudara a mejorar el servicio. 

Su meta para el futuro es tener una casa propia y un negocio propio ya que ahora vive arrendando. Los desafíos que el enfrenta en su negocio son algunos problemas económicos y la bajada de ventas en invierno. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar indoor y descansar. También disfruta la fiesta del pueblo cada 8 de diciembre.
texts.en:
Adrian Bladimir S. S. is 21 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Adrian Bladimir is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new loan group is located in Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office, in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in a number of different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Adrian Bladimir has a soda bar.  He opened his business 3 years ago.  He buys his products in Matilde Esther.  Adrian Bladimir will use this loan to expand his business and to start serving fast food.  The loan will help him to improve his service.  His goal for the future is to own his own home and business as he is currently renting.  The challenges that he faces in his business are financial problems and the fall in sales over the winter.  In his spare time he likes to play indoor soccer and relax.  He also enjoys celebrating the local fiesta every 8th of December.

loans.use: To support his soda bar business and to start selling fast food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has six children. To make a living, Virginia grows crops. The main source of income for the business comes from rice farming rice. Virginia and her husband are also involved in fishing. She sells her husband's catch to their community.

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to buy farming supplies and fishing gear. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fishing gear

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, de 35 años, vive al lado de su esposa Dora (35) y de sus tres hijos menores de edad, juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante. 

Desde hace un año este trabajador hombre instaló en una pieza de su vivienda un pequeño negocio de venta de suministros para construcción (como tubos, pegamentos, herramientas de acero, entre otros), en esta ferretería trabaja al lado de su familia, pues cuando él no puede atender le ayudan sus hijos o su esposa. Dice que obtiene regulares ganancias que invierte en surtir mejor su negocio y le brinda una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Además paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su auto propio en una ruta cercana a su zona. Esta muy satisfecho pues tiene buenas ganancias lo que le permite pagar una buena escuela a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio de venta de suministros para el hogar pues por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia. 

Efraín tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de artículos que necesita para surtir mejor su ferretería, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y así seguir progresando. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Efrain is 35 years old and lives with his wife Dora, age 35, and their three young children. Each day they strive to get ahead.

A year ago, this hardworking gentleman set up a small business on his property where he sells construction supplies (such as tubes, adhesives, steel tools, and other items). His family works with him. His children and wife manage their hardware store whenever he is not present. Efrain says that he is able to generate steady income by keeping his business well-stocked. This allows him to provide his family with a good quality of life. In addition, he provides transportation services by driving his own car along a route near his district. He is very satisfied because his income enables him to pay for his children to attend a good school. In the future, he wants to expand his home improvement store because there is no other competition in the district.

Efrain plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of items needed to restock his hardware store. He hopes to improve his profits so that he can continue progressing.

This is his first loan with MFP. Efrain promises to complete his payments on time because he does not want to look bad in the eyes of those responsible for making this loan possible so that he could continue working and moving forward.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to sell in his hardware store

loans.name: Kamene Katuu

texts.en:
Kamene Katuu is 48 years old and married to Nicholas Kimanji. She supports eight members of her family. She sells fruits and vegetables as a primary business, and at the same time she practices crop farming. She has been operating these two businesses for a period of two years with an income of about $150 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD, and she intends to use it to buy a variety of vegetable seedlings for planting and ready bananas to sell. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetable seedlings and ready bananas, cabbages and fruits to sell

loans.name: Kanoni Tweyambe Group A-Kihihi

texts.en:
Twenty-eight year old Annet A. is a tea farmer who operates from Kayonza in Kihihi district, Uganda. Annet, like many other enterprising young women in Uganda, has been striving to be an exception to the stereotype that women cannot be in charge of their destinies.

Annet, who is happily married with 6 kids, has been engaged in overseeing a tea production and sales business for the last 7 years. Through the course of these years, she has been making her own decisions on how to run her business without any help. Tea is among the highest selling cash crops in Uganda, and Annet says she has never regretted the decision she took to begin this business. At her farm, she does not just grow tea but also bananas that she also sells after harvesting.

Monthly, she says this business generates her shillings 260,000, and she says with this loan she is going to purchase fertilizers and manure to improve her yields and the fertility of her tea farm. Annet belongs to Kanoni Tweyambe group-Kihihi.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure to improve production and fertility of her tea farming gardens.

loans.name: Sairanbi

texts.en:
K. Sairanbi lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is widow and has two clever daughters, one of them works at home taking care of her family. Sairanbi sells woman’s shoes in the market of Pandjer in Dushanbe region. She started her business with her own capital and has been in this business for 7 years.  

Sairanbi would like to get a loan of 11500 Somoni to stock up on new fashionable shoes and expand her business.  She thanks all lenders who support her and her family, which allows her and her family to live better. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to stock new shoes for her store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Irene has been engaged in her business for more than 7 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Irene is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Irene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn is 29 years old and is married. She has two children aged five and three. Her husband works as a farmer.
Annelyn is engaged in farming. She has been assisting her husband in growing rice and corn for five years. They earn 5,000 PHP from farming. Annelyn also manages a sari-sari store. She sells items such as canned goods and noodles. She plans to use her loan to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell at her store. In the future, Annelyn hopes to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, a 37-year-old married father of two children, has run a cafeteria for almost four years to earn a living.  He employs three people to assist him in the business. Joshua also operates a retail shop and a tailoring business to supplement his income, and he previously also sold milk.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joshua has improved both his business and his living standards and is now requesting a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy beans, sugar, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat to stock in his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Bayansaikhan

texts.en:
Bayansaikhan is a 40-year-old widow and lives with her two sons and two daughters, aged between 1 and 21. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in an apartment. Bayansaikhan's oldest son works as a dancer in the countryside while her youngest son and oldest daughter attend public school. Bayansaikhan’s mother is retired and cares for Bayansaikhan’s youngest daughter. 

Bayansaikhan supports her children by operating two retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2000, she sold TV antennas at her one stall. Today she sells TV antennas and telecontrols at her two retail stalls and she has 3’000’000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She said: “I want to support my children's education and their lives by working hard”. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more TV antennas and telecontrols from Ereen, the border city of China, so that she can sell more to her customers during this very busy shopping season.

loans.use: to purchase more TV antennas and telecontrols

loans.name: Oulara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
