Madame Henriette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de citron et de savon en poudre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital afin de faire la promotion de son activité.

Les profits lui permettront de participer à l’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 7, 2011.  It is made up of ten women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their primary business is petty trading.  Madam Henriette, who is at the right of the photograph, raising her hand, is the group leader.  She is 36 years old.  She is a widow and the mother of three children.  She sells lemons and powdered soap.  She has much valuable experience in the business, having practiced it for many years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital in order to promote her business.  The profits will allow her to participate in the improvement of her family's quality of life (health, nutrition, clothing, etc...).

loans.use: to buy lemons and powdered soap.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a sanitary officer. She trades in soft drinks as well as fries fish for sale (as seen in the picture above).  She has done this in Abura for 2 years. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the education of her children. Esi will use the loan to purchase additional fish to fry to meet the demands of her customers. As part of her future plans, she hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is an aggressive 25-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been running a cosmetics shop since 2002. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for making funds available to her. This has helped her to boost her business. In the next five years, she wants to have opened several business outlets. Her dream is to gain a wider market for her products.
Joan wants a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy cosmetics products and repaint her business premises.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and repaint her business premises.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; la socia tiene 35 años; la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 18, 17 y 8 años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende leche fresca, también queso que son los derivados de sus vacas lecheras, la socia tiene vacas lecheras y toros, ella cría las vacas las engorda y vende, al igual que vende los derivados de estas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 1 vaca ternera y 1 toro tierno para aumentar el número de sus ganados vacunos.

 La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the "Mujeres en Acción" community bank which is located in Compone district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Lucila is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged 18, 17 and 8.  Her business is selling products retail.  She sells fresh milk and also cheese from her dairy cows.  She keeps dairy cows and bulls.  Lucila raises the cows, fattens them and sells them.  She also sells the dairy products she gets from them.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying 1 young cow and 1 young bull to increase the number of cattle she has.

Lucila is very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy 1 calf (cow) and 1 calf (bull) to increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Manuel vive en la ciudad de Managua.
El señor carlosr  visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito ya que piensa hacerles  mejoras a su vivienda.
La inversión que el  señor  va hacer es la compra de y cemento, piedra, arena, hierro, las mejoras que el señor va hacer es un cuarto de habitación .
 agradece mucho a ceprodel por que gracias al financiamiento va poder mejorar su vivienda y así también sus condiciones de vida para ella y su familia
texts.en:
Señor Carlos Manuel lives in the city of Managua.

Señor Carlos visited our office to request a loan because he intends to make improvements to his home.

The investment that the Señor will make is in buying cement, stone, sand, and iron.  The home improvement that the Señor will make is a bedroom.

He is very grateful to Ceprodel as thanks to the funding, he will be able to improve his home and in this way also improve his living conditions, and those of his family.

loans.use: to make home improvements and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bitcherose

texts.en:
Bitcherose is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Bitcherose has a bakeshop where she sells breads, biscuits, pastries & cakes. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

Bitcherose is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bitcherose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is very active and talented lady who performs her household duties very well. She also operates a clothes-sewing and boutique business to support her husband financially. She displays her dresses in her boutique which helps her attract more customers towards her work. 

She is the mother of six children; the first three work while her three younger children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He also operate a video shop through which he sells movies and DVDs. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her own business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine and some clothes that will allow her to make more dresses to display for selling and earn better profits. 

She is very confident that her business will go in a positive direction after making an investment into it. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shahida ".

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and clothes for sewing & boutique business

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy stays at home and does housework. Her husband is a pedicab driver. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two daughters; one is a garment worker, and the other stays at home.

The main source of income is from her daughter’s salary. She is asking for another loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Leonarda Migdalia

texts.es: Leonarda Migdalia tiene 41 años, ella se encuentra muy contenta con su medio de vida, pues le ha ayudado mucho para sacar a su familia adelante uno de sus mayores desafíos es que no puede comprar todos los productos que sus clientes le solicitan pues debido a que los precios de las utilidades varían. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar variedad en sus productos como es perfumes, cremas, ropa en general, sabanas, manteles, prendas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Leonarda Migdalia is 41 years old. She is very happy with her business, as it has helped her to provide for her family's future. 

One of her biggest challenges is that she is unable to buy all the products requested by her customers because the prices vary.

That's why she is requesting this loan to buy an assortment of products, such as perfumes, creams, sheets, tablecloths and clothing.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products, such as perfumes, creams, sheets, tablecloths and clothing.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Libertad en Progreso, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió y propicio para la cría de ganado por sus amplias llanuras, su gente es muy amable, cálida y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 17, 14, 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y también  estudia en un colegio a distancia, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su tercer hijo está en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo labora en cualquier trabajo que le salga al día como albañil, pintor etc., no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

La Señora. María se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa cría y vende  pollos, cuyes, vacas y borregos. También labora en la agricultura y lo que le produce es  solo para el consumo de su hogar. Como pasa en casa la mayor parte del tiempo se dedica a bordar, esta actividad  aprendió trabajando. 

Se encuentra en su octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas para el bordado y en alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio de venta de polleras (faldas).
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Libertad en Progreso” communal bank.  She lives in a community belonging to Victoria del Portete (Cuenca) Parish.  This is a cold climate place apt for raising livestock on its wide plains.  Its residents are kind, warm and keep the customs and traditions of their peoples.

María is 35 years old and has four children who are 17, 14, 5 and 3 years of age.  Her oldest son works and helps out economically while also studying at a distance high school.  Her second son is in secondary school and her third son is in Kindergarten.  Her husband works at whatever job comes up as a bricklayer, painter, etc.  She does not own a house but lives in a family member’s house.

She cares for her children and since she stays home she raises chickens, guinea pigs, cows and sheep to sell.  She also farms but what she grows is only for home consumption.  Since she spends most of her time at home she also embroiders, a skill she learned working.

She’s in her 8th loan with the communal bank and the new one will be invested in the purchase of fabric to embroider and to buy animal feed.  Her goal is to have a business selling ‘polleras’ (skirts).

loans.use: to buy fabric and animal feed.
